original: gang zhig bya bar 'dod pa de ni 'dod pa'i rang bzhin grub pa las bya ba tha dad pa nyid du mthong na rtsom par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig bya bar 'dod pa de ni 'dod pa'i rang bzhin grub pa las bya ba tha dad pa nyid du mthong na rtsom par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If one sees that the action is different from the nature of the desire, then one undertakes the action.

original: 'dod pa'i rang bzhin nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rang bzhin nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not with respect to the nature of the desire itself.

original: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba nyid dam rnam pa gzhan nyid du nges par ston pa la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba nyid dam rnam pa gzhan nyid du nges par ston pa la ni /
translated: Therefore, in the case of the demonstration of something as being either expressible or otherwise,

original: nges par ston pa po las tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par ston pa po las tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
translated: it is pervaded by the appearance as different from the demonstrator.

original: gzung ba'i char gnas par bdag nyid ni rang rig pa las tha dad par bya ba nyid du mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i char gnas par bdag nyid ni rang rig pa las tha dad par bya ba nyid du mi snang ngo //
translated: The self that exists as the part of the object does not appear as different from the self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyid du dgod pa'i khyab par byed pa tha dad par snang ba dang 'gal ba tha dad pa med par snang ba ni bdag la yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyid du dgod pa'i khyab par byed pa tha dad par snang ba dang 'gal ba tha dad pa med par snang ba ni bdag la yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the pervader of the expressibility, the appearance as different, is incompatible with the appearance as non-different, which is present in me.

original: gang gi tshe yang bdag ni 'di lta bu'o zhes ba dag la so sor rtog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang bdag ni 'di lta bu'o zhes ba dag la so sor rtog pa de'i tshe /
translated: And when one thinks, ‚ÄúI am like this,‚Äù

original: so sor rtog par byed pa 'dzin pa po las bdag tha dad par gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba na so sor rtog par byed pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang brda byed pa ni 'di ni bum pa'o zhes gzung bar bya ba'i char gnas pa'i sgra dang tha mi ngad par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: so sor rtog par byed pa 'dzin pa po las bdag tha dad par gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba na so sor rtog par byed pa yin no // gzhan yang brda byed pa ni 'di ni bum pa'o zhes gzung bar bya ba'i char gnas pa'i sgra dang tha mi ngad par byed pa yin na /
translated: When the self appears as the object of apprehension, distinct from the apprehender, the self is being conceptualized.üîΩMoreover, the self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, which is the basis of the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù because the word-imputing consciousness is the basis of the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù and the self is not.üîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid ni gang sgra dang tha dad pa med par bya ba gzung bar bya ba'i chang gnas par snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid ni gang sgra dang tha dad pa med par bya ba gzung bar bya ba'i chang gnas par snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i sgra dang 'dres par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa kho na'o //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar gal te nges par sbyor ba po las tha dad pa snang ba las nges par sbyor ram /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i sgra dang 'dres par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa kho na'o //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar gal te nges par sbyor ba po las tha dad pa snang ba las nges par sbyor ram /
translated: The self is not the same as the word-imputing consciousness, because the self is not the basis of the word ‚Äúpot.‚ÄùüîΩThe self

original: ci ste yang gzung bar bya ba'i char gnas pa'i sgra dang gcig tu byed pa sgra nges par sbyor ba yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang gzung bar bya ba'i char gnas pa'i sgra dang gcig tu byed pa sgra nges par sbyor ba yin yang bla ste /
translated: But even if the sound that is the basis of the object of apprehension is the same as the sound that is the basis of the expression, it is still tenable.

original: nges par sbyor ba la ni thams cad du gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang bas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba la ni thams cad du gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang bas khyab pa yin no //
translated: For in the case of the expression, the object of apprehension is always perceived.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang la gzung ba'i cha nyid du snang ba ma yin pa de ni nges sgra dang sbyar nas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang la gzung ba'i cha nyid du snang ba ma yin pa de ni nges sgra dang sbyar nas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which does not appear as the basis of the object of apprehension is not apprehended in connection with the sound.

original: dper na ba lang gi shes pa la rta bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi shes pa la rta bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of a cow is not a horse.

original: de bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid kyang rig pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid kyang rig pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
translated: In the same way, one‚Äôs own nature does not appear as the object of apprehension. This is the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: @92b de'i phyir tha dad pa med par snang ba de'i bdag nyid la de ltar gzung bar bya ba'i cha nyid du brten nas 'jug pa ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: @92b de'i phyir tha dad pa med par snang ba de'i bdag nyid la de ltar gzung bar bya ba'i cha nyid du brten nas 'jug pa ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory for that which appears without distinction to be based on the object of apprehension in that way.

original: gzhan yang brda gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa ste de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang brda gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa ste de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if a sign does not have an object and subject, then it does not have an object and subject because it does not exist.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan 'di sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs gzhan 'di sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover means that this is another reason for the probandum, that is, for the statement, ‚ÄúIt does not exist.‚Äù

original: rig pa bdag nyid la brda sbyor na ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brdar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa bdag nyid la brda sbyor na ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brdar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one applies a sign to oneself, then it is a sign that does not have an object and subject.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni sngon ma mthong ste ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni sngon ma mthong ste ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that nature of pleasure, etc., which is its own nature, is not seen, that is, is not observed, prior to it.

original: / gal te rig pa yod pa las sngon rol du de'i rang bzhin mthong ba yin na ni de'i tshe brjod par gzo ba dang sgra dgod pa sngon nyid du byas par 'gyur na ma mthong na ni thams cad byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gal te rig pa yod pa las sngon rol du de'i rang bzhin mthong ba yin na ni de'i tshe brjod par gzo ba dang sgra dgod pa sngon nyid du byas par 'gyur na ma mthong na ni thams cad byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of that were seen prior to the existence of awareness, then at that time the one who is skilled in expression and the one who sets forth the sound would have been made prior to it. But if it is not seen, then all would not be made.

original: 'di snyam du'o na gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin mthong ba de'i tshe byed do snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du'o na gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin mthong ba de'i tshe byed do snyam na bshad pa /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhen its nature is seen, then it is expressed,‚Äù then it is said:

original: brjod pa ni smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExpression‚Äù is the sound that is uttered.

original: gzo ba ni mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzo ba ni mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be ready‚Äù is to be present.

original: de ltar gyur pa na brda dang 'brel par bya ba'i yul 'gags pa'i phyir dang / de dang tha dad pa med pas te khyad par med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rig pa yang 'gags pa ste log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na brda dang 'brel par bya ba'i yul 'gags pa'i phyir dang / de dang tha dad pa med pas te khyad par med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rig pa yang 'gags pa ste log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When that is the case, because the object that is related to the sign is stopped, and because it is not different from that, that is, because there is no distinction, the reason is stopped, that is, it is refuted.

original: don 'di yin te gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin mthong ba de nyid kyi tshe dus ma mnyam du brda grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don 'di yin te gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin mthong ba de nyid kyi tshe dus ma mnyam du brda grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: When its nature is seen, at that time the sign is not established as being simultaneous.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba las rjod par byed pa'i sgra gzo la phyis brda byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba las rjod par byed pa'i sgra gzo la phyis brda byed pa yin no //
translated: However, after seeing it, the sound that expresses it is ready, and then the sign is made.

original: de la ji srid yul mthong ba la brda gzo zhing byed par 'dod pa de srid du yul ldog ste skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ji srid yul mthong ba la brda gzo zhing byed par 'dod pa de srid du yul ldog ste skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, as long as the object is seen, the sign is ready and is desired to be made, for that long the object is stopped, because it is momentary.

original: de dang tha dad pa med pas yul can rig pa yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang tha dad pa med pas yul can rig pa yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not different from that, the consciousness that is the subject also is refuted.

original: des na brda'i dus na yul dang yul can dag med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brdar thal lo //
analyzed: des na brda'i dus na yul dang yul can dag med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i brdar thal lo //
translated: Therefore, at the time of the convention, since the object and subject do not exist, it follows that the convention is without apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang dang sgra gang 'god pa'i dus na zhig pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni brda byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang dang sgra gang 'god pa'i dus na zhig pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni brda byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who assert that the object and subject and the word exist at the time of the convention do not make the convention because they are destroyed.

original: dper na ba lang gi sgra 'god pa'i dus las sngar 'gags nas yun ring du long pa'i ba lang dang lha sbyin dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi sgra 'god pa'i dus las sngar 'gags nas yun ring du long pa'i ba lang dang lha sbyin dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like Devadatta and the cow that have long since ceased to exist prior to the time of uttering the word cow.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang rig pa dag kyang mthong ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'god pa'i dus na zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang rig pa dag kyang mthong ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'god pa'i dus na zhig pa yin no //
translated: Also, the nature of pleasure and so on and consciousness are destroyed at the time of uttering the word pleasure and so on.

original: @93a * // rang gi ngo bo mthong ba yod na sgra gzo ba yin la /
analyzed: @93a * // rang gi ngo bo mthong ba yod na sgra gzo ba yin la /
translated: If one sees its nature, one utters the word.

original: de yod na yang sgra 'god pa yin na rang gi ngo bo dang rig pa dag ni mthong ma thag pa nyid du zhig pa'i phyir phyis bya brda'i dus na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yang sgra 'god pa yin na rang gi ngo bo dang rig pa dag ni mthong ma thag pa nyid du zhig pa'i phyir phyis bya brda'i dus na med pa yin no //
translated: If it does exist, and if sound is uttered, then the intrinsic reality and awareness of the object have already ceased immediately upon being seen, and therefore do not exist at the time of the utterance of the word.

original: brda ni sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin la de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa dag gis khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: brda ni sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin la de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod pa dag gis khyab pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: The word is apprehended as a particular sound, and that is pervaded by the existence of the object and subject.

original: 'di snyam du zhig pa'i rang rig pas brda nges par sbyor ba ma yin du zin kyang sgra gzo ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis yul du byas pa la brda byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhig pa'i rang rig pas brda nges par sbyor ba ma yin du zin kyang sgra gzo ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis yul du byas pa la brda byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: One might think that even though the awareness of the object does not connect with the word, the word is applied to the object by a subsequent consciousness that arises after the sound is heard.

original: gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: To respond:

original: sgra gzo ba'i dus nyid na zhig pa'i don gang yin pa de sgra gzo ba'i 'og tu byung ba'i shes pas rig pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra gzo ba'i dus nyid na zhig pa'i don gang yin pa de sgra gzo ba'i 'og tu byung ba'i shes pas rig pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the consciousness that arises after the sound is heard cognize the object that has already ceased at the time the sound is heard?

original: rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul du byas pa 'di dag ni gzhan gyis kyang rjod par byed pa dang sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul du byas pa 'di dag ni gzhan gyis kyang rjod par byed pa dang sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not cognition, it is not an object of expression or application by another.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is another meaning:

original: 'di snyam du rig pas ni sgra 'god pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa gzhan gyis so zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rig pas ni sgra 'god pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa gzhan gyis so zhes dogs pa la /
translated: One might suspect that cognition does not express sound, but rather another consciousness does.

original: gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: To that, the root text says, ‚ÄúBy another, either.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: re zhig dus mnyam par 'byung ba gzhan gyis ni yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dus mnyam par 'byung ba gzhan gyis ni yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: First, another that arises simultaneously does not make it an object,

original: dus gcig pa dag la phan par byed pa bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig pa dag la phan par byed pa bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no activity of benefit for those that are simultaneous.

original: dus tha dad pa nyid yin na yang shes pa gzhan gyis dus na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid log pa'i phyir rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid yin na yang shes pa gzhan gyis dus na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid log pa'i phyir rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if they are different in time, it is not cognition, because the nature of pleasure and so on has ceased at the time of another consciousness.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na nyid rig par bya ba yin gyi don ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na nyid rig par bya ba yin gyi don ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the position that has aspects, only consciousness alone is what is cognized, not objects.

original: de'i phyir shes pa gzhan gyis kyang sngar zhig pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul du byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gzhan gyis kyang sngar zhig pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul du byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the past object is not cognized by another cognition.

original: 'on kyang bdag gi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is the nature of the self.

original: rig par bya ba rang gi rnam pa yod pa la shes pas sgra 'gong na yang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig par bya ba ma yin pa med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig par bya ba rang gi rnam pa yod pa la shes pas sgra 'gong na yang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig par bya ba ma yin pa med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: If the object of cognition is the form of the cognition itself, then sound is not cognized, but pleasure, etc., which are not objects of cognition, are not nonexistent.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa la de'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la yang tha snyad du sgra 'god par 'dod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa la de'i rang bzhin du zhen pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la yang tha snyad du sgra 'god par 'dod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the nature of the object is conceived in the form of the cognition, it is held that conventionally sound is ascribed to the object.

original: don dam par bkod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par bkod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not held ultimately.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis shes pa sgra dang 'dres par @93b snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis shes pa sgra dang 'dres par @93b snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of cognition as mixed with sound is held to be conceptual because it has as its object past pleasure, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyis rgyu mtshan ni sgra dang 'dres par 'dzin pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyis rgyu mtshan ni sgra dang 'dres par 'dzin pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptual mind apprehends the object as mixed with the sound.

original: rang rig pa ni sgra dang ma 'dres pa'i don rig pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni sgra dang ma 'dres pa'i don rig pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: But self-cognition is nonconceptual because it cognizes the object without mixing it with the sound.

original: brda mi nus pa 'di nyid ni rang rig par rtog pa med par sgrub par nyid kyi don du bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: brda mi nus pa 'di nyid ni rang rig par rtog pa med par sgrub par nyid kyi don du bkod pa yin te /
translated: This very inability to express is stated to prove that self-cognition is nonconceptual.

original: brda mi nus pa'i rnam pa 'dis kyang rang rig pa rnam par rtog pa med par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: brda mi nus pa'i rnam pa 'dis kyang rang rig pa rnam par rtog pa med par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This inability to express also proves that self-cognition is nonconceptual.

original: de'i phyir zhig nas ring du long pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhig nas ring du long pa'am /
translated: Therefore, whether it is long after the object has ceased,

original: shes pa'i dus na yod pa yang rung ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i yul sgra dgod par rung ba na shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir bzhed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na yod pa yang rung ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i yul sgra dgod par rung ba na shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir bzhed pa yin gyi /
translated: or whether it exists at the time of cognition, the nature of pleasure, etc. is the object of self-cognition. It is not cognized by another cognition. This is the meaning intended here.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: because there is no consciousness that perceives pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar gyur na ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin zhes smras pa don med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin zhes smras pa don med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: But this is not the meaning, because if that were so, it would be pointless to say that the past has the nature of a real entity.

original: / gzhan gyis kyang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan gyis kyang rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should simply say that it is not cognized by others.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa dang sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa dang sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to express it or to apply a term to it.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang rig pa'am shes pa gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid so sor nges pa la sgra dgod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang rig pa'am shes pa gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid so sor nges pa la sgra dgod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, a term is not applied to the nature of pleasure, etc., which is ascertained by reflexive awareness or another consciousness.üîΩSimilarly, a term is not applied to it because it is purposeless.

original: de bzhin du dgos pa med pa'i phyir yang de la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni yang 'byung ba ma yin pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa thun mong ma yin pa la brda ste /üîΩsgra nges par sbyor ba don med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgos pa med pa'i phyir yang de la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes 'chad pa ni yang 'byung ba ma yin pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa thun mong ma yin pa la brda ste / sgra nges par sbyor ba don med pa ste /
translated: The explanation is that it is not possible to apply a term to something that is not arisen, does not endure, and is not common.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pointless to apply a term to it because it is purposeless.

original: yang zhes bya ba 'di ni rang rig pa la brjod pa srid pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid la gtan tshigs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba 'di ni rang rig pa la brjod pa srid pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid la gtan tshigs bsags pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the root text is a reason for the statement ‚Äúit is impossible to speak of reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las ni brjod pa med par bsgrub par bya ba la brdar mi nus pa gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin la gzhan 'di yang 'brel pa las brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las ni brjod pa med par bsgrub par bya ba la brdar mi nus pa gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin la gzhan 'di yang 'brel pa las brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the verse, the reason is stated as ‚Äúinability to express,‚Äù which is the proof of the absence of expression. The other reason, ‚Äúbecause it is related to expression,‚Äù is stated in the commentary.

original: brda mi nus pa nyid bsgrubs nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du dkyus ma mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: brda mi nus pa nyid bsgrubs nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du dkyus ma mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having proven the reason ‚Äúinability to express,‚Äù the root text concludes the section on the absence of conceptualization by stating:

original: de'i phyir te brda bya bar mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa de dag gi bdag rig pa rig par byed pa nyid ni'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir te brda bya bar mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa de dag gi bdag rig pa rig par byed pa nyid ni'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the reason ‚Äúinability to express,‚Äù those such as pleasure are not reflexive awareness.

original: brjod pa ni smra bar byed pa'i sgra yin gyi /üîΩbstan bcos gzhan las grags @94a * //
analyzed: brjod pa ni smra bar byed pa'i sgra yin gyi / bstan bcos gzhan las grags @94a * //
translated: ‚ÄúExpression‚Äù is the sound that expresses.

original: pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not known from other treatises.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don dang lhan cig tu byas pa'i sgra rnam brjod pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dang lhan cig tu byas pa'i sgra rnam brjod pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSound is expression when it is conjoined with meaning.‚Äù

original: de dang rjes su 'brel ba'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel ba'i snang ba'o //
translated: and the appearance that is related to that.

original: de gang la yod pa ni can te rig pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa ni can te rig pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: That which has that is a possessor of that. But cognition is not like that.

original: de nyid rnam par 'brel pa bshad pa la /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par 'brel pa bshad pa la /
translated: The explanation of the relation of that to the proof:

original: brdar mi nus pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi sgra'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: brdar mi nus pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi sgra'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: Because it is not possible to make a convention.

original: des na sbyor ba ni gang zhig smra ba gang gis brjod par bya ba brda nges par ma sbyar ba de ni des khyad par can du gzung bar byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na sbyor ba ni gang zhig smra ba gang gis brjod par bya ba brda nges par ma sbyar ba de ni des khyad par can du gzung bar byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not made to be apprehended as qualified by that by means of which it is expressed, by a word to which a convention has not been assigned,

original: dper na ba lang gi sgras rta bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi sgras rta bzhin no //
translated: like a horse by the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang sgra thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba nyid du brda nges par ma sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang sgra thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba nyid du brda nges par ma sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: And the property of the opponent is that the nature of pleasure, etc. is not made to be the object expressed by all words to which a convention has not been assigned. This is the absence of the pervader.

original: 'di ltar brda'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Thus, because it follows the convention and conforms to the presence and absence of the convention, the apprehension of a particular sound is not the intrinsic nature of sound.

original: de'i phyir brda 'dzin pas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub bo zhes lan mang du gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir brda 'dzin pas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub bo zhes lan mang du gtan la phab zin to //
translated: Therefore, because it is pervaded by the apprehension of the convention, the relation is established. This has been established many times.

original: gang dang gang la brjod pa dang ma 'brel pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang la brjod pa dang ma 'brel pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: Whatever is not related to expression is called this.

original: rig pa can rnams na re 'dis rig par byed pa'i phyir rig pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de dag ste /
analyzed: rig pa can rnams na re 'dis rig par byed pa'i phyir rig pa'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de dag ste /
translated: The logicians say that the intrinsic nature of awareness exists in whatever is aware.

original: de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba'o //
translated: It is not that which does not have that.

original: 'di skad du gzhan rig par byed pa yin na ni shugs kyis bdag nyid rig par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gzhan rig par byed pa yin na ni shugs kyis bdag nyid rig par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: In this way, if it makes another aware, it would indirectly make itself aware.

original: 'di dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: But these are not the intrinsic nature of awareness.

original: 'o na sim pa la sogs pa rig par 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sim pa la sogs pa rig par 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that pleasure and so on are aware?

original: smras pa shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: He says: It is known by another cognition.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzung ba ni yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzung ba ni yin gyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like a pot, etc., it is apprehended, but it is not the apprehender.

original: de dag bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid du snang bar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de dag bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid du snang bar thal lo zhe na /
translated: It follows that they appear as external natures, like a pot, etc.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: rang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa bdag nyid gcig la 'du ba yin pa des na tha dad pa med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa bdag nyid gcig la 'du ba yin pa des na tha dad pa med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one‚Äôs own pleasure, etc., and cognition are combined in the same nature, they appear without difference.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes pa khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes pa khyad par du byed de /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he specifies cognition.

original: gcig kyang de yin la don kyang yin pa der 'brel pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa ste shes pa des so //
analyzed: gcig kyang de yin la don kyang yin pa der 'brel pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa ste shes pa des so //
translated: That which is one and also an object is the mode of being related to it, i.e., by that cognition.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jog pa po nyid yis 'brel @94b pa can nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jog pa po nyid yis 'brel @94b pa can nyid do //
translated: By them, i.e., by the very one who posits, there is the relatedness.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gis dngos po de dag rnam par gzhag pas na rang gi bdag nyid dang rnam par 'brel pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gis dngos po de dag rnam par gzhag pas na rang gi bdag nyid dang rnam par 'brel pa byed pa yin te /
translated: Because they posit those things, they are related to their own nature.

original: des na de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ni de dag gi yin no zhes 'brel pa can gyi dngos po la ltos nas 'brel pa can nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po ni de dag gi yin no zhes 'brel pa can gyi dngos po la ltos nas 'brel pa can nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the things that have the nature of being that and not that are shown to be related in dependence on the related things.

original: de zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to a rice sprout.

original: de min zhes bya ba ni nas kyi myu gu'o //
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba ni nas kyi myu gu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that‚Äù refers to a barley sprout.

original: de dang de min bdag gis rang bzhin s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyis myu gu dag ste /
analyzed: de dang de min bdag gis rang bzhin s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyis myu gu dag ste /
translated: The nature of being that and not that is the nature of a rice sprout and a barley sprout.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni de dang de min rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni de dang de min rang bzhin can no //
translated: Those that have that are those that have the nature of being that and not that.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu gcig dang rang bzhin 'dra ba'i s'a lu'i myu gu gzhan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu gcig dang rang bzhin 'dra ba'i s'a lu'i myu gu gzhan brjod pa yin no //
translated: The rice sprout is one, and the other rice sprouts are similar in nature.

original: de bzhin du s'a lu'i myu gu gcig dang rang bzhin mi 'dra bar gnas kyi myu gu gzhan ni de min rang bzhin can du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du s'a lu'i myu gu gcig dang rang bzhin mi 'dra bar gnas kyi myu gu gzhan ni de min rang bzhin can du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the single rice sprout is said to be of a nature that is not different from the rice seed, and the other sprouts, which are of a different nature, are said to be of a nature that is not that .

original: s'a lu'i myu gu gcig las tha dad par mtshungs pa las s'a la'i myu gu ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa yin la nas kyi myu gu ni rang bzhin med pa yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu gcig las tha dad par mtshungs pa las s'a la'i myu gu ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa yin la nas kyi myu gu ni rang bzhin med pa yin no //
translated: The rice sprout, which is similar in being different from the single rice sprout, is said to be of a nature, and the barley sprout is said to be without a nature.

original: de dang de ma yin pa ni de de min no //
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa ni de de min no //
translated: That which is not that is not that.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni de de min dngos te /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni de de min dngos te /
translated: That which is their nature is that which is not that.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyi myu gu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyi myu gu la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is the rice sprout and the barley sprout, etc.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni s'a lu'i dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni s'a lu'i dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is their cause is the rice seed and the barley seed, etc.

original: de dag las skyes pa ni de de min dngos rgyu las skyes so //
analyzed: de dag las skyes pa ni de de min dngos rgyu las skyes so //
translated: That which arises from them is that which is not that, arisen from a cause.

original: de'i rang bzhin gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba las skyes pa ni de'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba las skyes pa ni de'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
translated: That which is the cause of that which is of a single nature is that which is similar to that, arisen from that cause.

original: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be applied to that which is not its nature.

original: de la don ni gang gi phyir de dag gi dngos po yang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes par 'gyur ba nges na de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la don ni gang gi phyir de dag gi dngos po yang de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes par 'gyur ba nges na de dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is: because their nature is produced from a cause that is both that and not that, it is asserted that they are both that and not that.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that, for that reason.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir te rgyu cis shes ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir te rgyu cis shes ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Pleasure, etc., are not known to be what,‚Äù i.e., by what cause?

original: blo'i rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: ‚Äú They are not of the nature of cognition.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med pa'i rgyus bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni blo'i rang bzhin du rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med pa'i rgyus bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni blo'i rang bzhin du rigs te /
translated: Because that which is produced by a cause that is not different from consciousness is reasonable as being of the nature of cognition,

original: dper na de dag gi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na de dag gi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: just as their nature is established. This is the intended meaning.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nyid rnam par 'grel par bshad pa /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nyid rnam par 'grel par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Commentary on the Meaning of the Verses

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rig pa can dag go //üîΩde dang de ma yin @95a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rig pa can dag go // de dang de ma yin @95a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat and not that‚Äù means that and not that.

original: s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyi myu gu dag go //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu dang nas kyi myu gu dag go //
translated: For example, a rice sprout and a barley sprout.

original: de dag nyid kyi'am rang gi ngo bo de dag nyid ga la yod pa de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi'am rang gi ngo bo de dag nyid ga la yod pa de rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf those‚Äù means of those very things.

original: de rang bzhin te yod pas na de'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de rang bzhin te yod pas na de'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat nature‚Äù means that existence.

original: de bzhin du de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that nature‚Äù means not that existence.

original: dngos po rnams kyi de'i rang bzhin can dang de'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa can de la brgal zhing brtags pa na ste brtsad cing dris na'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi de'i rang bzhin can dang de'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa can de la brgal zhing brtags pa na ste brtsad cing dris na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is a dispute about that nature and not that nature of things‚Äù means when there is a debate about that nature and not that nature of things.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de 'bras bu nges pa skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid la brten te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de 'bras bu nges pa skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid la brten te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the cause‚Äù means the essence. ‚ÄúIn dependence on the characteristic of being able to produce a definite effect‚Äù means in dependence on the characteristic of being able to produce a definite effect.

original: 'bras bu nges par bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du nye bar rten to //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges par bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du nye bar rten to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause is posited as the producer of a definite effect‚Äù means the cause is established as the producer of a definite effect.

original: yang ji ltar rten zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rten zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it posited?‚Äù

original: ngag gi don gyi bdag nyid rten pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ngag gi don gyi bdag nyid rten pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the basis of the meaning of the words, he says:

original: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i rgyu de las skyes pa ni de nyid kyi'am rang bzhin de nyid gang yin pa de dag ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i rgyu de las skyes pa ni de nyid kyi'am rang bzhin de nyid gang yin pa de dag ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of that is the cause of that, and what is born from that is that itself or that very nature. Those are its nature.

original: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir yang sbyar te nges na don gyi 'di yin te zhes
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir yang sbyar te nges na don gyi 'di yin te zhes
translated: Similarly, what is born from a cause that is not its nature is not its nature. This should be applied here also. The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù is applied here also.

original: bya ba de ltar spyir rgyu las 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nges par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba de ltar spyir rgyu las 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nges par smra ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in general, the nature of the effect is said to be determined by the cause.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin la rten pa spyi'i rnam pas brjod nas khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin la rten pa spyi'i rnam pas brjod nas khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having thus expressed the general nature of the basis of the cause, in order to teach the particular, he says, ‚ÄúFor example.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni spyir brjod pa'i don gyi yul nye bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni spyir brjod pa'i don gyi yul nye bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This demonstrates the object of the general expression.

original: spyir brjod pa'i don lta bur ji ltar blta bar bya zhes 'dra ba'i skabs su dper na zhes nye bar blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don lta bur ji ltar blta bar bya zhes 'dra ba'i skabs su dper na zhes nye bar blangs pa yin te /
translated: In the phrase how should one view the general meaning? the word for example is used in the sense of in this way.

original: don 'di la 'di lta bu ni de yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di la 'di lta bu ni de yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what it is like in this case.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag las so ;
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag las so ;
translated: From whatever rice seeds, etc.,

original: / de las skyes pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni des bskyed pa ste s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / de las skyes pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni des bskyed pa ste s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: that arise from that are produced by those rice seeds, etc., and have the nature of being produced by rice seeds, etc.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag las ni gzhan te /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa de dag las gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag las ni gzhan te /
translated: From whatever are different from those rice seeds, etc., are different from those,

original: rang bzhin mi 'dra ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'dra ba skye ba yin no //
translated: and have a different nature.

original: dper na na'i sgra ni ji ltar 'dir bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad du blta bar bya'o zhes nye bar ston par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na na'i sgra ni ji ltar 'dir bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad du blta bar bya'o zhes nye bar ston par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word for example is used in the sense of in this way, and the word like is used in the sense of in that way.üîΩ The general statement is that in this way, and the particular statement is that in that way.

original: lta bu'i sgra ni de ltar gyi don te //
analyzed: lta bu'i sgra ni de ltar gyi don te //
translated: The word like is used in the sense of in that way.

original: spyir brjod pa ni de ltar mthong pa'i khyad par pha rol la ston pa'o //
analyzed: spyir brjod pa ni de ltar mthong pa'i khyad par pha rol la ston pa'o //
translated: The general statement is that in this way, and the particular statement is that in that way.

original: de ltar de'i phyir de dag rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de'i phyir de dag rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are based on the nature of the cause.

original: yang ji ltar na rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten @95b nas 'bras bu rnam par 'jog ce na /üîΩglo bur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rgyu'i rang bzhin la brten @95b nas 'bras bu rnam par 'jog ce na / glo bur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Moreover, how is it that the effect is posited based on the nature of the cause?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúIf the effect were not produced by the nature of the cause, it would arise adventitiously.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu'i dbye ba rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis byas par ma gyu rna ni tshig lo bur 'byung ba ni glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i dbye ba rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis byas par ma gyu rna ni tshig lo bur 'byung ba ni glo bur ba ste /
translated: If the effect were not produced by the nature of the cause, it would arise adventitiously.

original: glo bur gyi sgra'i tshig phrad ni rgyu mtshan med par 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: glo bur gyi sgra'i tshig phrad ni rgyu mtshan med par 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: The compound ‚Äúarising adventitiously‚Äù means ‚Äúarising without a reason.‚Äù

original: rgyu med pa'o //üîΩde'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'o // de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: It is causeless.üîΩIts state is that itself.

original: der thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that it would be that.

original: dngos po de dang gzhan las kyang skye ba yin na rgyu nges pa med pa can du 'gyur gyi rgyu med pa can du ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po de dang gzhan las kyang skye ba yin na rgyu nges pa med pa can du 'gyur gyi rgyu med pa can du ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it were produced from both itself and another, there would be no certainty of cause, but it would not be causeless.

original: des na rgyu'i dbye ba las 'bras bu'i dbye ba khas mi len na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na rgyu'i dbye ba las 'bras bu'i dbye ba khas mi len na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, if one does not accept the classification of effects from the classification of causes, then why does he say that it follows that they would be causeless?

original: smras pa / rgyu nges pa can nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu nges pa can nyid ni rgyu med pa nyid yin te /
translated: We say: The certainty of a cause is causelessness.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang med par 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang med par 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which arises without something else is not caused by that.

original: dper na du ba chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba chu'i rgyu can ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, smoke is not caused by water.

original: de bzhin du du ba med dang dngos po gzhan de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ba med dang dngos po gzhan de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid do //
translated: Similarly, because it arises even without smoke and without another thing, it is causeless.

original: gzhan yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ngo bo ni cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir de dag rgyu med pa can nyid na sna tshogs rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba des na rgyu med pa nyidüîΩdu thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin ngo bo ni cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir de dag rgyu med pa can nyid na sna tshogs rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba des na rgyu med pa nyidüîΩdu thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, because the nature of an entity that is the opposite of different and not different does not exist in the least, if they are causeless, then the variety would be causeless. Therefore, it follows that they are causeless.

original: de ltar gyur na yang yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang de dag rnams kyi nges par de med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir na rgyu'i rang bzhin brten par bya'o zhes 'brel te gang gi phyir dngos po rgyu med pa can nyid yin na ni yul dang dusüîΩla ltos par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang de dag rnams kyi nges par de med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir na rgyu'i rang bzhin brten par bya'o zhes 'brel te gang gi phyir dngos po rgyu med pa can nyid yin na ni yul dang dus la ltos par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If things were causeless, they would not depend on object and time,

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni ltos par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin ni ltos par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the cause is that which is dependent.

original: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus dag spangs nas gzhan dag tu yang 'dug pa yin na de lta na ni der nges pa med pas de la mi ltos par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus dag spangs nas gzhan dag tu yang 'dug pa yin na de lta na ni der nges pa med pas de la mi ltos par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If they existed in other places and times, abandoning the desired object and time, then they would not depend on that, since they would not be definite there.

original: da lta ni yul dang dus gzhan spangs nas mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus su nges pas de la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin la de la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang de'i rgyu can nyid yin no //
analyzed: da lta ni yul dang dus gzhan spangs nas mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dang dus su nges pas de la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin la de la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang de'i rgyu can nyid yin no //
translated: But now, since they exist in the desired object and time, abandoning other objects and times, they are dependent on that, and that dependence itself is due to its cause.

original: kha cig gal te dngos po rgyu med pa yin na de'i tshe chu me'i rang bzhin nam me chu'i rang bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rang bzhin nges pa med par ston par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩde ltar gyur na ni chu'i rang bzhin gyi me ni chu @96a * //
analyzed: kha cig gal te dngos po rgyu med pa yin na de'i tshe chu me'i rang bzhin nam me chu'i rang bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rang bzhin nges pa med par ston par byed pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te / de ltar gyur na ni chu'i rang bzhin gyi me ni chu @96a * //
translated: This demonstrates that there would be no definite nature.

original: nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is illogical, because if that were so, then the fire that is the nature of water would be water.

original: des na brgal zhing brtag pa'i don ni me'i phyogs su chu nyid skye bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur la don 'di yang yul nges pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na brgal zhing brtag pa'i don ni me'i phyogs su chu nyid skye bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya bar 'dir 'gyur la don 'di yang yul nges pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the objection would be, ‚ÄúWhy wouldn‚Äôt water arise in the place of fire?‚Äù And this meaning is understood by the absence of a definite object.

original: gal te gcig nyid sna tshogs su ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin na yang 'dri ba 'di yang du ma'i dngos po rgyu med par smra ba la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid sna tshogs su ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin na yang 'dri ba 'di yang du ma'i dngos po rgyu med par smra ba la mi 'thad de /
translated: If the meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhy wouldn‚Äôt one thing be various?‚Äù then this question is not tenable for those who advocate that many things are causeless.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di skad du du ma nyid ni rgyu med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di skad du du ma nyid ni rgyu med pa yin gyi /
translated: Because they say that many things are causeless.

original: gcig ni ma yin no zhes smra ba de la brgal shing brtag pa 'di ji skad ces bya ba yin /
analyzed: gcig ni ma yin no zhes smra ba de la brgal shing brtag pa 'di ji skad ces bya ba yin /
translated: consequence and this analysis?

original: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
translated: The point here is this:üîΩThe very thing that is the basis of action, which has the particularity of

original: tha snyad du bya ba'i dngos po kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par can nyid tshogs pa gzhan la gnas pa'i yon tan dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad du bya ba'i dngos po kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par can nyid tshogs pa gzhan la gnas pa'i yon tan dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: color and shape, is related to the qualities that inhere in other collections.üîΩFor example, just as a magnet and myrobalan are able to attract iron andüîΩto cure illness, why couldn‚Äôt a pot and so forth also do this?

original: dper na khab long dang aa ru ra la sogs pa rnams lcags len pa dang 'khru bar byed nus pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur yang dper na mig gi shes pas gzugs shes par bya ba de bzhin du sgra
analyzed: dper na khab long dang aa ru ra la sogs pa rnams lcags len pa dang 'khru bar byed nus pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur yang dper na mig gi shes pas gzugs shes par bya ba de bzhin du sgra
translated: For example, just as form is perceived by the visual faculty, it would also be

original: 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i shes pas kyang gzung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i shes pas kyang gzung bar 'gyur la /
translated: perceived by the auditory faculty.üîΩSimilarly, sound would also be perceived by the visual faculty, which is

original: de bzhin du sgra yang rang gi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i mig gi shes pas gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra yang rang gi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i mig gi shes pas gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: essentially different from it.

original: de lta na rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: In that case, it would not be tenable that the objects of the consciousnesses are apprehended distinctly.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig spyod pa'i rdzas gzhan dang 'brel pa nges pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig spyod pa'i rdzas gzhan dang 'brel pa nges pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Similarly, it is not tenable that the other substances that accompany it are definitely related.

original: ji ltar tsandan du mngon par 'dod pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs nyid dro ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig rgyu bar 'gyur la me yang grang ba dang / 'o thug ro med pa dang / chu mngar ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rang bzhin nges pa rnam pa gsum 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tsandan du mngon par 'dod pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs nyid dro ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig rgyu bar 'gyur la me yang grang ba dang / 'o thug ro med pa dang / chu mngar ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rang bzhin nges pa rnam pa gsum 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the color and shape that are asserted to be sandalwood would occur together with the hot touch, fire would be related to cold, milk would be related to no taste, and water would be related to sweetness. Thus the three types of definite nature would not be tenable.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba 'di rgyu'i rang bzhin kho nas byas par khas blang dogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba 'di rgyu'i rang bzhin kho nas byas par khas blang dogs so //
translated: Therefore, others should accept that this classification of effects is made by the nature of the cause alone.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed gong ma bshad nas phyed 'og ma bshad par bzhed pas bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa rgyu tha mi dad par sbyar ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed gong ma bshad nas phyed 'og ma bshad par bzhed pas bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa rgyu tha mi dad par sbyar ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since he explains the second half of the verse after explaining the first half, he says ‚Äúin that‚Äù in order to connect pleasure, etc., with consciousness as not different in cause.

original: 'di la yang rgyu tha dad pa'i rgyu ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu tha dad pa'i rgyu ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Here, the cause of difference is the substantial cause.

original: des na blo dang blo ma yin pa'i rgyud rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyu @96b nyid tha mi dad par bstan par bya ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na blo dang blo ma yin pa'i rgyud rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyu @96b nyid tha mi dad par bstan par bya ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the substantial cause, which is the cause of the stability of the continuum of consciousness and non-consciousness, is indeed taught to be not different in cause.

original: 'on kyang bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa'i nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid la dang por rtsod pa de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba khyad par med par rgyu mtshungs par bsgrubs pa'i shugs nyid kyis nye bar len ba dang tha dad pa med par bstanüîΩpa byas par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba la sogs pa dang shes pa'i nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid la dang por rtsod pa de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba khyad par med par rgyu mtshungs par bsgrubs pa'i shugs nyid kyis nye bar len ba dang tha dad pa med par bstanüîΩpa byas par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: However, since the debate is first about the identity of the substantial cause of pleasure, etc., and consciousness, and then the proof of the similarity of cause without distinction is presented, he thinks that the non-difference in substantial cause is taught by the force of that.

original: tshogs pa nyid tha mi dad par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid tha mi dad par ston pa yin no //
translated: The collection itself is not different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gang la yul med par mi skye ba gang yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gang la yul med par mi skye ba gang yin pa de dag ste /
translated: Those which do not arise without an object, such as pleasure, etc.

original: yul med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: they do not occur without an object.

original: yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa yul med kyang skye ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa yul med kyang skye ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that mental pleasure, etc. do arise without an object?

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i zhes byas pas khyad par can gyi bde ba la sogs pa nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i zhes byas pas khyad par can gyi bde ba la sogs pa nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: To anticipate this doubt, he says, ‚Äúin accordance with its own nature,‚Äù and he shows that they are effects by way of the exclusion of extraordinary pleasure, etc.

original: gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid yin pa ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid yin pa ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'o //
translated: That which is of a certain nature is in accordance with its own nature.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la so sor nges pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yul de dang de dag ni rgyur gyur pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi gzugs la sogs pa la so sor nges pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yul de dang de dag ni rgyur gyur pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: The objects of those individual pleasures, etc. which are extraordinary forms, etc. are of a nature which is a cause.

original: dper na pi wang gi sgra thos pa las byung ba'i yul ni pi wang gi sgra yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na pi wang gi sgra thos pa las byung ba'i yul ni pi wang gi sgra yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the object which arises from hearing the sound of a lute is the sound of a lute.

original: de la bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa rnams bdag nyid kyi yul de tshogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa rnams bdag nyid kyi yul de tshogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Whatever objects such as pleasure are related to the self, they are not the self‚Äôs object, since they are not a collection.üîΩ

original: rung ba'i yul du mi gnas na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul du mi gnas na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever pleasure, etc. is related to a particular object, that is not the object of the self, because it is the cause of the non-occurrence of the self in the absence of the collection of its own objects.

original: de'i phyir de ltar khyad par can gyi yul can du rab tu grub pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams ldog pa'i sgo nas de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar khyad par can gyi yul can du rab tu grub pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams ldog pa'i sgo nas de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, pleasure, etc. are well established as having a particular object, and they are shown to be its effect by way of their exclusion.

original: gang la dbang po yod pa ma yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: gang la dbang po yod pa ma yin pa de dag ste /
translated: Those that do not have a sense faculty are not the effect of the self,

original: de lta bur gyur pa la yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa la yang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: and they do not arise in that way.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúaccumulation.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa la 'bras bu'i dngos por rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'jug pa de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la 'bras bu'i dngos por rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'jug pa de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that are related to form, etc. as an effect are said to be ‚Äúhaving that nature.‚Äù

original: de rnams ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa de'i yul can gyi dbang po gang yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa de'i yul can gyi dbang po gang yin pa de dag ste /
translated: They are the faculties that are the subjects of those objects, such as form, that are the causes of pleasure, etc.

original: de yang yin la dbang po yang yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: de yang yin la dbang po yang yin pa dag ste /
translated: They are faculties and they are also that.

original: de dag dang bral ba ste med pa la zhes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ste med pa la zhes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not present, i.e., they do not exist, because they are absent.

original: 'di ni dbang po med pa nyid la 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs so //üîΩdbang po yang de yin la nyams pa med @97a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po med pa nyid la 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs so // dbang po yang de yin la nyams pa med @97a * //
translated: This is a logical proof of the cessation of the nonexistence of the faculties.

original: pa yang yin pa de nye bar gnas pa ni yod pa dang mngon du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa yang yin pa de nye bar gnas pa ni yod pa dang mngon du phyogs pa ste /
translated: The faculties are present, i.e., they exist and are manifest,üîΩbecause they are not impaired.

original: mngon du phyogs par ma gyur na ni lta bar 'dod kyang mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par ma gyur na ni lta bar 'dod kyang mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were not manifest, then even if one wanted to see, one would not see form with the eye.

original: des na mngon du phyogs la yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon du phyogs la yang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are present and manifest.

original: de ltar gyur pa na sngar dbang po med pa na ma mthong ba las yang ste phyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na sngar dbang po med pa na ma mthong ba las yang ste phyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When that is so, then one sees later, i.e., after the faculties are present, what one did not see previously, i.e., when the faculties were absent.

original: des na gtan tshogs 'di gnyis kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa mig gi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed par bstan to //
analyzed: des na gtan tshogs 'di gnyis kyis ni gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa mig gi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, these two arguments demonstrate that pleasure and so on that depend on form and so on conform with the presence and absence of the eye.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyu nyid ston par yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyu nyid ston par yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúconformity‚Äù should also be applied to the prior and subsequent causes.

original: ldog pa tsam nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa tsam nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it demonstrates mere absence.

original: yang na ma mthong ba'i mig gi rang bzhin de'i shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa rnams de med na mi 'byung bar go ji ltar zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na ma mthong ba'i mig gi rang bzhin de'i shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa rnams de med na mi 'byung bar go ji ltar zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Or, since it is untenable that the consciousness of that unseen eye nature is otherwise, it is posited. Since it is understood that pleasure and so on do not occur without it, how is that?

original: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is the statement of conformity.

original: ji ltar dper na yul dang yid la byed pa dag las tha dad pa'i mig shes pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur yang gzhag par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dper na yul dang yid la byed pa dag las tha dad pa'i mig shes pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur yang gzhag par nus pa yin te /
translated: Just as the cause of eye consciousness is posited as separate from objects and mental factors, in the same way it is possible to posit it as the cause of pleasure and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams de yod na yod pa dang / med na med pa de'i phyir de dag rgyu yang mig yin no zhes gnyi ga bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams de yod na yod pa dang / med na med pa de'i phyir de dag rgyu yang mig yin no zhes gnyi ga bstan to //
translated: Since pleasure, etc. exist when the eye exists and do not exist when the eye does not exist, the eye is the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gang dag skye ba la yid la byed pa med pa ste yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gang dag skye ba la yid la byed pa med pa ste yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen pleasure, etc. arise‚Äù means that pleasure, etc. do not arise without the activity of the mind.

original: gnyi ga ni yul dang dbang po'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni yul dang dbang po'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúboth‚Äù refers to the object and the sense faculty.

original: tshogs pa ni yul rung ba'i yul na gnas pa dang nyams pa med pa'i dbang po mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni yul rung ba'i yul na gnas pa dang nyams pa med pa'i dbang po mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcoming together‚Äù means that the object is present in a suitable place and the sense faculty is present without defect.üîΩEven though the eye sense faculty of one who is asleep is present, it is not directed toward an object.

original: gal te gnyid log pa'i mig gi dbang po mngon du phyogs pa ma yin yang dbang po gzhan dag ni mngon du phyogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te gnyid log pa'i mig gi dbang po mngon du phyogs pa ma yin yang dbang po gzhan dag ni mngon du phyogs pa kho na'o //
translated: However, the other sense faculties are directed toward their objects.

original: yang 'ga' zhig gi ni mig kyang mngon du phyogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig gi ni mig kyang mngon du phyogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, the eye sense faculty of one who is asleep is also directed toward its object,

original: 'ga' zhig mig gi 'bras bu g-yo ba med par mngon du gyur pa'i yul la 'jug bzhin du gnyid log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mig gi 'bras bu g-yo ba med par mngon du gyur pa'i yul la 'jug bzhin du gnyid log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eyes of some people who are asleep do not move, but remain fixed on the object.

original: de la gnyi ga tshogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga tshogs kyang ngo //
translated: Both are present in the case of the drunkard.

original: gnyid ni gnyid do //üîΩde la sogs pa myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa des bslad pa ste /
analyzed: gnyid ni gnyid do // de la sogs pa myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa des bslad pa ste /
translated: Sleep is sleep.üîΩThe mind of one who is affected by these and similar conditions, such as intoxication, fainting, etc.,

original: 'khrul par gyur cing dbang po'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa nyams pa'i blo gang la yod ba de la dbang po las skyes pa'i @97b bde ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul par gyur cing dbang po'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa nyams pa'i blo gang la yod ba de la dbang po las skyes pa'i @97b bde ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is disturbed, and the capacity to generate a sense perception is impaired.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa la ltos pa can zhes khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa la ltos pa can zhes khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that pleasure, etc., are dependent on mental attention.

original: gang yang dbang po las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la brjod pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang yang dbang po las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la brjod pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa 'di ni /
translated: The collection of causes that is said to produce pleasure, etc.,

original: rnam par shes pa ste skabs kyi dbang po la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ste skabs kyi dbang po la brten pa'o //
translated: is the sense faculty, which is the basis of consciousness in this context.

original: de skyes pa la yang rgyu ste skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa ste 'dus pa 'di dag tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de skyes pa la yang rgyu ste skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa ste 'dus pa 'di dag tsam du zad de /
translated: The mere collection of causes that produces it is the mere collection of these causes.

original: rdzas kyi grangs 'di tsam du chad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi grangs 'di tsam du chad pa'o //
translated: The number of substances is limited to this.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Because here too, as before, there is the presence of concomitance and reverse concomitance.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa med pa des na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa med pa des na ste /
translated: Because consciousness and pleasure, etc. are not different causes,

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: therefore pleasure, etc. do not have an objective support that is a distinct entity.

original: ji ltar gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa rang gi ngo bo ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rang gi ngo bo ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The explanation is: the result that is related to that cause, which is its own nature, is its result.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yul dang dus dang yon tan gyi khyad par so sor nges pa de ltar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yul dang dus dang yon tan gyi khyad par so sor nges pa de ltar gyur pa na'o //
translated: When it has that nature, which is the determination of the distinctions of object, time, and quality.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
translated: Those that have an essential nature that is not an objective support,

original: de ltar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: they are not like that.

original: 'di snyam du 'dus byas pa'i zhes bya ba'i bdag gi yon tan yod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dus byas pa'i zhes bya ba'i bdag gi yon tan yod de /
translated: If you think that there is a quality of the self called ‚Äúconditioned,‚Äù

original: de ni rnam par shes pa nyid kyis bdag de la skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa nyid kyis bdag de la skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Consciousness itself produces that self,

original: dus gzhan du yang de las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang de las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: and at another time, consciousness arises from that self.

original: ji skad du shes pa las skyes pa dang / shes pa'i rgyu ni 'dus pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du shes pa las skyes pa dang / shes pa'i rgyu ni 'dus pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúConsciousness arises from consciousness, and the cause of consciousness is contact.‚Äù

original: de ni shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ma yin pa des na rnam par shes pa nyid blo'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes sems so //
analyzed: de ni shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ma yin pa des na rnam par shes pa nyid blo'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes sems so //
translated: That is the cause of consciousness, not pleasure, etc. Therefore, consciousness itself has the nature of mind, but pleasure, etc. do not.

original: dogs pa de nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus byas pa las nges pa yin no zhe na zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa de nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus byas pa las nges pa yin no zhe na zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: In order to include that very doubt, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say it is certain from the conditioned.‚Äù

original: lan bshad pa /
analyzed: lan bshad pa /
translated: The answer is:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
