translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'dus byas pa de'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa de'i rjes su byed pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa de'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa de'i rjes su byed pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see that the existence or nonexistence of the capacity of that conditioned thing follows after that.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas pa la ni yul gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis sam /üîΩdbang po bzhin du ldog pa'i sgo nas shes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas pa la ni yul gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis sam / dbang po bzhin du ldog pa'i sgo nas shes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the produced does not follow the same rule as the object, i.e., it does not go to another place and return,üîΩor as the sense faculty, i.e., it does not return.

original: shes pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed cing de skye ba la nus pa ma mthong ba de ji ltar de'i skyed par @98a * //
analyzed: shes pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed cing de skye ba la nus pa ma mthong ba de ji ltar de'i skyed par @98a * //
translated: If the produced does not follow the same rule as the cognition, i.e., it does not follow the same rule as the cognition in going and returning, and if one does not see that it has the power to arise, how can it be the producer of the cognition?

original: byed pa yin /
analyzed: byed pa yin /
translated: How can it be the producer of the cognition?

original: gang zhig de tsam nyid la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba ni de dag las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de tsam nyid la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba ni de dag las byung ba yin no //
translated: That which is seen to follow the same rule as the cognition in going and returning arises from the cognition.

original: de tsam las 'byung ba la de las gzhan yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i yul rgyu nyid du brtags na ni 'gro ba ma lus pa thams cad rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam las 'byung ba la de las gzhan yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i yul rgyu nyid du brtags na ni 'gro ba ma lus pa thams cad rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines that the object, which arises from the cognition, is the cause, even though it does not follow the same rule as the cognition in going and returning, then it follows, absurdly, that the entire world is the cause of the cognition.

original: de'i phyir thams cad tshogs na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad tshogs na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when all the causes are assembled, the effect arises; otherwise, it does not.

original: thag ring po na gnas pa rnams kyi rgyu yin na yang rdul gcig nyams na yang 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thag ring po na gnas pa rnams kyi rgyu yin na yang rdul gcig nyams na yang 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the cause is distant, if one atom is missing, the effect will not arise.

original: gzhan du na thams cad rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di rgyu'i ming tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na thams cad rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di rgyu'i ming tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that everything is a cause, and the name ‚Äúcause‚Äù would be a mere nominality.

original: 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la yang gi sgra ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la yang gi sgra ni bsags pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúconditioned and unconditioned‚Äù indicates that the cause is not only unconditioned.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzhan gyis brtags pa'i 'dus byas pa ni 'di'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzhan gyis brtags pa'i 'dus byas pa ni 'di'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the conditioned that is imagined by others is not a cause of this.üîΩMoreover, even if the opponent does not assert that consciousness itself is conditioned, the conditioned is still not a cause, because the conditioned is not a cause of the effect.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa nyid la 'dus byas par pha rol 'dod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dus byas pa'i yon tan ci 'dra bar mngon par 'dod pa de ni rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa nyid la 'dus byas par pha rol 'dod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'dus byas pa'i yon tan ci 'dra bar mngon par 'dod pa de ni rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The effect is not produced from the conditioned, because the effect is not produced from the conditioned that is other than it.

original: gang gi phyir de ni rnam par shes pa las skyes pa dang shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin la 'dus byas pa'i chos kyang 'di kho na yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis rnam par shes pa nyid la 'dus byas pa'i sgrar brjod pa yin no zhes ston par
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rnam par shes pa las skyes pa dang shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu yin la 'dus byas pa'i chos kyang 'di kho na yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis rnam par shes pa nyid la 'dus byas pa'i sgrar brjod pa yin no zhes ston par
translated: Because it is produced from consciousness and is the cause of another consciousness, and because it is the only conditioned phenomenon, therefore, others call consciousness itself the word ‚Äúconditioned.‚Äù

original: byed do // 'dus byas pa zhes bya bar zhes pa la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dus byas pa sgra'i don du byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed do // 'dus byas pa zhes bya bar zhes pa la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dus byas pa sgra'i don du byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcalled‚Äù in ‚Äúcalled conditioned‚Äù means that ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù is the meaning of the word.

original: 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni rnam pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni rnam pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù expresses its aspect.

original: ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of specific characteristic does it have?

original: snga ma zhes smos te /
analyzed: snga ma zhes smos te /
translated: The text says ‚Äúprior.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is the nature of the cause of another consciousness.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba 'dis kyang shes pa gang las gang skyes pa de ni de'i 'dus byas pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba 'dis kyang shes pa gang las gang skyes pa de ni de'i 'dus byas pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúsuitable‚Äù also shows that whatever is produced from a consciousness is its conditioned state.

original: rung ba'i shes pa ni 'dus byas pa yin la /
analyzed: rung ba'i shes pa ni 'dus byas pa yin la /
translated: A suitable consciousness is a conditioned state.

original: de yang kha cig ni bar du chod pa yin yang rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang kha cig ni bar du chod pa yin yang rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: Some say: Even if there is an obstruction, it is a cause.

original: dper na goms pa'i shes pa bzhin ;
analyzed: dper na goms pa'i shes pa bzhin ;
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of a familiar object.

original: goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa phyi ma gsal bar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa phyi ma gsal bar skye ba yin no //
translated: A subsequent clear cognition arises in accordance with the familiar object.

original: kha cig ni bar du ma chod pa nyid du shes pa gsal bar skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni bar du ma chod pa nyid du shes pa gsal bar skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Some say: It is a cause of the clear arising of cognition only if there is no obstruction.

original: de'i phyir de ltar chod dam ma chod kyang rung ste phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa khyad par can gyi rgyu'i shes pa ni 'dus byas pa @98b zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar chod dam ma chod kyang rung ste phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa khyad par can gyi rgyu'i shes pa ni 'dus byas pa @98b zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whether there is an obstruction or not, the cognition that is the cause of a subsequent special cognition is called conditioned.

original: yid ni bag chags sad pa na bar du ma chod pa nyid kyis shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yid ni bag chags sad pa na bar du ma chod pa nyid kyis shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is the cause of subsequent cognition because it is not obstructed when latent impressions are activated.

original: des na gang las shes pa gang skyes pa de ni de'i yid yin la /
analyzed: des na gang las shes pa gang skyes pa de ni de'i yid yin la /
translated: Therefore, whatever is the cause of a cognition is its mental faculty.

original: yang gang las khyad par can du 'byung ba de ni 'dus byas pa yin par kho bos rtogs te /
analyzed: yang gang las khyad par can du 'byung ba de ni 'dus byas pa yin par kho bos rtogs te /
translated: Moreover, I understand that whatever is the cause of a special cognition is conditioned.

original: bdag gi rig pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi rig pa yin no //
translated: This is my theory.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is stated.

original: bar du chod dam ma chod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bar du chod dam ma chod kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not it is obstructed,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa nyid yin la de ni bde ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par med par sngar nyid bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa nyid yin la de ni bde ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par med par sngar nyid bsgrubs zin te /
translated: the cause of the nature and special qualities of consciousness is consciousness itself. That has already been established earlier, without distinction with regard to pleasure and so on.

original: dbang po'i bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa nyid rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa nyid rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it said that the pleasure and pain of the sense faculties are preceded by consciousness?

original: des na yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: des na yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa ji ltar yin /
translated: Therefore, how can consciousness be the cause of mental pleasure and so on?

original: rnam par shes pa nyid 'dus byas par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid 'dus byas par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can consciousness itself be conditioned?

original: don gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: don gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason for both of those points is stated:

original: nang gi byed pa ni yid de /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa ni yid de /
translated: The internal agent is the mind.

original: de las byung ba'i ngang tshul gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ngang tshul gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from it are its nature.

original: bde ba la sogs thams cad nang gi byed pa las byung bar khyad par med kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa gang dag yin pa de nyid ni yid kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs thams cad nang gi byed pa las byung bar khyad par med kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa gang dag yin pa de nyid ni yid kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Although there is no difference in the fact that all things such as pleasure arise from internal activity, the difference in the mind is due to the fact that there is no other cause such as the eye, etc.

original: de rnams rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de rnams rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is connected with the word ‚Äúmind.

original: rnam par shes par gzung bar bya ba gcig la yang nas yang du 'jug cing byang bar byas pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par gzung bar bya ba gcig la yang nas yang du 'jug cing byang bar byas pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúPractice‚Äù is the repeated engagement in and cultivation of a single object of consciousness.

original: g-yer ba'i khyad par dang zhan pa de dag gi dngos po ni g-yer ba dang zhan pa'i yid //
analyzed: g-yer ba'i khyad par dang zhan pa de dag gi dngos po ni g-yer ba dang zhan pa'i yid //
translated: The nature of the mind that is proud and humble is the pride and humility of the mind.

original: de la sogs pa ni phyin ci log tu gsal ba nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa ni phyin ci log tu gsal ba nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd so on‚Äù refers to the clarity, etc., of the mind.

original: g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa yang de yin la /üîΩkhyad par yang yin pa de ni goms pa'i g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa yang de yin la / khyad par yang yin pa de ni goms pa'i g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The mind that is proud and humble, etc.,

original: de'i rjes su phyed pa rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su phyed pa rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is the pride and humility of the mind that is practiced.üîΩThe mind that is proud and humble, etc., is the pride and humility of the mind that is practiced.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: rnam par shes pas sngar rjes su mthun pa'am mi mthun pa nyid du ji lta ji ltar don la goms par bya ba'i goms pa de dang rjes su mthun par dngos po de la yid kyi bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas sngar rjes su mthun pa'am mi mthun pa nyid du ji lta ji ltar don la goms par bya ba'i goms pa de dang rjes su mthun par dngos po de la yid kyi bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The pleasure or pain of the mind arises in relation to that object in accordance with the prior habituation of consciousness to the object, whether in accordance with it or not.

original: bar chad med par g-yer bar goms pa la ni shin tu g-yer ba'i bde ba 'byung zhing zhan pa la ni zhan par phyin @99a * //
analyzed: bar chad med par g-yer bar goms pa la ni shin tu g-yer ba'i bde ba 'byung zhing zhan pa la ni zhan par phyin @99a * //
translated: In the case of habituation to excessive exertion, the pleasure is excessive; in the case of weak exertion, the pleasure is weak.

original: ci log la ni rjes su mthun par goms par byas pa'i dngos po la yang mi mthun par goms par byas par gyur na de dang rjes su mthun par yid bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur zhing /üîΩsngar skyes pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci log la ni rjes su mthun par goms par byas pa'i dngos po la yang mi mthun par goms par byas par gyur na de dang rjes su mthun par yid bde ba'am / sdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur zhing / sngar skyes pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of habituation to the opposite of that, the pleasure of the mind is weak in relation to the object that was previously habituated to in accordance with it.üîΩIf one habituates oneself to the opposite of that, then the pleasure of the mind in relation to that object arises in accordance with that habituation.üîΩIf one habituates oneself to the opposite of that, then the pleasure of the mind in relation to that object arises in accordance with that habituation.

original: des na ji ltar rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa snga ma'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa snga ma'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The pleasure of the mind in relation to that object arises in accordance with that habituation.

original: khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu la yang 'dus byas pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu la yang 'dus byas pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In particular, the cause of distinction is also called the conditioned.

original: des na 'dus byas pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can ni khyad par med pa gnyi ga'i yang rgyur bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dus byas pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can ni khyad par med pa gnyi ga'i yang rgyur bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the conditioned, which is the nature of consciousness, is established as the cause of both without distinction.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu nyid 'dus byas pa yin pa des na goms pa zhes bya bas bag chags brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par du byed pa'i rgyu nyid 'dus byas pa yin pa des na goms pa zhes bya bas bag chags brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the cause of distinction is itself conditioned, the so-called habit is not described as a latent impression.

original: de ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the cause of consciousness because it is the nature of the condition as the antecedent.

original: de'i khyad par las shes pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i khyad par las shes pa khyad par du 'gyur ba yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness does not become distinguished from that distinction.

original: 'on kyang de 'jog par byed pa goms par byed pa'i shes pa'i khyad par las shes pa phyi ma khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'jog par byed pa goms par byed pa'i shes pa'i khyad par las shes pa phyi ma khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, the subsequent consciousness becomes distinguished from the distinction of the consciousness that is cultivated, which establishes that.

original: khyad par du byed pa de bzhin du zin kyang de'i bag chags 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni shes pa phyi ma khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin par brjod de /
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa de bzhin du zin kyang de'i bag chags 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni shes pa phyi ma khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin par brjod de /
translated: Just as the prior cognition is the cause of the subsequent cognition, in the same way, the nature of consciousness that is the result of the latent imprint is said to be the cause of the subsequent special cognition.

original: des na bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i sgo nas khyad par can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i khyad par du byed pa po ni goms par byed pa'i shes pa snga ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i sgo nas khyad par can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i khyad par du byed pa po ni goms par byed pa'i shes pa snga ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the prior cognition that cultivates the imprint is the cause of the subsequent special cognition.

original: de ma thag pa'i yid kyang blo'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i yid kyang blo'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: The immediately preceding mind is the cause of the nature of the cognition.

original: 'dus byas pa nyid ni gzhan gyis snga ma'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod de dper na bltas nas gzhag pa'i snam yug phyis bshig nas bkram pa na 'bad pa med par snga ma nyid kyi gnas thabs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i
analyzed: 'dus byas pa nyid ni gzhan gyis snga ma'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod de dper na bltas nas gzhag pa'i snam yug phyis bshig nas bkram pa na 'bad pa med par snga ma nyid kyi gnas thabs kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i
translated: The state of being conditioned is asserted to be the cause of the subsequent state of the prior cognition, just as when a cloth is placed on a stand and later the stand is removed, the cloth is spread out without effort.

original: rgyu 'dus byas pa yin pa de bzhin du snga ma dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'i shes pa'i rgyu ni 'dus byas par 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu 'dus byas pa yin pa de bzhin du snga ma dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'i shes pa'i rgyu ni 'dus byas par 'dod do //
translated: Just as the cause is conditioned, in the same way, the cause of consciousness, which is in conformity with the former, is also conditioned.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
translated: From the immediately preceding condition, it is the nature of cognition,

original: g-yer bag can du 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: g-yer bag can du 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not held to be distracted.

original: de'i phyir g-yer ba'i rgyu ni dngos sam brgyud nas kyang rung ste goms par byed pa'i shes pa snga ma yin par @99b 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yer ba'i rgyu ni dngos sam brgyud nas kyang rung ste goms par byed pa'i shes pa snga ma yin par @99b 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the cause of distraction is the prior cognition that is cultivated, either directly or indirectly.

original: des na goms pas ni goms par byed pa brjod kyi bag chags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na goms pas ni goms par byed pa brjod kyi bag chags ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said to be cultivated through practice, but not through latent impressions.

original: gtan tshigs 'dis ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'dus byas pa'i rgyu can nyid dang / 'dus byas pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'dus byas pa'i rgyu can nyid dang / 'dus byas pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: By this reasoning, it is established that pleasure, etc. have the nature of consciousness, are caused by the conditioned, and the conditioned has the nature of consciousness.

original: 'di nyid kyis rnam par shes pa goms pa'i g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa rjes su byed pa'i phyir dbang po'i bde ba la sogs pa rjes su byed pa'i sba yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus byas pa'i rgyu can du brjod pa yin
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis rnam par shes pa goms pa'i g-yer ba dang zhan pa la sogs pa rjes su byed pa'i phyir dbang po'i bde ba la sogs pa rjes su byed pa'i sba yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus byas pa'i rgyu can du brjod pa yin
translated: Because it is the cause of the pleasure of the sense faculties, etc., it is said that the pleasure of the sense faculties, etc., are the result of the formative forces that have consciousness as their essential nature.

original: te ni ma pa la sogs pa'i ro sngar mi 'dod kyang goms pa las kyang phyis dbang po'i bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te ni ma pa la sogs pa'i ro sngar mi 'dod kyang goms pa las kyang phyis dbang po'i bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because even though one does not desire the taste of molasses, etc. at first, one later experiences the pleasure of the sense faculties as a result of habituation.

original: des na da ltar yid dang dbang po pa dag rgyu gcig nyid kyis blo'i rang bzhin nyid du bsgrubs pa la /
analyzed: des na da ltar yid dang dbang po pa dag rgyu gcig nyid kyis blo'i rang bzhin nyid du bsgrubs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in the proof that the mind and the sense faculties have the nature of consciousness because they have the same cause,

original: pha rol po rang bzhin gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu gcig pa nyid yin pa bzlog pa'i don du ha cang thal brjod par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol po rang bzhin gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu gcig pa nyid yin pa bzlog pa'i don du ha cang thal brjod par byed do //
translated: the opponent states an absurd consequence in order to refute the fact that the reason is the same cause.

original: tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cause is the same in terms of the characteristics of the collection.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: bde ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyad par ni phan tshun nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi khyad par ni phan tshun nyid de /
translated: The difference between pleasure, etc. and pain, etc. is mutual.

original: khyad par de med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par de med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that difference did not exist, it would follow that they are not different.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i yul dang 'brel par khyad par med pa des na ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni shes pa bde ba'i rang bzhin du res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang ldan par res 'ga' ni gnyi ga las bzlog pa
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i yul dang 'brel par khyad par med pa des na ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni shes pa bde ba'i rang bzhin du res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang ldan par res 'ga' ni gnyi ga las bzlog pa
translated: Thus, since there is no difference in the object of eye, form, light, and mental attention, why is consciousness sometimes of the nature of pleasure, sometimes associated with pain, and sometimes associated with neither?

original: dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i don yin gyi cig car du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i don yin gyi cig car du ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the question, not that they are simultaneous.

original: gang gis bde ba la sogs pa srid par 'gyur ba 'gal ba nye bar len pa mtshungs pa rnams cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis bde ba la sogs pa srid par 'gyur ba 'gal ba nye bar len pa mtshungs pa rnams cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that pleasure, etc. exist simultaneously, since they are mutually incompatible.

original: rnam 'grel las 'gal ba'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin na //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las 'gal ba'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin na //
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says that it is not the case that they are mutually incompatible.

original: gzhan dag de ltar dogs pa la bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag de ltar dogs pa la bshad pa /
translated: Others, fearing that, explain it this way.

original: khyad par med par thal ba ma yin te //üîΩgang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa na ste /
analyzed: khyad par med par thal ba ma yin te // gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni de'i tshogs pa nyid kyi tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa na ste /
translated: It does not follow that there is no difference,üîΩbecause the difference of pleasure, etc. is produced by the transformation of the collection of causes of that, i.e., of the feeling, etc.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i rdzas kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i rdzas kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The collection of causes is the collection of causes of that feeling, etc.üîΩWhen that collection is transformed, the feeling, etc. is transformed.üîΩAnd that is the difference.

original: de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa des byas pa'i de'i ngo bo ni nyid @100a * //
analyzed: de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa des byas pa'i de'i ngo bo ni nyid @100a * //
translated: The nature of that is produced by that.

original: de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i phyir ro //
translated: That is why.

original: 'di skad brjod ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod ba yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad ni rdzas gzhan dang 'brel bas byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad ni rdzas gzhan dang 'brel bas byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Not all differences of effect are produced by the connection with another substance.

original: 'on kyang de nyid kyi tshogs pa'i rdzas yongs su gyur pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid kyi tshogs pa'i rdzas yongs su gyur pas byas pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the transformation of the substance of the collection itself produces it.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi gnas skabs gang dang yul gang dang sngar gyi goms ba gang thob nas bde ba skye ba de nye bar gnas na ni 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi gnas skabs gang dang yul gang dang sngar gyi goms ba gang thob nas bde ba skye ba de nye bar gnas na ni 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when the body, the object, and the previous habit are obtained, pleasure arises. If that is present, the effect does not change.üîΩIf an object that produces the experience of pain is present,

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gzhan nye bar gnas sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gzhan nye bar gnas sam /
translated: or if the previous habit is weak,üîΩthe effect changes.

original: sngar gyi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de nyid goms pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar gyi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de nyid goms pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The very same thing that was previously experienced as pleasure becomes the experience of pain through habituation.

original: nye bar gnas sam lus kyi gnas skabs yongs su gyur pa la ni sdug bsngal skye ste /üîΩdes na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i goms pa dang / snang ba dang mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa ni gzhan du mthong la /
analyzed: nye bar gnas sam lus kyi gnas skabs yongs su gyur pa la ni sdug bsngal skye ste / des na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i goms pa dang / snang ba dang mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa ni gzhan du mthong la /
translated: Pain arises from the transformation of the body‚Äôs condition.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang gzhan du mthong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang gzhan du mthong ngo //
translated: The collection of the eye, form, and mental attention that is the cause of pleasure is seen to be different from the collection that is the cause of pain.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa khyad par med par thal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa khyad par med par thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the consequence that there would be no distinction between pleasure, etc. does not follow.

original: yang nang gi khyad par 'di 'dra ba gang las she na /
analyzed: yang nang gi khyad par 'di 'dra ba gang las she na /
translated: Moreover, how is this internal distinction to be understood?

original: brjod pa / gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa nyid kyi khyad par yin gyi de dag las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa nyid kyi khyad par yin gyi de dag las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: We reply: Because the distinction of the very same eye, etc. that is the cause of pleasure is the cause of pain, and no other cause of pain exists apart from them.

original: de'i phyir nang zhes bya ba 'di khyad par du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang zhes bya ba 'di khyad par du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this internal distinction is stated.

original: gdon mi za par 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las skye ba na tshogs pa'i khyad par las rnam pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdon mi za par 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste / mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las skye ba na tshogs pa'i khyad par las rnam pa khyad par can du 'gyur te /
translated: It must be accepted without doubt thatüîΩwhen all eye consciousnesses arise from the eye, form, light, and attention, they become distinctive due to the distinctive features of the collection.

original: sngon po dang ldan pa'i tshogs pas ni de'i rnam pa rang bzhin gzhan dang 'brel par gyur pa las ni rnam pa gzhan du mig skyon dang bcas pa las ni mthong ba mi gsal la /
analyzed: sngon po dang ldan pa'i tshogs pas ni de'i rnam pa rang bzhin gzhan dang 'brel par gyur pa las ni rnam pa gzhan du mig skyon dang bcas pa las ni mthong ba mi gsal la /
translated: A collection possessing blue produces a consciousness possessing blue. From a collection related to another nature, another aspect arises. From an eye with an impairment, a consciousness with an aspect is seen.üîΩFrom a collection that is distorted, a consciousness with a distorted aspect arises.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur na ni phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rig pas mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur na ni phyin ci log ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rig pas mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: And so on. Because it is seen by reasoning.

original: / yang ji ltar khyed bdag dang yid dang 'dus byas pa la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa rnams la /
analyzed: / yang ji ltar khyed bdag dang yid dang 'dus byas pa la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa rnams la /
translated: Moreover, just as you assert that consciousnesses of the self, the mind, and the conditioned arise from their own causes,

original: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa gcig la ring ba dang ring ba ma yin pa'i rgyus the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang log pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i khyad @100b bar shes pa nyid las 'das pa ma yin pa bzhin du shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yang nang gi dga' ba la sogs par goms pa'iüîΩbag chags kyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa gcig la ring ba dang ring ba ma yin pa'i rgyus the tshom dang gtan la phebs pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang log pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i khyad @100b bar shes pa nyid las 'das pa ma yin pa bzhin du shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yang nang gi dga' ba la sogs par goms pa'i bag chags kyis byas pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the distinctions of pleasure and so on that are the nature of consciousness are created by the latent potentialities of cultivating internal joy and so on.

original: gang zhig blo'i rang bzhin gcig las tshor ba dang sems pa dang 'du shes pa la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin du ma skyes par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i don yin no zhes zer ba de ni cher ma 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig blo'i rang bzhin gcig las tshor ba dang sems pa dang 'du shes pa la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin du ma skyes par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i don yin no zhes zer ba de ni cher ma 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the question ‚ÄúHow could many natures of consciousness such as feeling, discernment, and so on arise from a single nature of consciousness?‚Äù is not at all relevant.

original: gang gi phyir chung du chen por byed pa skyon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chung du chen por byed pa skyon du 'gyur na /
translated: If it were a fault to make something small or large,

original: n+ya gro dha'i sa bon las myu gu chen po'am /
analyzed: n+ya gro dha'i sa bon las myu gu chen po'am /
translated: then a sprout would not arise from a nyagrodha seed.

original: rim gyis phung po skyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis phung po skyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it gradually produce the aggregates?

original: me stag tsam nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pas rgyur byas pa me lce 'od rgya chen po dang ldan pa 'byung bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: me stag tsam nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pas rgyur byas pa me lce 'od rgya chen po dang ldan pa 'byung bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could a cause that is the size of a spark produce a result that is a flame with a vast radiance?

original: kho bo cag gis tshad yongs su bgrang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis tshad yongs su bgrang bar mi nus te /
translated: We cannot calculate the measure of the cause and effect,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni rtog gi pa'i tshig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni rtog gi pa'i tshig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
translated: but we do say that this is not the word of the TathƒÅgata.

original: rtog ge pas smras pa ni chung du'am chen po yin yang bla ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'dra bas bskyed pa ni rigs mthun pa nyid du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtog ge pas smras pa ni chung du'am chen po yin yang bla ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'dra bas bskyed pa ni rigs mthun pa nyid du skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The logicians say that whether the cause is small or large, a result is produced that is similar to the cause that is its substantial condition.

original: gzhan las ni rigs mi mthun par skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni 'di 'dra bar tha dad pa byed pa po yin gyi gcig las du ma nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhan las ni rigs mi mthun par skye bar 'gyur ro // de ni 'di 'dra bar tha dad pa byed pa po yin gyi gcig las du ma nyid dam /
translated: A result is produced that is dissimilar from its cause when it is produced from other conditions.üîΩThis is the difference between them.üîΩThe one is the agent, the other is not.üîΩThe one is a cause, the other is not.

original: du ma las kyang gcig skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma las kyang gcig skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: The one is a condition, the other is not.üîΩThe one is a result, the other is not.

original: nas gang zhig las s'a lu dang nas dag tha dad par khyad par med pa la gnas gzhan gcig pu 'dra ba yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhes dris pa na gtan tshigs ni rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la rten par byed kyi gcig dang du
analyzed: nas gang zhig las s'a lu dang nas dag tha dad par khyad par med pa la gnas gzhan gcig pu 'dra ba yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhes dris pa na gtan tshigs ni rgyu 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la rten par byed kyi gcig dang du
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between rice and barley?‚Äù there is no difference in their being different from wheat and so on.

original: ma nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is based on the cause being similar or dissimilar, not on being one or many.

original: de'i phyir blo'i rang bzhin gcig las rnam par shes pa stong phrag skye yang thams cad du de'i nye bar len pa las byung ba ni rigs mi mthun pa 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo'i rang bzhin gcig las rnam par shes pa stong phrag skye yang thams cad du de'i nye bar len pa las byung ba ni rigs mi mthun pa 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though a thousand consciousnesses arise from a single nature of cognition, in all cases it arises from the appropriation of that.

original: gzhan yang skyon brjod pas chog go //
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon brjod pas chog go //
translated: Moreover, it is enough to state the error.

original: dkyus ma'i don ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dkyus ma'i don ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the root text is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar snang ba nas khyim phugs su zhugs pa la phan tshun khyad par sgrub pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams brgyud nas rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba nas khyim phugs su zhugs pa la phan tshun khyad par sgrub pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams brgyud nas rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the case of a person entering a house, the eyes and so on that establish the differences between things generate consciousness indirectly.

original: de las mig la sogs pa ni so sor 'dus pa las skyes pa yin pa des na tshogs pa gcig 'brel pa'i phyir gcig gi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las mig la sogs pa ni so sor 'dus pa las skyes pa yin pa des na tshogs pa gcig 'brel pa'i phyir gcig gi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But since the eye and so on arise from a collection of parts, they are related to a single collection. Therefore, it follows that they are a single nature.

original: bde sogs ci phyir shes ma yin //üîΩzhes @101a * //
analyzed: bde sogs ci phyir shes ma yin // zhes @101a * //
translated: Why is pleasure not a cognizer?

original: gang smras pa de la khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: gang smras pa de la khyad par bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation of the difference from the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa gzhan du bya'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa gzhan du bya'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position should be stated in verse.

original: 'di snyam du yul la sogs pa gcig gis bskyed pa yin pa de lta na yang nye bar len pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir de dag gi tha dad pa ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa las yin no zhe na de ni rigs pa ma
analyzed: 'di snyam du yul la sogs pa gcig gis bskyed pa yin pa de lta na yang nye bar len pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir de dag gi tha dad pa ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa las yin no zhe na de ni rigs pa ma
translated: If the opponent thinks that although pleasure and so on are generated by a single object and so on, they are different because they have different appropriators, this is illogical.

original: yin te / 'du byed skad cig ma lhan cig byed pa so sor 'bras bu skyed par nus pa rnams la /
analyzed: yin te / 'du byed skad cig ma lhan cig byed pa so sor 'bras bu skyed par nus pa rnams la /
translated: This is because in the case of momentary formations that are coemergent causes, each is capable of generating its own effect.

original: nye bar len pa dang gzhan zhes bya bar ni rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang gzhan zhes bya bar ni rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no apprehension of them as different appropriators.

original: nye bar len pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod pa yin yang de lta na yang bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang rgyu gcig pa nyid du the tshom za ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod pa yin yang de lta na yang bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang rgyu gcig pa nyid du the tshom za ste /
translated: Although there is a difference in the appropriated aggregates, still there is doubt that pleasure and so on are of the same cause as consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i tha dad pa rgyu tha dad par byas par 'dod la shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa gcig par yang 'dod pa gang yin pa de de dag rang bzhin 'dra bar 'dod par ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i tha dad pa rgyu tha dad par byas par 'dod la shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa gcig par yang 'dod pa gang yin pa de de dag rang bzhin 'dra bar 'dod par ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: Because the difference in effect is made by the difference in cause, and since you assert that consciousness and pleasure and so on are the same in being appropriated, how could you not assert that they are the same in being of the same nature?

original: des na rang bzhin 'dra ba bkag pa nyid kyis 'di dag nye bar len pa 'dra bar pha rol pos mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin 'dra ba bkag pa nyid kyis 'di dag nye bar len pa 'dra bar pha rol pos mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the opponent does not assert that these are the same in being appropriated, he must assert that they are the same in being of the same nature.

original: de las kyang des nye bar len pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba yin pa las bstan bcos mdzad pas tshogs pa tha mi dad par bstan pa'i 'bad pa ni 'bras bu med par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang des nye bar len pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba yin pa las bstan bcos mdzad pas tshogs pa tha mi dad par bstan pa'i 'bad pa ni 'bras bu med par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the author of the treatise would have made an effort to teach that they are not different in being a collection, but it is understood that this effort would be fruitless.

original: re zhig nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa med do zhes gang brjod pa de la /
analyzed: re zhig nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa med do zhes gang brjod pa de la /
translated: Now, in regard to the statement ‚ÄúThe nature of consciousness as the cause of appropriation does not exist,‚Äù

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid du brjod de /
translated: this is described as the characteristic of the cause of appropriation.

original: gang skye ba ni gang gi rgyun ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyun ldog pa'i chos can de ni cig shos kyi nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: gang skye ba ni gang gi rgyun ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyun ldog pa'i chos can de ni cig shos kyi nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: That which arises is the cause of the cessation of the continuum. The cessation of the continuum is the appropriation of the other.

original: dper na 'jim pa log ba na skye ba'i 'khar gzhong gi nye bar len pa ni 'jim pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa log ba na skye ba'i 'khar gzhong gi nye bar len pa ni 'jim pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when clay ceases, the clay is the appropriation of the arising pot.

original: myu gu'i nye bar len pas bon yin yang dbus kyi cha las myu gu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: myu gu'i nye bar len pas bon yin yang dbus kyi cha las myu gu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But since the sprout arises from the middle part of the seed, is it not the case that not everything ceases? No, it is not.

original: sa bon ni rdzas gcig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sa bon ni rdzas gcig ma yin gyi /
translated: The seed is not a single substance.

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pas de'i pags pa dang sbun pa dang snying po'i cha rnams rgyu tha dad pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pas de'i pags pa dang sbun pa dang snying po'i cha rnams rgyu tha dad pa yin zhing /
translated: But it is an aggregation of subtle particles. Therefore its outer skin, inner pulp, and kernel are different causes.

original: myu gu ni snying po'i cha las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: myu gu ni snying po'i cha las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The sprout comes from the essence of the seed.

original: de bzhin du gtsub shing gi cha gang las me 'byung ba'i rgyun de yang 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsub shing gi cha gang las me 'byung ba'i rgyun de yang 'chad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the fire that comes from the friction of the two pieces of wood is not in the pieces of wood.

original: de bzhin du na ga ra ga'i 'bras bu gcig gi pags pa dang / sha dang / khu @101b ba'i gnas dang / sa bon gyi cha rnams 'brel pa'i phyogs nas bzung ste me tog la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du na ga ra ga'i 'bras bu gcig gi pags pa dang / sha dang / khu @101b ba'i gnas dang / sa bon gyi cha rnams 'brel pa'i phyogs nas bzung ste me tog la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the flower, etc., are different from the seed, because they are produced from the seed, and because they are not the seed.

original: de bzhin du me rdo'i me'i skye gnas kyi zur lcags mag gis bcag pa na chag pa'i 'dzel  ma las me 'byung ba'i rang gi skye gnas ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du me rdo'i me'i skye gnas kyi zur lcags mag gis bcag pa na chag pa'i 'dzel  ma las me 'byung ba'i rang gi skye gnas ldog pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, when a flint is struck, the fire is produced from a certain part of the flint, and this part disappears.

original: me skye ba na bud shing gi snying po'i cha 'ga' zhig ni me'i dngos por 'gyur la /üîΩgser du zhugs pa'i rdul gyi tshogs kyi cha 'ga' zhig ni du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me skye ba na bud shing gi snying po'i cha 'ga' zhig ni me'i dngos por 'gyur la / gser du zhugs pa'i rdul gyi tshogs kyi cha 'ga' zhig ni du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the fire is produced, a certain part of the fuel becomes fire;

original: mer gyur pa yang cha 'ga' zhig ni sol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mer gyur pa yang cha 'ga' zhig ni sol bar 'gyur la /
translated: a certain part of the fuel becomes ash;üîΩa certain part of the fuel is transformed into the heat of the fire.

original: shun pa'i cha 'ga' zhig ni thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: shun pa'i cha 'ga' zhig ni thal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Some parts of the husk become ash.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rdzas rnams la nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rdzas rnams la nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the characteristics of the appropriated aggregates of subtle particles are not mistaken.

original: de ltar na yang chu shel rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid las chu'i rgyun dang / me shel las me dang / gnyis brdabs pa las phrad pa las skyes pa'i sgra dang ; ba sil yab las rlung gi tshogs rab tu 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang chu shel rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid las chu'i rgyun dang / me shel las me dang / gnyis brdabs pa las phrad pa las skyes pa'i sgra dang ; ba sil yab las rlung gi tshogs rab tu 'byung ba dang /
translated: However, some say that since a stream of water arises from a water crystal that is unchanging, fire arises from a fire crystal, sound arises from the conjunction of two things, a breeze arises from a fan,

original: 'o ma las zho dang spris ma dag dang / zho las dar ba dang mar dang / gser rdo las so thog dang gser dag 'byung pa'i phyir kha cig ni nye par len pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o ma las zho dang spris ma dag dang / zho las dar ba dang mar dang / gser rdo las so thog dang gser dag 'byung pa'i phyir kha cig ni nye par len pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: curds and cream arise from milk, yogurt arises from curds, and butter and gold arise from gold ore, some things arise without appropriation.

original: zho la sogs pa yang nye bar len pa mtshungs par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zho la sogs pa yang nye bar len pa mtshungs par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, curds and so on would be similar to appropriation, but that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa la ltos sam mi ltos kyang bla ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa la ltos sam mi ltos kyang bla ste /
translated: Whether or not they depend on coemergent causes,

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig las rang bzhin tha dad pa dag skyes na ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag rgyu med pa'i phyir /üîΩsna tshogs rgyu med par 'gyur ba na thams cad du nye bar len pa tha dad pa la brten par bya ba yin no zhe na de la chu'i sa bon du gyur pa zla ba'i 'od kyi zer chu shel dang reg pas nus pa sad par gyur pa
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig las rang bzhin tha dad pa dag skyes na ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag rgyu med pa'i phyir / sna tshogs rgyu med par 'gyur ba na thams cad du nye bar len pa tha dad pa la brten par bya ba yin no zhe na de la chu'i sa bon du gyur pa zla ba'i 'od kyi zer chu shel dang reg pas nus pa sad par gyur pa
translated: If different natures were produced from a single cause, then difference and non-difference would be without cause.üîΩIf the various things were without cause, then the different appropriated aggregates would not be dependent on anything.

original: kho na dag las chu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: kho na dag las chu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: But water arises only from the moonstone, which is activated by the rays of the moon, which are the seed of water.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How can something arise from a dissimilar cause?

original: bdag gis dus 'di srid kyi bar du rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi shes sam /
analyzed: bdag gis dus 'di srid kyi bar du rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi shes sam /
translated: Have I not known the distinction between similar and dissimilar causes for a long time?

original: gang las gang skye bar mthong pa de ni de dang rigs mthun pa yin la cig shos ni rigs mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las gang skye bar mthong pa de ni de dang rigs mthun pa yin la cig shos ni rigs mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: That from which something is seen to arise is similar to it, and the other is dissimilar.

original: gzugs dang ro dang nus pa dang yon tan tha dad pa chu dang chu shel dag las skyes pa'i chu dag tha dad pa dang bral ba yin no zhes sems dang @102a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dang nus pa dang yon tan tha dad pa chu dang chu shel dag las skyes pa'i chu dag tha dad pa dang bral ba yin no zhes sems dang @102a * //
translated: Water that arises from water crystals and water that arises from water crystals are distinct in terms of their form, taste, potency, and qualities, but they are not distinct in terms of their being water.üîΩ

original: ldan pa su zhig dogs par byed /
analyzed: ldan pa su zhig dogs par byed /
translated: Who would suspect that the water produced from the union of form, taste, potency, and virtue, and from water and water crystal, would be different?

original: chu'i nye bar len par gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i 'od kyi tshogs ni sad pa yin yang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chu'i nye bar len par gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i 'od kyi tshogs ni sad pa yin yang mthong ba gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa nyid do //
translated: The light that produces the appropriation of water is the sun, but the seeing is different.

original: des na ldog pa'i chos can skyed par byed pa ni gzhan yin pa la mthong ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pa'i chos can skyed par byed pa ni gzhan yin pa la mthong ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the producer of the reversed property is one thing, and the seeing is another.

original: me shel dang rig pas nus pa yongs su brtags pas byas pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las me 'byung ba la yang tshul 'di nyid rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: me shel dang rig pas nus pa yongs su brtags pas byas pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs las me 'byung ba la yang tshul 'di nyid rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The same principle applies to the production of fire from the union of the sun‚Äôs rays and a magnifying glass, when the fire is produced by the power of the examination.

original: rlung la yang bla gab dang bcas pa'i khar bzangs kyi rlung med pa'i bar snang gi phyogs su srin dang ras bal la sogs pa gyen du 'gro ba dang thur du 'ong ba rtsom pa las yod par rjes su dpag pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i tshogs pa
analyzed: rlung la yang bla gab dang bcas pa'i khar bzangs kyi rlung med pa'i bar snang gi phyogs su srin dang ras bal la sogs pa gyen du 'gro ba dang thur du 'ong ba rtsom pa las yod par rjes su dpag pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i tshogs pa
translated: Also, in the case of wind, it is inferred that there is a subtle collection of wind particles in the sky, which is not covered by a canopy, because a subtle collection of wind particles is observed in the sky, which is not covered by a canopy, when a mosquito or cotton seed moves upward or downward.

original: phra mo yod pa bsil yab shugs dang ldan par g-yabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa las 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i rlung gi tshogs dmigs pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur bar rtsom pa gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin gyi bsil yab ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phra mo yod pa bsil yab shugs dang ldan par g-yabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa las 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i rlung gi tshogs dmigs pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur bar rtsom pa gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin gyi bsil yab ni ma yin no //
translated: The collection of wind particles that increases through the cooperative cause of vigorously waving a fan is observed as an object of the sense faculty of touch, but the fan is not the substantial cause of the wind.

original: de dag nyid rtsig ngos kyi bu ga'i gseng du zhugs pa brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can dag las sgra 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid rtsig ngos kyi bu ga'i gseng du zhugs pa brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can dag las sgra 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Sound arises from the cooperative cause of the striking of wind particles that enter the space between the walls of a house.

original: skyed par byed pa'i cha ni zad pa'i chos su 'gyur la lhag ma ni 'phyo ba yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i cha ni zad pa'i chos su 'gyur la lhag ma ni 'phyo ba yin no //
translated: The part that generates sound is a quality of impermanent wind particles, and the remaining wind particles continue to move.

original: mthong ba'i sgra bskyed pa'i nus pa gnas thams cad khyab pa shugs dang ldan par brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can ldog pa'i chos su gyur pa'i nye bar len pa de nyid las sgra 'byung ba yin no //üîΩkha cig na re brdabs pa'i rdzas de dag dus kyi mthar thug pa la ltos nas cung zhig 'ga' zhig tu nyams bar mthong ba'i phyir ldog par rjes su dpag pas de nyid las sgra 'byung ba yin no zhes smras pa de ni ltar khyab pa ma yin
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgra bskyed pa'i nus pa gnas thams cad khyab pa shugs dang ldan par brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can ldog pa'i chos su gyur pa'i nye bar len pa de nyid las sgra 'byung ba yin no // kha cig na re brdabs pa'i rdzas de dag dus kyi mthar thug pa la ltos nas cung zhig 'ga' zhig tu nyams bar mthong ba'i phyir ldog par rjes su dpag pas de nyid las sgra 'byung ba yin no zhes smras pa de ni ltar khyab pa ma yin
translated: The sound that is generated from the striking of the two objects is the result of the potential that pervades all the parts of the object that is struck, and it is the result of the object that is struck, which is the dominant condition of the sound.üîΩüîΩSome say: Sound arises from the object that is struck because it is inferred that the object that is struck ceases, since it is seen that the object that is struck diminishes slightly at some point in time.üîΩüîΩThat is not a correct pervasion.

original: te / gang gi phyir rim gyis skye ba'i chos can na chod gzhon nu'i gnas phrad pa dang / rlung gis 'thab bar byas pa'i lo ma dag las kyang sgra 'byung ba de la 'ga' zhig tu cung zad nyams pa ni rtogs pa med ba de'i phyir snga ma nyid rigs so //
