original: gzhan ni nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can sgra phra mor gyur pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par sems te /
analyzed: gzhan ni nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa brdabs pa'i lhan cig byed pa can sgra phra mor gyur pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par sems te /
translated: The other says that sound is subtle matter, which is the material cause of sound, and that it exists pervading space, and is the simultaneous cause of sound.

original: de yang yod par dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang med pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir snga ma nyid @102b kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod par dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang med pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir snga ma nyid @102b kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: But that is untenable, because there is no reason to apprehend that it exists. Therefore the former explanation is free of fault.

original: 'o ma yang 'o ma dang chu'i cha gnyis te /üîΩdper na zho'i steng gi spris ma'am snying po'i cha ni mar gyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma yang 'o ma dang chu'i cha gnyis te / dper na zho'i steng gi spris ma'am snying po'i cha ni mar gyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Milk is a combination of two parts: milk and water.üîΩFor example, the part of milk that is cream or essence is the cause of butter.

original: yang na 'o ma'i mgrin pa dang 'o ma'i cha yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'o ma'i mgrin pa dang 'o ma'i cha yin no //
translated: Or, the part of milk that is the neck of milk is the cause of butter.

original: de la chu'i cha las ni zhog chur 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du zho las mar dang mar ma yin pa'i char 'gyur ba yang rdzas kyi rgyu tha dad pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: de la chu'i cha las ni zhog chur 'gyur ro // de bzhin du zho las mar dang mar ma yin pa'i char 'gyur ba yang rdzas kyi rgyu tha dad pa kho na las yin no //
translated: From the part of water, curd is produced.üîΩSimilarly, from curd, butter and non-butter are produced, and they are different substantial causes.

original: mar las snying po dang snying po ma yin par 'gyur ba yang de nyid las yin no //
analyzed: mar las snying po dang snying po ma yin par 'gyur ba yang de nyid las yin no //
translated: From butter, essence and non-essence are produced, and they are also different substantial causes.

original: gser rdo las so thog dang rdzas kyi char 'gyur ba yang de bzhin te phyogs 'dis gzhan yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gser rdo las so thog dang rdzas kyi char 'gyur ba yang de bzhin te phyogs 'dis gzhan yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, hail and rain fall from a gold mine. By this example, one should understand the other cases.

original: gzhan yang skyed par byed pas khyad par du bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad nang du sdud par nus pa'i bdag nyid gang las skye ba de ni nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyed par byed pas khyad par du bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad nang du sdud par nus pa'i bdag nyid gang las skye ba de ni nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the appropriator is that from which all the particular effects that are to be established by the agent arise, and which has the nature of being able to gather all the particular effects that are to be established by the agent.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pas phan par bya ba'i rang bzhin thams cad ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pas phan par bya ba'i rang bzhin thams cad ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid /
translated: For example, all the natures that are beneficial to the focal object of visual consciousness and so on are the nature of the mind.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i phyir te nye bar len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i phyir te nye bar len pa bzhin no //
translated: They arise from the immediately preceding condition, like the appropriator.

original: gang yang so sor nus pa rnams la nye bar len pa'i don gang zhig yin zhes smras pa de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang so sor nus pa rnams la nye bar len pa'i don gang zhig yin zhes smras pa de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, someone might say, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of appropriator for those that are individually capable?‚Äù

original: rnam pa gcig pa nyid kyis gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa don bya ba byed pa gcig pa rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du nges par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa nyid kyis gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa don bya ba byed pa gcig pa rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du nges par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The object that is understood as one by virtue of having one aspect is ascertained as the entity of cause and effect that performs the same function.

original: skad cig ma gcig la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not ascertained as the entity of cause and effect in a single moment,

original: tshu rol mthong ba 'am gzhan gyis kyang rung ste rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba 'am gzhan gyis kyang rung ste rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those with limited vision or others do not comprehend the forward and reverse processes.

original: gang gis na 'dus pa'i yul can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po'i yul can ma yin par 'gyur ba 'dus pa gcig pa nyid bkag pa na 'dus pa can rnams kyang bkag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na 'dus pa'i yul can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po'i yul can ma yin par 'gyur ba 'dus pa gcig pa nyid bkag pa na 'dus pa can rnams kyang bkag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When the sameness of the collection is refuted, the collection itself is not refuted, because the entity of cause and effect in the object of the collection is not the entity of cause and effect in the object.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dus pa'i yul can la ni ji skad brjod pa'i ldog ba'i chos su gyur pa'i nye bar len pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dus pa'i yul can la ni ji skad brjod pa'i ldog ba'i chos su gyur pa'i nye bar len pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yin par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that the subject that unifies the entities of cause and effect has a specific nature that generates the appropriated that is the opposite of what was said.

original: nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba gang brjod pa de yang rnam pa 'dis bsgrubs par blta ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba gang brjod pa de yang rnam pa 'dis bsgrubs par blta ste /
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúthe sameness of appropriation is not established,‚Äù that is also established by this method.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi rgyun ma log pa nyid las bde ba la sogs pa skye ba na de ni nye bar len pa ma yin no //üîΩyul gyi phyogs gcig @103a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi rgyun ma log pa nyid las bde ba la sogs pa skye ba na de ni nye bar len pa ma yin no // yul gyi phyogs gcig @103a * //
translated: Thus, when pleasure and so on arise from the noncessation of the continuum of the object, it is not the appropriated.

original: log pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: log pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the cessation of one part of the object.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not seen.

original: 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable.

original: yul gcig rgyur gyur pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag rgyud tha dad par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig rgyur gyur pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag rgyud tha dad par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure and pain that are the cause of one object arise in different continua.

original: dbang po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the sense faculty.

original: de log na phyis mig gi rnam shes mi skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de log na phyis mig gi rnam shes mi skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it ceases, later eye consciousness would not arise.

original: phyogs gcig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not one of these,

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes par rnam par 'gyur ba thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes par rnam par 'gyur ba thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that its effect, consciousness, would be transformed.

original: des na lhag mar gyur pa rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i chos su gyur pa na bde ba la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir de ni nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lhag mar gyur pa rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i chos su gyur pa na bde ba la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir de ni nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since pleasure, etc. arise when consciousness, which is the remainder, is transformed, it is the appropriator.

original: 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i don du slob dpon gyis dbang po la sogs pa thams cad rgyu'i mtshan nyid du sbyar bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i don du slob dpon gyis dbang po la sogs pa thams cad rgyu'i mtshan nyid du sbyar bar mdzad do //
translated: In order to prove just this, the Acarya has applied the definition of cause to all faculties, etc.

original: dbang po dang yul dag rgyun ma log pa las bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa na rgyun log pa gang yin pa de nye bar len par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dag rgyun ma log pa las bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa na rgyun log pa gang yin pa de nye bar len par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: If pleasure, etc. are generated from the faculties and objects that have not ceased, how can that which has ceased be established as the appropriator?

original: nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis so //
translated: There are two definitions of appropriator.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang nye bar lan pa mtshungs pa'i phyir blo'i rang bzhin grub pa na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang nye bar lan pa mtshungs pa'i phyir blo'i rang bzhin grub pa na /
translated: Since pleasure, etc. are similar to consciousness in being appropriated, when the nature of the intellect is established,

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin par grub pa yin te /
translated: Pleasure, etc. are established as consciousness,

original: myong ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di gcig nyid de zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di gcig nyid de zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is explained that ‚Äúthis is the one nature of experience.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rnam pa tha mi dang kyang nye bar len pa tha dad pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yin pas rgyu tha dad pa nyid ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa kho na las yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rnam pa tha mi dang kyang nye bar len pa tha dad pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yin pas rgyu tha dad pa nyid ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa kho na las yin la /
translated: ‚Äù And, from different effects, there is a difference in causes, because different effects arise from different substantial causes.

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams las ni khyad par skye ba yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams las ni khyad par skye ba yin no //
translated: But from the cooperating causes, there is the arising of a difference.

original: des na thams cad du tha dad par byed pa'i gtso bo ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa nyid yin par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: des na thams cad du tha dad par byed pa'i gtso bo ni nye bar len pa tha dad pa nyid yin par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the primary difference-maker is the difference in substantial cause.

original: gang zhig gang dang rgyu tha mi dad pa de ni de las rang bzhin tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang rgyu tha mi dad pa de ni de las rang bzhin tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: That which is not a different cause from something is not a different nature from it,

original: dper na s'a lu'i myu gu gcig las gzhan pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i myu gu gcig las gzhan pa yin no //
translated: like a rice sprout, which is not different from a rice seed.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa las rgyu tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa las rgyu tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: And pleasure, etc. are not different causes from consciousness.

original: khyad par rgyu'i tha mi dad pa nyid la ni rgyu dang ldan pa spyi'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: khyad par rgyu'i tha mi dad pa nyid la ni rgyu dang ldan pa spyi'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: In particular, the non-difference of the cause is pervaded by the general nature of possessing a cause.

original: rgyu tha dad pa med par 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na yang sna tshogs rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med par 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na yang sna tshogs rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If an effect were to be different when the cause is not different, then the variety would be causeless.

original: khyab par byed pa med pas rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid de las ldog pa na rang bzhin tha mi dad pas khyab pa'i phyir na rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med pas rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid de las ldog pa na rang bzhin tha mi dad pas khyab pa'i phyir na rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Since there is no pervader, the non-difference of the cause is negated, and since there is no difference in nature, it is a nature.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa @103b bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nang du 'gyur ba yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa @103b bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nang du 'gyur ba yin na ni //
translated: If pleasure, etc. were the basis of self-grasping on the inside,

original: rnam par shes pa dang nye bar len pa gcig par dogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang nye bar len pa gcig par dogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: wouldn't consciousness and appropriation be the same?

original: gang gi phyir nang ste bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba de'i rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nang ste bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir 'gyur ba de'i rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it would be the basis of self-grasping on the inside, its own nature is not that.

original: 'on kyang sgra la sogs pa phyi rol bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra la sogs pa phyi rol bzhin yin no //
translated: However, it is like external things such as sound, etc.

original: des na khyod kyis kyang de dag bzhin du 'di dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang rgyu gcig bar dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis kyang de dag bzhin du 'di dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang rgyu gcig bar dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, you should not suspect that these are the same substance as consciousness.

original: kho bo cag la ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin nam mi rtag pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba skyes bu rtag pa'i shes pa yod pa dang rgyu mtshungs pa nyid du gal 'gyur /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin nam mi rtag pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba skyes bu rtag pa'i shes pa yod pa dang rgyu mtshungs pa nyid du gal 'gyur /
translated: For us, there is no similarity between the arising of a transformation of an impermanent nature and the cognition of a permanent person.

original: gal te yang na nang gi bdag nyid kyi blo yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pa la de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin ni skyes bus spyad par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang na nang gi bdag nyid kyi blo yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pa la de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin ni skyes bus spyad par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if the internal cognition has the nature of the three qualities, its nature is not something that a person can experience.

original: 'on kyang de la gnas pa'i yul gyi snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gnas pa'i yul gyi snang ba yin te /
translated: However, it is the appearance of an object that abides in it.

original: blo la shar ba'i don ni skyes bus shes par byed do zhes gang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: blo la shar ba'i don ni skyes bus shes par byed do zhes gang smras pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the meaning that arises in the mind is what a person cognizes.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na don bzhin du bdag nyid kyi gzugs brnyan ni blo la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na don bzhin du bdag nyid kyi gzugs brnyan ni blo la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not different, like the object, the reflection of its own form does not exist in the mind.

original: des na nyams su myong bzhin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong bzhin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, such things as the experience of pleasure are external objects.

original: de ltar na bkag pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can yin pa bkag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na bkag pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can yin pa bkag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In this way, the mere negation of the experience of pleasure, etc., as being conscious is implied by the negation itself.

original: nyams su myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba des na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba des na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
translated: But since the experience of pleasure, etc., is the nature of the aspect of pleasure, etc., it is the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.üîΩAnd it is external.

original: phyi rol du yang 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs dog par byas nas /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs dog par byas nas /
translated: Having thus restricted the scope of the opponent‚Äôs words,

original: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi zhes smras te /
analyzed: sems pa can yang ma yin gyi zhes smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is not conscious.‚Äù

original: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir skyes bu ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin ba des na bde ba la sogs pa sems pa'i rang bzhin du gal 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir skyes bu ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin ba des na bde ba la sogs pa sems pa'i rang bzhin du gal 'gyur /
translated: Since it would follow, absurdly, that the person would be the transformation of the experience of pleasure, etc., the person does not take on the aspect of pleasure, etc. Therefore, how could pleasure, etc., be the nature of consciousness?

original: de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni yul la longs spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni yul la longs spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: The taking on of its aspect is not the enjoyment of the object.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu dang yul dag gis gzugs brnyan blo gcig 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu dang yul dag gis gzugs brnyan blo gcig 'dres pa yin no //
translated: But the reflection is a single cognition that is mixed with the person and the object.

original: 'o na nang du rten par gsal ba ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na nang du rten par gsal ba ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is it that the reflection is clearly perceived internally?

original: bde ba la sogs pa de dag gis bdag nyid du gyur pa gang dag yin pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba sgra dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de dag gis bdag nyid du gyur pa gang dag yin pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba sgra dang gzugs la sogs pa de dag ste /
translated: The reflection is the sound and form, etc., that are the transformations of pleasure, etc., which are the entities that are the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag nyams su @104a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro // de dag nyams su @104a * //
translated: The nature is the cause of the transformations because it is the universal of the transformations.üîΩThe experience of those transformations is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: myong ba las bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin la de las de nyams su myong bar rtogs pa ste shes shing nges pa yin no //
analyzed: myong ba las bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba yin la de las de nyams su myong bar rtogs pa ste shes shing nges pa yin no //
translated: From that experience, one understands, knows, and ascertains the experience.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nang du myong bar nges ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nang du myong bar nges ba ni /
translated: The internal experience of pleasure, etc., is ascertained

original: yul snang ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir yin gyi nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul snang ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir yin gyi nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the object is the final appearance, not because it becomes the nature of the experience.

original: gzhan ni grangs can no //
analyzed: gzhan ni grangs can no //
translated: The other is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: snga ma'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig mi rigs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig mi rigs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the assertion of the former unreasonable,

original: bde ba la sogs pa don gyi bdag nyid du 'dod ba de'i ltar na yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa don gyi bdag nyid du 'dod ba de'i ltar na yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: but also it is unreasonable that pleasure, etc. are the nature of objects.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / phyi rol sgra la sogs pa khyad par med na yang ste /üîΩrnam pa gcig yin yang dga' ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / phyi rol sgra la sogs pa khyad par med na yang ste / rnam pa gcig yin yang dga' ba ste /
translated: It is said: Even though external objects, such as sound, etc. are undifferentiated,

original: bde ba'i rnam pa dang yongs su gdung ba sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag goms pa las te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa dang yongs su gdung ba sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag goms pa las te /
translated: there is pleasure, etc. from the cultivation of the aspects of pleasure and the aspects of pain, such as heat.

original: bsgoms pa'i khyad par las khyad par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i khyad par las khyad par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the difference is due to the difference in cultivation,

original: tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: because there is a difference. This is the reason.

original: don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dag ste tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dag ste tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are not the nature of objects, which is the result of valid knowledge.

original: gal te goms pas khyad par du 'gyur ba de lta na yang don gyi rang bzhin ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te goms pas khyad par du 'gyur ba de lta na yang don gyi rang bzhin ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if there is a difference due to cultivation, how can they not be the nature of objects?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
translated: The explanation: ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the meaning of the reason.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa ste /
translated: That which exists in the nature of sound, etc.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi khyad par snang ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi khyad par snang ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the nature of pleasure, etc. were the appearance of the nature of sound, etc., this is the meaning.

original: gzugs brnyan dang yul tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i phyir bdag nyid smos pa byas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang yul tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i phyir bdag nyid smos pa byas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used because the reflection is conceived as not different from the object.

original: don ni gal te sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba yin na zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: don ni gal te sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba yin na zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning is: if the nature of sound, etc. were the appearance.

original: de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa khyad par med pa la ste gcig nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa khyad par med pa la ste gcig nyid la'o //
translated: Then, in the case of sound, etc., which are undifferentiated, i.e., which are one.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa dang btang snyoms la brten par goms par bya ba'i phyi rol la'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa dang btang snyoms la brten par goms par bya ba'i phyi rol la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDue to the difference in habituation‚Äù means in the external world, which is the object of habituation based on benefit, harm, and indifference.

original: dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba ni bde ba dang mi bde ba'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba ni bde ba dang mi bde ba'i snang ba'o //
translated: Delight and distress are the appearances of pleasure and pain.

original: khyad par ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'am 'phel pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'am 'phel pa ste /
translated: The difference is the transformation or increase of the object.

original: rtogs par byed pa gcig la rim gyis sam mang po rnams la cig car du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa gcig la rim gyis sam mang po rnams la cig car du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the object is not gradual in one cognition, nor is it simultaneous in many cognitions.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi snang ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi snang ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the object such as blue is the form.

original: de nyid khyad par du 'gyur bas khyad par te mngon sum gyis bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du 'gyur bas khyad par te mngon sum gyis bzung ba'o //
translated: That itself is the difference, grasped by perception, because it is transformed.

original: @104b sngon po la sogs pas bskyed pa de goms pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma yin pa dang / ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang des byas pa yin na goms pas khyad par du mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @104b sngon po la sogs pas bskyed pa de goms pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma yin pa dang / ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang des byas pa yin na goms pas khyad par du mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the appearance of blue, etc. is not increased or decreased by cultivation, and is not of the nature of yellow, etc., so too, if it is produced by that, it would not be transformed by cultivation, but rather by the thing itself.

original: gang yang dbang po gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'am /
analyzed: gang yang dbang po gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'am /
translated: And also, the clarity or unclarity of the sense faculty,

original: thag nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pas byas pa'i khyad par de ni sngon po'i rnam pa las ma 'das pa de'i phyir snang ba de sngon po'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba yin te /
analyzed: thag nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pas byas pa'i khyad par de ni sngon po'i rnam pa las ma 'das pa de'i phyir snang ba de sngon po'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba yin te /
translated: The difference between the object being near or far is not beyond the aspect of blue. Therefore, the appearance of blue conforms to the presence or absence of the object of blue.

original: 'on kyang rdul dang 'brel pa'i sngon po thag ring po nas bzung ba'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul dang 'brel pa'i sngon po thag ring po nas bzung ba'am /
translated: However, the blue that is related to the particles is apprehended from a distance,

original: dbang po'i khyad par gyis gsal bar mi snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: dbang po'i khyad par gyis gsal bar mi snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: or it is not clearly seen due to the difference in the sense faculty.

original: sgra la ni goms pa las 'dod pa'i bdag nyid thams cad ldog cing bzlog par yang 'jug pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra la ni goms pa las 'dod pa'i bdag nyid thams cad ldog cing bzlog par yang 'jug pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of sound, because all the aspects of sound that are desired are stopped and reversed through habituation, the presence or absence of sound does not conform to the presence or absence of the appearance of sound.

original: 'dir khyad par ni 'di 'dra bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir khyad par ni 'di 'dra bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid snang ba de ni goms pa la ltos pa med par de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid snang ba de ni goms pa la ltos pa med par de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which appears as the nature of something conforms to the presence or absence of that nature without depending on habituation.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of blue, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de snang ba'i tha snyad la ni yul nges pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de snang ba'i tha snyad la ni yul nges pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te ;
translated: Because in the case of the appearance of that, the determination of the object is all-pervasive,

original: 'di ni sngon po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes tha snyad nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes tha snyad nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the determination of the convention, ‚ÄúThis is blue, not something else.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa yang de snang ba ni thams cad la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa spangs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i tha snyad la de'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas khyab bo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa yang de snang ba ni thams cad la snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa spangs par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na de'i bdag nyid snang ba'i tha snyad la de'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas khyab bo //
translated: And if it does not follow the invariable concomitance, then the appearance of that would be the appearance of everything, and the determination would be abandoned.üîΩTherefore, by the non-apprehension of the pervader, when there is the exclusion from the discordant side, the appearance of that nature is pervaded by the invariable concomitance with the particular of the convention.

original: des na 'gal ba khyab pa dmigs pas phyi rol la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa 'gog pa thal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba khyab pa dmigs pas phyi rol la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa 'gog pa thal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the apprehension of the pervasion of the contradictory, it follows that the exclusion of the appearance that does not rely on external objects is the particular of the convention.

original: thal ba bzlog pa'i khyab pa sgrub pa yang thal ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa sgrub pa gnag yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: thal ba bzlog pa'i khyab pa sgrub pa yang thal ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa sgrub pa gnag yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: The proof of the pervasion of the contrapositive of the reductio is the same as the proof of the pervasion of the reductio.üîΩThe pervasion is as follows: Whatever is not dependent on external objects and is a result of the maturation of habitual propensities is not a consciousness that perceives external objects.

original: gang gi phyir thal ba las bzlog ba'i gtan tshigs ni gang dag phyi rol la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de dag ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid snang ba ma yin te zhes khyab par @105a * //üîΩbyed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thal ba las bzlog ba'i gtan tshigs ni gang dag phyi rol la mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de dag ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid snang ba ma yin te zhes khyab par @105a * // byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
translated: The reason is contradictory because it is impossible for something to be both dependent and independent.

original: yang ba blo nyid ces slob dpon gyis ji ltar bkod pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: yang ba blo nyid ces slob dpon gyis ji ltar bkod pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Or, as the master [Candrakƒ´rti] has stated, ‚Äúbecause it is a consciousness.‚Äù This is an autonomous reason.

original: phyi rol gyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid snang ba la khyab par grub pa na gnyi ga la yang 'brel pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid snang ba la khyab par grub pa na gnyi ga la yang 'brel pa grub pa yin te /
translated: When it is established that whatever is a result of the maturation of habitual propensities and is not dependent on external objects is necessarily a consciousness that perceives an aspect that is of the nature of that [habitual propensity] and is not a consciousness that perceives external objects, then the relation between the reason and the predicate is established in both parties of the debate.

original: rang bzhin la ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i chos la khyab par bya ba dang 'gal bas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol snang ba dgag pa nyid la yang de'i khyad par gyi rjes su mi byed pa khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i chos la khyab par bya ba dang 'gal bas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol snang ba dgag pa nyid la yang de'i khyad par gyi rjes su mi byed pa khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervader is incompatible with the property that is pervaded, the pervasion is established. And because the pervader is incompatible with the non-concomitance of the particular of that [pervaded property] in the mere negation of external appearances.

original: de'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog pa 'chad de /üîΩgang dag sgra la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par la mi ltos par goms par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su mthun pa de dag ni nang na gnas pa'i blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bya bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni thal ba bzlog pa 'chad de / gang dag sgra la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par la mi ltos par goms par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su mthun pa de dag ni nang na gnas pa'i blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bya bsdus pa'o //
translated: The phrase from its particular explains the reversal of the consequence.üîΩ The phrase those that are not dependent on the particular of that nature of sound, etc., are the cognition that exists internally is the conclusion of the reason.

original: gang dag gang gang gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba de dag ni nang nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gang gang gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par mi ltos par goms pa'i khyad par yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba de dag ni nang nyid yin te /
translated: Those that are not dependent on the particular of the nature of anything are the cognition that exists internally, because they are related to the existence and non-existence of the particular of habituation.

original: shes rab la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like wisdom, etc.

original: shes rab ni shes par bya ba rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni shes par bya ba rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of the knowable.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba brtse ba dang yid byung ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba brtse ba dang yid byung ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes love, compassion, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po khyad par med kyang goms pa'i khyad bar gyi rjes su byed bas shes bya'i rang bzhin snang ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang nang nyid yin zhing phyi rol gyi bdag nyid snang ba ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po khyad par med kyang goms pa'i khyad bar gyi rjes su byed bas shes bya'i rang bzhin snang ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang nang nyid yin zhing phyi rol gyi bdag nyid snang ba ni ma yin no
translated: Although there is no difference in the objective entity, the appearance of the nature of the knowable is not due to the object, but rather is due to the difference of cultivation.

original: // de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: // de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, pleasure, etc. are also like this.

original: 'brel pa grub pa ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa ni brjod zin to //
translated: The establishment of the relation has already been explained.

original: de ltar na nang nyid yin par bsgrubs nas phyi rol la yin yang sems can du khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar na nang nyid yin par bsgrubs nas phyi rol la yin yang sems can du khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having thus established that the appearance is internal, he explains that it is also accepted as sentient, in order to demonstrate that it is not external.

original: nang yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: nang yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems pa'ang yin no //
translated: It is not only internal, but also sentient.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad ni bsags pa'o //üîΩgtan tshigs bshad ba myong phyir te /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad ni bsags pa'o // gtan tshigs bshad ba myong phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a collection.üîΩThe reason is stated: because of experience.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa myong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa myong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure, etc. are to be experienced.

original: gal te myong bar bya ba yin du zad mod /
analyzed: gal te myong bar bya ba yin du zad mod /
translated: If they are to be experienced,

original: de lta na yang sems pa can du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang sems pa can du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can they be mental?

original: bshad pa / de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de lta bu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de lta bu ste /
translated: The response: That which is its nature is just like that.

original: de ltar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: des na don @105b myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don @105b myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the experience of objects.

original: gang zhig don gang gi rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig don gang gi rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is not the nature of an object does not experience it. This is the meaning.

original: tha ma'i tshig dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to explain the final word, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù means the meaning of reason.

original: yul can gang zhig yul gang gi ste /
analyzed: yul can gang zhig yul gang gi ste /
translated: That which is the subject of an object,

original: de nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bur gyur pa myong ba ma yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bur gyur pa myong ba ma yin no zhe na'o //
translated: But it is not experienced in the aspect of that.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ces smos pa de nyid yang smos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ces smos pa de nyid yang smos pa'o //
translated: That is, that which is mentioned in the phrase ‚Äúthat which is experienced‚Äù is mentioned again in the phrase ‚Äúthat is experienced.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du myong ba gang zhig yul gyi rnam pa mi 'dzin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du myong ba gang zhig yul gyi rnam pa mi 'dzin pa de ni de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In other words, the experience that does not grasp the aspect of an object is not the experience of that object.

original: dper brjod pa phan tshun gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dper brjod pa phan tshun gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The example is the nature of the other.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba gang la snang ba med pa'i myong ba de ni gzhan myong bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba gang la snang ba med pa'i myong ba de ni gzhan myong bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The experience of pleasure, etc., that does not appear as the experience of another is not the experience of that other.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba la bde ba'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba la bde ba'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir de'i myong bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The experience of pain is not the experience of pleasure, because the aspect of pleasure does not exist in the experience of pain.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas kyang don 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas kyang don 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: This meaning is also demonstrated through the method of difference.

original: gang zhig gang gi myong bar byed pa ni de'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi myong bar byed pa ni de'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is the experience of something has the aspect of that.

original: grangs can la dpe 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: grangs can la dpe 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the SƒÅ·πÉkhya have no example at all.

original: dpe med kyang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid dper byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe med kyang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid dper byed pa yin te /
translated: The non-example is also the example of the valid cognition that does the refuting.

original: sgrub par byed pa la dpes ni dgos cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la dpes ni dgos cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest purpose in proving with an example.

original: de la myong bar byed pa la nges pa'i yul can nyid kyis khyab pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la myong bar byed pa la nges pa'i yul can nyid kyis khyab pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
translated: As for that, the pervasion by the certainty of the object of experience is established by experience.

original: 'dra ba med na ni khyab par byed pa des pa med pa'i phyir myong bar byed pa med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'brel pa grub bo //
analyzed: 'dra ba med na ni khyab par byed pa des pa med pa'i phyir myong bar byed pa med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'brel pa grub bo //
translated: If there is no similarity, then because there is no pervasion by that pervader, the non-existence of the experience is pervaded by the non-observation of the pervader. Thus the relation is established.

original: myong bar byed pa nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gzhag pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'i myong bar byed pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: myong bar byed pa nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gzhag pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'i myong bar byed pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to posit the reason for the similarity of the experience itself, in order to eliminate the doubt of others, it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the experience of that.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi myong bar byed pa dang myong bar byed pa nges pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon par la ba gsal bar gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi myong bar byed pa dang myong bar byed pa nges pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon par la ba gsal bar gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The reason for the relation of the experience and the experiencer of such a nature is the clarity of the manifestation.

original: gal te yang grangs can gyi rtag tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu mngon par mi gsal ba las mngon par gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang yul la chags pa'i nye bar bslad pa ni gsal ba'i dngos po tha snyad du bya
analyzed: gal te yang grangs can gyi rtag tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu mngon par mi gsal ba las mngon par gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang yul la chags pa'i nye bar bslad pa ni gsal ba'i dngos po tha snyad du bya
translated: The mind is the basis of conventional activity because it is the cause of the mind‚Äôs activity.üîΩThe mind is the basis of conventional activity because it is the cause of the mind‚Äôs activity.

original: bar gzung ba yin la tha snyad du bya ba'i gnas skabs kyi don gyi dbang gis yin te /üîΩdon yod pa la @106a * //üîΩsems pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
