original: 'dir 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes don gyi khyad par dang 'brel pas myong ba'i tha snyad du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes don gyi khyad par dang 'brel pas myong ba'i tha snyad du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, the object to be established is that which is connected with a particular object, such as ‚ÄúThis is blue, not yellow,‚Äù and is the basis for the convention of experience.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The object to be established is not the means of establishing it.

original: don gyi khyad par gyi 'brel pa las gzhan du gyur pa 'di ni myong pa'o zhes bya ba gsal pa'i rang bzhin tsam 'di ni rgyu mtshan nyid du nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par gyi 'brel pa las gzhan du gyur pa 'di ni myong pa'o zhes bya ba gsal pa'i rang bzhin tsam 'di ni rgyu mtshan nyid du nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason for the mere clear nature of the experience, which is different from the connection with a particular object.

original: mngon par gsal ba 'di ni dbang po rnams dang / yid dang blo dang yul rnams la yang rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba 'di ni dbang po rnams dang / yid dang blo dang yul rnams la yang rag las pa yin te /
translated: This manifestation depends on the sense faculties, the mind, the intellect, and the objects.

original: dbang po dang blo la sogs pa med par ni de la myong bar byed pa nyid du tha snyad du rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang blo la sogs pa med par ni de la myong bar byed pa nyid du tha snyad du rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without the sense faculties, the intellect, and so on, it cannot be cognized as the basis for the convention of experience.

original: de bas na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan rang bzhin tsam mngon par gsal ba yin pas dbang po la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan rang bzhin tsam mngon par gsal ba yin pas dbang po la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the reason for the relation is the mere nature of the manifest, it would also follow for the sense faculties and so on.

original: rgyu de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: For that reason, there is similarity.

original: de'i myong ba ni de myong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i myong ba ni de myong ba ste /
translated: The experience of that is the experience of that.

original: de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is its characteristic.

original: yul gyi 'brel pa nges pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba nyid yin no //üîΩda ni gud na gnas pa 'ga' zhig slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: yul gyi 'brel pa nges pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba nyid yin no // da ni gud na gnas pa 'ga' zhig slob dpon gyis /
translated: The cause of ascertaining the relation to the object is similarity.

original: grangs can la yang 'dra ba bsgrub pa mi 'thad par mthong ba nas de dang 'dra bar yang sems pa can la ji ltar zhe na zhes smos te /
analyzed: grangs can la yang 'dra ba bsgrub pa mi 'thad par mthong ba nas de dang 'dra bar yang sems pa can la ji ltar zhe na zhes smos te /
translated: Now, the master, seeing that it is untenable to establish similarity for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya as well, says, ‚ÄúHow is it for the mind-possessor in the same way?‚Äù

original: gal te 'dra ba med na myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de ltar na yang grangs can gyi shes pa yod pa la 'dra ba ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med na myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de ltar na yang grangs can gyi shes pa yod pa la 'dra ba ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If similarity is untenable without experience, then even for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, similarity is untenable for the existent consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i dus las sngar 'dra ba de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang de nyams su myong ba'i dus su snga ma yang snga ma'i rang bzhin las nyams pa med pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i dus las sngar 'dra ba de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang de nyams su myong ba'i dus su snga ma yang snga ma'i rang bzhin las nyams pa med pa ste ;
translated: Because prior to the time of experience, it is not the same as that self, then later, at the time of experience, it is not the case that the former is not impaired from its previous nature.

original: ldog pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of its non-cessation is the same.

original: gang gi phyir 'dra ba de ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dra ba de ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because that which is the same has the nature of being conscious.

original: de sngar ma gyur na ni thams cad du don te mi myong bar thal lo //
analyzed: de sngar ma gyur na ni thams cad du don te mi myong bar thal lo //
translated: If it did not exist previously, then it would follow that it would never experience objects.

original: myong ba'i dus na skye ba yin na ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bas mi rtag par 'gyur na rtag par yang @106b 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: myong ba'i dus na skye ba yin na ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bas mi rtag par 'gyur na rtag par yang @106b 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If it were produced at the time of experience, then the nature of the person would change and it would become impermanent, but it is also asserted to be permanent.

original: de'i phyir grangs can la myong bar byed pa nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs can la myong bar byed pa nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to posit the Samkhyas‚Äô consciousness as the reason for the same.üîΩThis is another fault of theirs.

original: 'di ni 'di'i nyes pa gzhan yin te zhes bya ba la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i nyes pa gzhan yin te zhes bya ba la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this.

original: 'dir grangs can gyi lta ba sgrub pa'i skabs ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can gyi lta ba sgrub pa'i skabs ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the occasion to establish the SƒÅ·πÉkhya view.

original: 'on kyang myong bar byed pa nyid brtag pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang myong bar byed pa nyid brtag pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: However, this is the occasion to examine the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: 'dra ba de'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gzhag pa na rang gi nus pas ji snyed grangs can la nyes pa gzhan grub pa de yang kho bo cag gi bsam pa grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba de'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gzhag pa na rang gi nus pas ji snyed grangs can la nyes pa gzhan grub pa de yang kho bo cag gi bsam pa grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: When similarity is posited as the reason, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs other faults are established by the power of our argument. We accept that, because it establishes our own position.

original: skabs kyi don btang ba ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni 'dra ba med par ni myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩ'di snyam du rtag tu yod pa'i skyes bu ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nas /
analyzed: skabs kyi don btang ba ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni 'dra ba med par ni myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no // 'di snyam du rtag tu yod pa'i skyes bu ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nas /
translated: We are not abandoning the topic at hand. The point is that there is no experience without similarity.

original: de don de la sems pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de don de la sems pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe permanent person does not think about that object by its own nature alone.üîΩ‚Äù

original: snga ma nyid bsgrub pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: snga ma nyid bsgrub pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: To address this doubt, he explains the point of the previous verse.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa ste /
translated: Because of awareness,

original: myong ba yod pa nyid ni nges pa'i don de myong par te /
analyzed: myong ba yod pa nyid ni nges pa'i don de myong par te /
translated: The existence of experience is the experience of the definitive meaning.

original: nyams su myong bar ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar ro //
translated: It is experienced, it is felt.

original: gang gi phyir de don thams cad la khyad par med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de don thams cad la khyad par med pa yin te /
translated: Because it is undifferentiated with regard to all objects.

original: des na thams cad la ste don thams cad la khyad par te /
analyzed: des na thams cad la ste don thams cad la khyad par te /
translated: Therefore, with regard to all, with regard to all objects, there is no differentiation,

original: tha dad par bya ba med pas na /
analyzed: tha dad par bya ba med pas na /
translated: no distinction.

original: don thams cad rig par thal ba'i phyir 'dra ba nyid de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: don thams cad rig par thal ba'i phyir 'dra ba nyid de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Because it follows that all objects are cognized, sameness is the reason. This is the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir yul so so la khyad par du ma gyur pa'i rig pa tsam po 'ba' zhig ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul so so la khyad par du ma gyur pa'i rig pa tsam po 'ba' zhig ni /
translated: Because mere awareness, which is not differentiated with regard to individual objects,

original: khyad par can du myong bar bya ba'i don gyi myong ba ma yin zhing rang gi rang bzhin myong ba las don gzhan myong ba zhes bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can du myong bar bya ba'i don gyi myong ba ma yin zhing rang gi rang bzhin myong ba las don gzhan myong ba zhes bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: is not the experience of an object that is to be experienced as differentiated, and it is not that the experience of its own nature is called the experience of something other than itself.

original: de'i rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du don nyams su myong ba yin na de'i rang gi rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / don myong ba yang de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du don nyams su myong ba yin na de'i rang gi rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / don myong ba yang de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the experience of the object is the nature of the experience of its own nature, then because its own nature would be undifferentiated, and because the experience of the object would be of the nature of that, it would be undifferentiated.

original: 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: shes pa yod pa gang yin pa de la 'dra ba yod de /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa gang yin pa de la 'dra ba yod de /
translated: That which is the existence of consciousness has similarity.

original: de'i bdag nyid yod pa yin na ni 'dra bar byed pa po'i don la sbyor zhing 'brel par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yod pa yin na ni 'dra bar byed pa po'i don la sbyor zhing 'brel par byed pa yin no //
translated: If it has the existence of that nature, it would be the cause of similarity, and it would be the connection that is applied to the object.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa 'di'i rgyu ni 'dra ba nyid yin par rigs pa de ltar ni 'bras bu bsam @107a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa 'di'i rgyu ni 'dra ba nyid yin par rigs pa de ltar ni 'bras bu bsam @107a * //
translated: Just as this connection is the cause of similarity, in the same way, the effect will be considered.

original: par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: nyams su myong ba ni 'dra ba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni 'dra ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Experience is accompanied by similarity.

original: 'dra ba yang de las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i myong ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba yang de las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i myong ba'i bdag nyid du grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: And because the likeness is not different from that, it is established as having the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: sems pa can yin par grub bo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can yin par grub bo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus it is established as having consciousness.

original: 'di snyam du 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang sems pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang sems pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that it follows that blue, etc. are consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir de la yang rnam par shes pa sems par byed pa na de'i rang bzhin nyid du skye par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang rnam par shes pa sems par byed pa na de'i rang bzhin nyid du skye par 'gyur te /
translated: because when consciousness is conscious of them, they are born having the nature of that,

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sngon po la sogs pa rnams sems par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sngon po la sogs pa rnams sems par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it follows that blue, etc., which have the nature of likeness, are consciousness, but that is not accepted.

original: ci ste rnam pa 'dis rnam par shes par smra ba la brten pa yin na de lta na yang ngal ba 'bras bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa 'dis rnam par shes par smra ba la brten pa yin na de lta na yang ngal ba 'bras bu med pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that this consciousness is based on the proponent of consciousness, then that is pointless.

original: gzhan dag kyang phyi rol yin pa 'gog pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dmigs kyis gzung bas ci bya zhes dogs pa la 'di nyid kyang kho bo cag gi bde ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang phyi rol yin pa 'gog pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dmigs kyis gzung bas ci bya zhes dogs pa la 'di nyid kyang kho bo cag gi bde ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThis very thing is our pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: bsdus pas ni 'di ltar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pas ni 'di ltar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The summary teaches this:

original: 'dra ba gcig pu ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba gcig pu ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can gyi rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: A single similarity is not the cause of the pleasure, etc. of a sentient being.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang yin no //
translated: However, a specific nature is also.

original: de yang gang zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na bshad pa /
translated: What is that?

original: gang sim par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par myong ba ste nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: gang sim par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par myong ba ste nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience that is in accordance with the desire for comfort.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This indicates the opposite of pain and both.

original: gang gi phyir de dag la yang ji ltar ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag la yang ji ltar ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because they should be understood as they are, just as they are.

original: don 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di ltar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is accepted in this way.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi don bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gsal ba phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi don bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gsal ba phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: The function of pleasure, etc., is to manifest desire, etc., which have the nature of benefiting, etc.

original: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa yang don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa yang don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: And the existence of things is based on their causal capacity.

original: de ni sim pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las kyang 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ni sim pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa las kyang 'thob ste /
translated: But pleasure, etc., are also obtained from the aspect of consciousness, such as the feeling of pleasure.

original: des na shes pa la gnas pa'i sim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de nyid bde bas bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir bde bar rigs so //
analyzed: des na shes pa la gnas pa'i sim pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de nyid bde bas bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir bde bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the aspect of pleasure, etc., which is present in consciousness, is pleasure, because it accomplishes what is to be accomplished by pleasure.

original: phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod par rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di nyid las yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod par rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di nyid las yin no //
translated: The existence of external pleasure, etc., is also based on this.

original: sngon po la sogs par yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu ni sngon @107b po'i rnam par gsal ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu ni sngon @107b po'i rnam par gsal ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: The result of the causal basis of existence as blue, etc., is not the manifestation of blue, etc.

original: rnam pa de skyes kyang sngon po la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de skyes kyang sngon po la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though that aspect has arisen, one sees that those who seek the object to be established by blue, etc. engage in activity.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni gang gi don du de dag 'jug pa'i don bya ba'i de nyid kyis yod pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni gang gi don du de dag 'jug pa'i don bya ba'i de nyid kyis yod pa yin la /
translated: Blue, etc. exist by the reality of the object of activity for the sake of which they engage.

original: de yang blo la gnas pa'i sngon po dang 'dra ba las mi 'grub pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba sngon po ma yin pas sngon po la sogs pas sems pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang blo la gnas pa'i sngon po dang 'dra ba las mi 'grub pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba sngon po ma yin pas sngon po la sogs pas sems pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not established from something similar to the blue that exists in the mind, because that which is similar to it is not blue, so blue, etc. are not cognized.

original: sems pa can yin par grub po zhes bya ba ni sim pa la sogs pa myong ba tsam gyi 'bras bus yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni 'dra ba'i bdag nyid la yang 'thad pa yin no zhes mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems pa can yin par grub po zhes bya ba ni sim pa la sogs pa myong ba tsam gyi 'bras bus yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni 'dra ba'i bdag nyid la yang 'thad pa yin no zhes mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is established as the possessor of cognition‚Äù concludes that pleasure, etc., which are posited as existing by the result that is the mere experience of satisfaction, etc., are also tenable in the nature of the similar.

original: yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is similar to the object.

original: yul dang 'dra ba yin pa de'i phyir myong ba rig pa bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du khas len na'o //
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba yin pa de'i phyir myong ba rig pa bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du khas len na'o //
translated: Because it is similar to the object, therefore, if you accept that experience is of the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: rang bzhin gang gis myong ba'i rang bzhin de ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis myong ba'i rang bzhin de ni myong ba'o //
translated: that very nature which experiences is experience.

original: gang dag la de yod pa ma yin pa de dag ste de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag la de yod pa ma yin pa de dag ste de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those which do not have that are not experience.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: If, because of being similar to pleasure, etc.,

original: myong ba de'i bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'dra bar byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams phyi rol du 'gyur te /
analyzed: myong ba de'i bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe 'dra bar byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams phyi rol du 'gyur te /
translated: you accept that experience is of the nature of that, then at that time, the pleasure, etc., which are the similar things, would be external.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi sngon po blo'i rnam pa'i 'dra bar byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi sngon po blo'i rnam pa'i 'dra bar byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, external blue is the similar thing that makes the aspect of the consciousness.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhen dang / myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhen dang / myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc., would be of two kinds: that which is of the nature of experience and that which is not of the nature of experience.

original: yang gi sgra med kyang 'dra ba las sems pa bde ba la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gi sgra med kyang 'dra ba las sems pa bde ba la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is not stated, because of the establishment of the mind that is similar to pleasure, etc.,

original: phyi rol ni myong ba ma yin par yang zhes bya ba 'di /
analyzed: phyi rol ni myong ba ma yin par yang zhes bya ba 'di /
translated: The external is not experienced.üîΩ

original: don gyis go ba'i phyir yang gi sgra ma bkod do //
analyzed: don gyis go ba'i phyir yang gi sgra ma bkod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúexternal objects are not experienced‚Äù is understood implicitly, so it is not stated.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa zlog par byed pa ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa zlog par byed pa ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The response to the opponent‚Äôs doubt is ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: kho bo la phyi rol du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir khyed kyi lta ba la yang bde ba'i rang bzhin myong ba bde ba'i bdag nyid can yod pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan pa gang yin pa'i don de nyid kyi don du bkod pa ni nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: kho bo la phyi rol du thal bar mi 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir khyed kyi lta ba la yang bde ba'i rang bzhin myong ba bde ba'i bdag nyid can yod pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan pa gang yin pa'i don de nyid kyi don du bkod pa ni nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: The consequence that external objects do not exist does not follow for us.üîΩThe point of the statement ‚ÄúBecause in your view, too, there is an experience that has the nature of pleasure‚Äù is presented as follows:

original: ji ltar khyed kyi lta ba la yang myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba khas blang bar bya'o zhes de'i don du bkod pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi lta ba la yang myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba khas blang bar bya'o zhes de'i don du bkod pa byas pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as you accept that there is an experience that has the nature of pleasure in your view, we also accept that there is an experience that has the nature of pleasure in our view.‚Äù

original: 'o na khyed rang gi phyogs la de kho nar don ji lta bu zhig @108a * //üîΩyin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed rang gi phyogs la de kho nar don ji lta bu zhig @108a * // yin zhe na /
translated: What is the point of this statement in our own system?

original: bshad pa myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de la yang ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de la yang ngo //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThat is, the nature of experience is pleasure.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du kho bo cag myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa spong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na la nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma shin tu gsal bas 'di
analyzed: 'di skad du kho bo cag myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa spong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang myong ba bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na la nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma shin tu gsal bas 'di
translated: It is not that we reject the self that is the nature of the experience of pleasure, and so on, but rather that the valid knowledge that is the characteristic of the experience of pleasure, and so on, is very clear.

original: ltar mthong zhing shes so //
analyzed: ltar mthong zhing shes so //
translated: Thus we see and understand it in this way.

original: dga' ba ni sim par myong ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sim par myong ba'o //
translated: Joy is the experience of comfort.

original: yongs su gdung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Sorrow is the opposite of that.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de lta bur gyur pa de ni gcig tu rtogs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de lta bur gyur pa de ni gcig tu rtogs par mthong ngo //
translated: The nature of those is seen to be realized as one.

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol gyi byas pa 'gog par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol gyi byas pa 'gog par brjod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù indicates that external creation is rejected.

original: 'di ltar gang gis phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las rnam par chad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyis byas pa nyid du rig par 'gyur ba myong bar byed pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las rnam par chad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyis byas pa nyid du rig par 'gyur ba myong bar byed pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan la /
translated: Thus, by what is external, the nature of the experience of pleasure, and so on, which is separate from the aspect of the apprehender, is known to be created by the external, and the apprehender that is the experience is also different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang gzhan du snang ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzung ba'i rang bzhin yang gzhan du snang ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspect of pleasure, etc., which is the nature of the apprehended object, does not appear as something else.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa gang zhig phyi rol gyi rang bzhin gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba ma yin pa de ni phyi rol gyis byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa gang zhig phyi rol gyi rang bzhin gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang ba ma yin pa de ni phyi rol gyis byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Because that aspect which does not appear as the nature of the external apprehended object is not produced by the external object,

original: dper na sems pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: like the aspect of volition.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The aspect of pleasure, etc., is also like that.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i don du nang du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i don du nang du zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says: ‚Äúinternally.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin myong ba la gnas pa ni nang du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'i rnam par mthong gi phyi rol gzung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin myong ba la gnas pa ni nang du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi 'dzin pa'i rnam par mthong gi phyi rol gzung ba'i rnam par ni ma yin te /
translated: The experience of the nature of pleasure, etc., is seen internally as the apprehension of the basis of the self-habit, not as the aspect of the external apprehended object.

original: dri zhim po dang rtsub mo la sogs pa nyams su myong ba na phyi rol gyi dngos po de nyid bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: dri zhim po dang rtsub mo la sogs pa nyams su myong ba na phyi rol gyi dngos po de nyid bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: When one experiences a pleasant or unpleasant smell, etc., that external entity is not experienced as pleasure or pain,üîΩbut rather the experience of pleasure or pain arises in the mind.

original: 'dod pa'am sdang bar snang ba ni med kyi 'on kyang 'dod pa dang sdang ba ni de las rnam par chad pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nang gi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'am sdang bar snang ba ni med kyi 'on kyang 'dod pa dang sdang ba ni de las rnam par chad pa bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nang gi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance of desire or aversion does not exist, but desire and aversion appear as the basis of the conception of self, the inner aspect of the nature of grasping.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la phyi rol du lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la phyi rol du lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no external attachment to pleasure, etc., which exist in the nature of grasping, they are not external, not created.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la bde ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la bde ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for us, pleasure, etc. will not be external.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod @108b pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang / chags pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams phyi rol gyi ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin pa gzung ba'i rnam par bde ba'am chags pa'am sdang bas bde ba dang chags pa la sogs pa rnams su thalüîΩba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod @108b pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang / chags pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams phyi rol gyi ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin pa gzung ba'i rnam par bde ba'am chags pa'am sdang bas bde ba dang chags pa la sogs pa rnams su thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore it is not the case that pleasure or attachment or aversion is the self.

original: rnal 'byor pas ni chags pa'am sdang ba gang yin pa de ni nga ma yin zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni chags pa'am sdang ba gang yin pa de ni nga ma yin zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The yogi thinks, ‚ÄúWhatever is attached or averse, that is not the self.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med pa'i phyir na /üîΩbdag ni sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med pa'i phyir na / bdag ni sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThere is no suffering and so on that is based on the aspect of the object of apprehension.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore he thinks, ‚ÄúI am not suffering,

original: bde ba'am sdang ba ma yin no zhes 'dzin pa'i rnam pa mthong ba des na /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdang ba ma yin no zhes 'dzin pa'i rnam pa mthong ba des na /
translated: I am not pleasure, I am not aversion.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol du thal ba med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol du thal ba med do //
translated: Thus, according to us, it is not the case that pleasure and so on are external.

original: 'di ni re zhig nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: This is the experience of the yogi.

original: 'di phyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pas byas pa ni rigs pas kyang yid la 'bab pa ma yin no zhes bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir yang ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di phyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pas byas pa ni rigs pas kyang yid la 'bab pa ma yin no zhes bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir yang ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not tenable that pleasure, etc. are produced by external things such as sound, etc. This is also shown by the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù in the verse, which indicates that it is not reasonable.

original: myong ba'i rang bzhin 'di'i bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'di 'jog par byed pa 'dra bar byed pa gzhan gang yin pa de ste de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba'i rang bzhin 'di'i bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'di 'jog par byed pa 'dra bar byed pa gzhan gang yin pa de ste de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: What other thing, similar to this experience, would establish this pleasure, etc. as having the nature of sound, etc.? That is not so.

original: 'di'i bdag nyid la 'dra bar byed pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid la 'dra bar byed pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable that anything else is similar to this. This is the conclusion.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra la sogs pa de khyad par med de /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra la sogs pa de khyad par med de /
translated: Sound, etc. do not differ in their nature as pleasure, etc.

original: sna tshogs med kyang ste sgra la sogs pa gcig la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs med kyang ste sgra la sogs pa gcig la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though there is no diversity, i.e. even with respect to a single sound, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par las te srog chags kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i khyad par bye brag las cig car du gcig nyid la bde ba la sogs pa skye ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par las te srog chags kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i khyad par bye brag las cig car du gcig nyid la bde ba la sogs pa skye ste /
translated: It arises simultaneously in many things, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the object.üîΩFor example, from one moon, many moons are seen by many men.üîΩIt arises simultaneously in one thing, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the living being, due to the specific nature of the object.

original: dper na tshva'i rdzas gcig nyid las rnga mo la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshva'i rdzas gcig nyid las rnga mo la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, from one substance of salt, the taste of salt arises in the camel, but not in other living beings.üîΩIt arises simultaneously in many things, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the object.üîΩFor example, from one moon, many moons are seen by many men.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las kyang gcig la mang po rnams cig car ram /üîΩgcig rim gyis bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid khyad par du grub pa ni myong ba ste nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las kyang gcig la mang po rnams cig car ram / gcig rim gyis bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid khyad par du grub pa ni myong ba ste nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It arises simultaneously in many things, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the living being, due to the specific nature of the object.üîΩFor example, from one substance of salt, the taste of salt arises in the camel, but not in other living beings.üîΩIt arises simultaneously in one thing, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the living being, due to the specific nature of the object.

original: rgyu de'i phyir 'jog par byed pa gzhan yin par rigs pa ma yin par grub pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir 'jog par byed pa gzhan yin par rigs pa ma yin par grub pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: For example, from one substance of salt, the taste of salt arises in the camel, but not in other living beings.

original: tshad ma'i don ni sngar gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni sngar gtan la phab zin to //
translated: It arises simultaneously in many things, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the object.üîΩFor example, from one moon, many moons are seen by many men.üîΩIt arises simultaneously in one thing, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the living being, due to the specific nature of the object.

original: 'di snyam du bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang rjes su @109a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang rjes su @109a * //
translated: For example, from one substance of salt, the taste of salt arises in the camel, but not in other living beings.üîΩIt arises simultaneously in many things, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the object.üîΩFor example, from one moon, many moons are seen by many men.

original: 'brel pa ni blo yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni blo yin gyi /
translated: It arises simultaneously in one thing, due to the specific nature of the object, due to the specific nature of the living being, due to the specific nature of the object

original: myong ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'am de'i khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'am de'i khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Experience does not possess the nature or the special qualities of pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ltar blo ni phyi rol gyi bde pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / rang nyid kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo ni phyi rol gyi bde pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / rang nyid kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition has the aspect of external pleasure, etc., and it itself has the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: de la phyi rol khyad par med kyang blo la gnas pa nang gi bde ba la sogs pa nyid khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol khyad par med kyang blo la gnas pa nang gi bde ba la sogs pa nyid khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Although there is no difference in the external, the internal pleasure, etc., which is present in the cognition, is the special quality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jog pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jog pa yang yin la /
translated: For that very reason, it is also established by the aspect of pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan khyad par med pa yang nang gi khyad par nyid las khyad par du yang 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan khyad par med pa yang nang gi khyad par nyid las khyad par du yang 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dogs pa la /
translated: And although there is no difference in the other, it becomes different due to the internal difference alone.

original: sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'di ci zhig ces 'dri bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'di ci zhig ces 'dri bar mdzad do //
translated: In order to refute this doubt, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: 'dir ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is this:

original: blo dang rig pa'i khyad par lung las grub pa'am nyams su myong bas grub pa yin grang /
analyzed: blo dang rig pa'i khyad par lung las grub pa'am nyams su myong bas grub pa yin grang /
translated: Is the difference in cognition and awareness established by scripture or established by experience?

original: de la lung gis grub pa la ni rtsod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la lung gis grub pa la ni rtsod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no dispute about what is established by scripture.

original: nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di gnyis la ni khyad par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di gnyis la ni khyad par ma mthong ste /
translated: But we do not see any difference between these two, that is, between what is established by experience and what is established by testimony.

original: des na 'di zhes mngon sum gyi tshul du bzung nas 'dri par mdzad do //
analyzed: des na 'di zhes mngon sum gyi tshul du bzung nas 'dri par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, he asks the question as if it were directly perceived, saying ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: 'dri ba'i don ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa blo'i tha snyad du byed ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba'i don ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa blo'i tha snyad du byed ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the thing that is established by experience on the basis of which worldly people make conventional assertions?‚Äù

original: cig shos kyis kyang zhen pa'o zhes bya bas nyams su myong bas grub pa nyid bstan pa'i don du mtshan nyid ma brjod par rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas ston par byed de /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang zhen pa'o zhes bya bas nyams su myong bas grub pa nyid bstan pa'i don du mtshan nyid ma brjod par rnam grangs gzhan gyi sgo nas ston par byed de /
translated: The other replies, ‚ÄúAttachment,‚Äù in order to show that it is established by experience. Without stating the definition, he teaches by means of another synonym.

original: gang la 'jig rten zhen pa'i tha snyad du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten zhen pa'i tha snyad du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat on the basis of which worldly people make conventional assertions‚Äù is ‚Äúthat to which worldly people are attached.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du myong ba'i 'dri ba dang lan la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du myong ba'i 'dri ba dang lan la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The question and answer concerning experience should be understood in the same way.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam grangs bzhi ka 'jig rten pas nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po gcig nyid la sbyor bar gzigs nas blo dang rig pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ces gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam grangs bzhi ka 'jig rten pas nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po gcig nyid la sbyor bar gzigs nas blo dang rig pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ces gsungs te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between these two, cognition and awareness?‚Äù

original: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is not the slightest difference.

original: cig shos kyis kyang 'dis bdag la mtshan nyid dris so snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang 'dis bdag la mtshan nyid dris so snyam du bsams nas /
translated: The other [party] thinks, ‚ÄúHe is asking me about the characteristics of these two.‚Äù

original: 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par rjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par rjod par byed de /
translated: He states the different characteristics of these two:

original: yul gyi rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni yul gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa gang la yod pa de ni yul gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which has the aspect of an object is an object-aspect.

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like that.

original: 'di myong ba ma yin pa ni myong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di myong ba ma yin pa ni myong ba med pa'o //
translated: That which is not an experience is without experience.

original: blo ni yul gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo ni yul gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that cognition has the aspect of an object.

original: gzhan te yul gyi rnam pa dang bral ba ni myong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan te yul gyi rnam pa dang bral ba ni myong ba yin no //
translated: That which is different from that, which is free from the aspect of an object, is an experience.

original: 'di ni 'di gnyis ni rang @109b bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di gnyis ni rang @109b bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature of these two.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par gtong ba dang len pa dag gis yongs su 'gyur ba can du ma gyur cig ces rnam pa med par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par gtong ba dang len pa dag gis yongs su 'gyur ba can du ma gyur cig ces rnam pa med par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: because it is not the case that the person is not transformed by the various natures of giving and taking.

original: myong ba yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: myong ba yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not the case that there is no experience.üîΩIf the definition of cognition is that it is similar to that which is free from thought,üîΩthen a mirror, a crystal, a stone, etc., which are similar to that,

original: sems pa dang bral ba'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de blo'i mtshan nyid yin na ni ste rang gi rang bzhin rnam par 'jog pa'i go bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na ni me long dang shel dang rdo ba la sogs pa 'dra ba dang ldan pa
analyzed: sems pa dang bral ba'i 'dra ba gang yin pa de blo'i mtshan nyid yin na ni ste rang gi rang bzhin rnam par 'jog pa'i go bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na ni me long dang shel dang rdo ba la sogs pa 'dra ba dang ldan pa
translated: would also be cognition.

original: gzhan yang blo der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo der 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that cognition would be different.

original: ha cang thal ba spangs pa'i don du khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spangs pa'i don du khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If there were some difference in order to avoid the absurd consequence that everything would be cognition, that would have to be stated.

original: rang nyid kyis gzhan gyi khyad par dogs par byed nas dgag par mdzad pa ni nang gi byed pa zhes smras te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis gzhan gyi khyad par dogs par byed nas dgag par mdzad pa ni nang gi byed pa zhes smras te /
translated: Having suspected that the opponent would object that there would be no difference between the cognition of the object and the cognition of the subject, he says ‚Äúinternal activity.‚Äù

original: nang gi skyes bu don la nye bar spyod pa na byed par gyur pa ni nang gi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi skyes bu don la nye bar spyod pa na byed par gyur pa ni nang gi byed pa'o //
translated: When the internal agent is engaged in the pursuit of the person‚Äôs purpose, it is the internal agent.

original: de nyid la sogs pa shin tu dang ba nyid dang / nang nyid dang / skyes bu'i longs spyod par nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la sogs pa shin tu dang ba nyid dang / nang nyid dang / skyes bu'i longs spyod par nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: It is called that because it is the cause of the clarity, the internal state, and the enjoyment of the person.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'di dag nyid gzhan gyis khyad par du bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'di dag nyid gzhan gyis khyad par du bzhag pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes these are distinguished by others.

original: 'di dag kyang kha cang thun mong ma yin pa dang thun mong du bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang kha cang thun mong ma yin pa dang thun mong du bzung ba yin no //
translated: These are also taken as both uncommon and common.

original: re zhig thun mong ma yin pa ni nang gi byed pa gang zhig skyes bu la tha dad pa med par snang ba na skyes bu don la nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i nang gi de byed pa de ni blo nyid yin no //
analyzed: re zhig thun mong ma yin pa ni nang gi byed pa gang zhig skyes bu la tha dad pa med par snang ba na skyes bu don la nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i nang gi de byed pa de ni blo nyid yin no //
translated: First, the uncommon is as follows: When the internal agent appears without distinction in the person, the internal agent that is like that which engages in the pursuit of the person‚Äôs purpose is the mind itself.

original: de bzhin du shin tu dang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu dang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all the distinctions such as clarity.

original: thun mong ba ni nang gi byed pa la sogs pa khyad par dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ba ni nang gi byed pa la sogs pa khyad par dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The common one is the nature devoid of distinctions, such as internal activity.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa ni ma grub ste 'di ltar de 'dra ba'i nang gi byed pa de yang 'dra ba ji lta bu zhig ces the tshom za ba la /üîΩ'dra ba nyid mtshan nyid du gzhag par bya ba yin pas ji ltar 'dra bas mtshon pa'i blo ma grub pa de bzhin du 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i nang gi byed pa 'di la yang the tshom za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i nang gi byed
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa ni ma grub ste 'di ltar de 'dra ba'i nang gi byed pa de yang 'dra ba ji lta bu zhig ces the tshom za ba la / 'dra ba nyid mtshan nyid du gzhag par bya ba yin pas ji ltar 'dra bas mtshon pa'i blo ma grub pa de bzhin du 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i nang gi byed pa 'di la yang the tshom za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i nang gi byed
translated: The uncommon one is not established, because when one doubts what kind of similarity that kind of internal activity is,üîΩsince similarity itself is posited as the characteristic, just as the mind that is characterized by similarity is not established, so too this internal activity that possesses similarity is itself doubtful.

original: pa ni blo grub pa nyid na grub pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni blo grub pa nyid na grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the mind is established, the internal activity that is like that is established.

original: des na de'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: des na de'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: Thus it has that as its reason,

original: gang dag la rgyu mtshan blo de yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la rgyu mtshan blo de yod pa'o //
translated: because it has the mind that is the reason.

original: 'dis ni phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: This expresses the error of mutual dependence,

original: de 'dra ba'i nang gi byed pa ni blo grub na 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i nang gi byed pa ni blo grub na 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the mind is established, the internal activity that is like that is established.

original: gang gi phyir nang gi byed pa 'di ni blo'i @110a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nang gi byed pa 'di ni blo'i @110a * //
translated: Because this internal activity is the essence of the mind, if one doubts it, then one should also doubt this.

original: rang gi ngo bo yin pas da la the tshom za na 'di la yang the tshom za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yin pas da la the tshom za na 'di la yang the tshom za ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be proclaimed.

original: thun mong ba la ltos nas bshad pa /
analyzed: thun mong ba la ltos nas bshad pa /
translated: The explanation in terms of the common:

original: blo bye brag tu rtogs pa'i yan lag ste go bar byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: blo bye brag tu rtogs pa'i yan lag ste go bar byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not a part of the understanding of the mind, i.e., it is not the understanding itself,

original: thun mong du gyur pas khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thun mong du gyur pas khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is common and not distinguished.

original: / de'i phyir des na bsgrag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir des na bsgrag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not to be proclaimed,

original: blo rtogs pa'i yan lag tu dgong par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: blo rtogs pa'i yan lag tu dgong par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not to be taken as a part of the understanding of the mind.

original: thun mong ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu ni zhes smos te khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu ni zhes smos te khyad par med pa'o //
translated: In order to show that very commonness, he says, ‚Äúin that way,‚Äù i.e., without distinction.

original: shin tu dang ba la sogs pa gzhan la yang ste /
analyzed: shin tu dang ba la sogs pa gzhan la yang ste /
translated: It is also in others, i.e., in those who are very clear, etc.

original: me long la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in mirrors, etc., and in eyes, etc.

original: de ltar na nang gi byed pa tsam ni mig la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi byed pa tsam ni mig la sogs pa la yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mere internal operation is also present in the eye, etc.

original: nang nyid dang skyes bu'i longs spyod du nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyang don gzhan la ltos pa nyid kyis ji ltar rigs par mig ngang shel la sogs pa yang blo nyid du thal ba'i phyir blo'i mtshan nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: nang nyid dang skyes bu'i longs spyod du nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyang don gzhan la ltos pa nyid kyis ji ltar rigs par mig ngang shel la sogs pa yang blo nyid du thal ba'i phyir blo'i mtshan nyid ma grub bo //
translated: And since the cause of the presence of the object of the internal self and the person is dependent on another object, it follows that the eye, the crystal, etc. are also the mind, and thus the definition of the mind is not established.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnam par 'jog pa ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnam par 'jog pa ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: The determination of the object, such as sound, etc. is the conventional designation of those which are different in place, time, and nature.

original: rnam par 'jog pa ni rang gi rang bzhin nges pa sgrub pa'am tha snyad du byed pa las 'dir ni tha snyad du byed pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa ni rang gi rang bzhin nges pa sgrub pa'am tha snyad du byed pa las 'dir ni tha snyad du byed pa gzung ngo //
translated: The determination is the establishment of the ascertainment of its own nature, or the conventional designation. Here, the conventional designation is accepted.

original: yang gi sgra ni 'dra ba blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni 'dra ba blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only is similarity not the definition of the mind,

original: blo 'dra ba dang bcas pa yin yang blo dang rnam pa med pa'i sems pa can du yul gyi don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo 'dra ba dang bcas pa yin yang blo dang rnam pa med pa'i sems pa can du yul gyi don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is similar to cognition, it is not a cognition that is a mental factor that lacks a mental image and that is a determination of the meaning of an object.

original: myong ba yin te myong bar byed pa'o //üîΩmthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: myong ba yin te myong bar byed pa'o // mthar thug pa ste /
translated: It is experience, that is, that which experiences.üîΩIt is the finality, that is, the conclusion.

original: mthar gtugs pa gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: mthar gtugs pa gang yin pa dag go //
translated: It is that which is the finality, that is, the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir myong ba zhes bya ba gzhan brjod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang blta bar bya ba'i nges pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mthong ba rnam par brtag par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa nyid myong ba yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir myong ba zhes bya ba gzhan brjod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang blta bar bya ba'i nges pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mthong ba rnam par brtag par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa nyid myong ba yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa
translated: Because it is not said that there is another called experience, but rather that the seeing that is connected with the ascertainment of the object to be seen is the imagination of what is unreal, and that experience is established by experience.

original: yin no // snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa dag gi tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yin no // snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa dag gi tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa nyid yin te /
translated: The designation of the appearance and the imagination is seeing and imagination.

original: de'i phyir myong ba'i mthar thug pa myong ba'i ngo bo can myong ba gang yin pa de nyid don rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir myong ba'i mthar thug pa myong ba'i ngo bo can myong ba gang yin pa de nyid don rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is the essence of experience, the ultimate of experience, is the establishment of objects, and not anything else.

original: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi tha snyad 'di ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi tha snyad 'di ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: This convention, which is the nature of seeing and conception, is associated with difference.

original: myong ba @110b yang rnam pa med pa nyid kyi don so so la khyad par du 'dod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: myong ba @110b yang rnam pa med pa nyid kyi don so so la khyad par du 'dod pa ma yin na /
translated: And experience is not asserted to be different in regard to the individual object that is devoid of aspect.

original: de ji ltar don rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar don rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur /
translated: How then could it establish objects?

original: 'di snyam du don tha dad pa dang 'brel pa'i myong ba tha dad par snang ba de'i phyir bdag nyid tha dad ci dgos she na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don tha dad pa dang 'brel pa'i myong ba tha dad par snang ba de'i phyir bdag nyid tha dad ci dgos she na /
translated: If you think that because the experience associated with different objects appears to be different, what need is there for it to be different in itself?

original: gal te don tha dad pa mi gsal bar myong ba tha dad par byed pa yin na ni de de ltar 'thad pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te don tha dad pa mi gsal bar myong ba tha dad par byed pa yin na ni de de ltar 'thad pa zhig na /
translated: If the experience of different objects were to be different without the objects being clear, that would be acceptable.

original: gang gi phyir de yang gsal bzhin pa kho na tha dad par byed pa yin zhing gsal ba de yang myong ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yang gsal bzhin pa kho na tha dad par byed pa yin zhing gsal ba de yang myong ba nyid yin la /
translated: Because that is also what differentiates the manifest alone, and that manifestation is just experience.

original: de yang tha dad pa med pa des na /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa med pa des na /
translated: And because that is not different,

original: don tha dad pas ni myong ba tha dad par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don tha dad pas ni myong ba tha dad par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: experience does not become different due to different objects.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas yin no ;
translated: However, it is due to the difference of its own nature.

original: / de'i phyir don nges pa yod dam med kyang rung ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin rig pa ni don so so la nges par 'dod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: / de'i phyir don nges pa yod dam med kyang rung ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin rig pa ni don so so la nges par 'dod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, whether the ascertainment of the object exists or not, the awareness that has the nature of manifestation is to be accepted as the ascertainment of each object.

original: gsal ba nges pa yang don rnams kyi rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba nges pa yang don rnams kyi rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: And the ascertainment of manifestation is what determines the objects.

original: skyes bu yang rnam par med pa nyid kyis don thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: skyes bu yang rnam par med pa nyid kyis don thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ;
translated: And because the person is also devoid of form, it is not different with regard to any object.

original: 'di ni 'di'i gsal ba yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes brtag par mi nus pas ma nges par rig pa'i phyir de la ni yul nges pa'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i gsal ba yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes brtag par mi nus pas ma nges par rig pa'i phyir de la ni yul nges pa'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to investigate and say, ‚ÄúThis is the manifestation of that, not of another,‚Äù because it is known to be indefinite. Therefore, it does not have the complete designation of a definite object.

original: de'i phyir na don rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi blos byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na don rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi blos byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the mind that has the aspect of an object is what establishes the object.

original: bshad pa ; sems pa med pa de don gyi rnam pa dang ldan yang yul gyi rnam par gnas pa rnam par 'jog par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bshad pa ; sems pa med pa de don gyi rnam pa dang ldan yang yul gyi rnam par gnas pa rnam par 'jog par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Even though that nonconceptual mind has the aspect of an object, how can it establish the object that has the aspect of an object?

original: tha snyad du byed pa ni gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad du byed pa ni gsal ba yin la /
translated: The mind that has the aspect of an object is the manifestation of the object.

original: de ni mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not clear, it does not establish the object.

original: gal te don dang 'dra ba tsam nyid yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe me long la sogs pa yang rnam par 'jog par byed par thal na /
analyzed: gal te don dang 'dra ba tsam nyid yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe me long la sogs pa yang rnam par 'jog par byed par thal na /
translated: If the mere likeness to an object establishes the object, then it follows that a mirror, etc., would also establish the object.

original: me long ni 'dra bar mthong yang rnam pa 'jog par byed par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me long ni 'dra bar mthong yang rnam pa 'jog par byed par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The mirror is seen as similar, but it is not ascertained as the designator.

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the designator.

original: mig phye nas don gyi gzugs brnyan dang ldan bzhin du gnyid log pa'i skyes bu yag don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig phye nas don gyi gzugs brnyan dang ldan bzhin du gnyid log pa'i skyes bu yag don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: When a person is awake with eyes open and the reflection of an object is present, the object is not ascertained.

original: des na nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar thal ba'i phyir 'dra ba tsam ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas par yin no //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar thal ba'i phyir 'dra ba tsam ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas par yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it would follow that this contradicts experience, a mere similarity is not the designator.

original: gang zhig don rnam par 'jog pa de ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid @111a * //
analyzed: gang zhig don rnam par 'jog pa de ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid @111a * //
translated: That which ascertains the object is the nature of clarity,

original: yin te / gang gi phyir yul rnam par 'jog ba de ni me long la sogs pa rnams las bzlog nas nges pa'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: yin te / gang gi phyir yul rnam par 'jog ba de ni me long la sogs pa rnams las bzlog nas nges pa'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: because the ascertainment of an object is experienced as having a nature that is the opposite of mirrors, etc.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na ni nges pa med pa nyid du 'gyur bas /üîΩgsal ba las gzhan ni rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa med pas de'i bdag nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na ni nges pa med pa nyid du 'gyur bas / gsal ba las gzhan ni rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa med pas de'i bdag nyid du grub bo //
translated: If it were to posit what is not of the nature of clarity, then it would be uncertain.üîΩTherefore, since it is not other than clarity, it is not a positer.

original: des na khyab par byed pa gsal ba nyid med pa'i phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i blo ni rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa gsal ba nyid med pa'i phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i blo ni rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Since the pervader, clarity, is absent, the cognition that is not of the nature of clarity, even though it has aspects, is not a positer.

original: skyes bu yang sems pa can yin yang 'dra ba dang bral bas nges pa med pa'i phyir yul rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu yang sems pa can yin yang 'dra ba dang bral bas nges pa med pa'i phyir yul rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since the person is not similar to the mind, even though it is an experiencer, it is uncertain, and therefore it is not a positer of objects.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid blo la yod pa'i bde ba'i 'dra bar byed pa'i phyi rol gyi bde ba la khyad par yod pa ma yin yang blor gtogs pa'i bde ba blo'i bde ba ni bsgoms pas byas pa'i bye brag gi khyad par de dang ldan pa
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid blo la yod pa'i bde ba'i 'dra bar byed pa'i phyi rol gyi bde ba la khyad par yod pa ma yin yang blor gtogs pa'i bde ba blo'i bde ba ni bsgoms pas byas pa'i bye brag gi khyad par de dang ldan pa
translated: But the pleasure that is in the mind, the pleasure of the mind, has the special feature that is created by meditation.

original: yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni tshig tsam las 'ongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni tshig tsam las 'ongs pa yin gyi /
translated: This is mere verbiage.

original: tshad ma las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not established by valid cognition.

original: des na rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩyang gi sgra ni blo tha dad pa mi rigs pa dang yul rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i nyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi khyad bar med na de la gnas pa'i bde ba yang goms pas khyad par du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma
analyzed: des na rigs pa ma yin no // yang gi sgra ni blo tha dad pa mi rigs pa dang yul rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i nyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi khyad bar med na de la gnas pa'i bde ba yang goms pas khyad par du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma
translated: Therefore it is illogical.

original: yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not just the error that it is illogical for there to be different minds and that there would be no way to posit objects, but also that if there is no difference in external objects, it is illogical for the pleasure that is in them to be transformed by meditation.

original: phyi rol gyis bskyed pa'i bde ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid skyes bus shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyis bskyed pa'i bde ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid skyes bus shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The image of pleasure that is generated by external objects is the consciousness of a person.

original: blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the nature of cognition.

original: 'dra bar byed pa de yang nyams su myong ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dra bar byed pa de yang nyams su myong ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na yin te /
translated: And this similarity is only in the experience of the similarity;

original: gzhan du na de des ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de des ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, it would not be produced by that.

original: des byas pa nyid yin yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des byas pa nyid yin yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And even if it were produced by that, it would be too much.

original: des na de'i khyad par gyis 'dra bar byed pa khyad par can du go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na de'i khyad par gyis 'dra bar byed pa khyad par can du go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the similarity is understood to be qualified by that difference.

original: phyi rol la khyad par yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol la khyad par yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And there is no difference in the external object.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis ni khyad par dang bcas par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dbang gis ni khyad par dang bcas par gnas pa yin la /
translated: But by the power of the reflection, it abides with a difference.

original: nyams su myong ba ni khyad par med pas tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu phan tshun 'gal ba 'di ni gcig la rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa gcig la ste sna tshogs par ma gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni khyad par med pas tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu phan tshun 'gal ba 'di ni gcig la rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa gcig la ste sna tshogs par ma gyur ba'o //
translated: And since the experience is without difference, this cause of the convention of difference, which is mutually contradictory, is not reasonable in one thing. Therefore, in one thing, i.e., not in the manifold.

original: cig car zhes bya ba yang rgyun gcig @111b la khyad par sgrub pa mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba yang rgyun gcig @111b la khyad par sgrub pa mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the word ‚Äúsimultaneously‚Äù is not refuted in establishing the difference in one continuum.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i phyir phyi rol la ma ltos par blo khyad par dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i phyir phyi rol la ma ltos par blo khyad par dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of contradiction, it is not reasonable for a cognition to have a special feature without depending on an external object.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa las tha dad pa rnam pa dang ldan pa'i zhen pa las mtshan nyid med pa dang / yul rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba dang gang gi don du blo khas blangs pa phyi rol gyis ma bzhag pa'i blo'i bde ba khyad par can yang gnas pa med pa las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa las tha dad pa rnam pa dang ldan pa'i zhen pa las mtshan nyid med pa dang / yul rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba dang gang gi don du blo khas blangs pa phyi rol gyis ma bzhag pa'i blo'i bde ba khyad par can yang gnas pa med pa las /
translated: Because of the absence of a cognition that has a form different from the mind, because of the absence of an object that is not established, and because of the absence of a special happiness of the mind that is not established by an external object for which the mind is accepted,

original: yul rnam par gnas pa dang phyi rol khyad par med kyang goms pas byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nyams su myong ba yang yod pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo phyi rol gyis byas pa ma yin pa de
analyzed: yul rnam par gnas pa dang phyi rol khyad par med kyang goms pas byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nyams su myong ba yang yod pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo phyi rol gyis byas pa ma yin pa de
translated: there is no object that is established. Even though there is no difference between the external object and the mind, there is an experience of a special happiness that is produced by habituation. Therefore, a cognition that has the aspect of happiness and so on is not produced by an external object.

original: sems pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not different from the mind.

original: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
translated: However, it is established by the experience of its nature.

original: sems pa yod pa las ldog pa tha dad pa'i blo ni rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems pa yod pa las ldog pa tha dad pa'i blo ni rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mind that is different from the existence of intention is not a knower, because it is not characterized.

original: mtshan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not characterized, because it is not an object of knowledge.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yul dang 'dra ba'i sems pa yod pa nyid don rnam par 'jog pa po yin la /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yul dang 'dra ba'i sems pa yod pa nyid don rnam par 'jog pa po yin la /
translated: The existence of intention, which is like the object, is the determiner of the object, in the manner previously explained.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yang de nyid yin no //
translated: And it is the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: blo yang bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ldan pa dang / yul gyi rnam pa dang ldan par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: blo yang bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ldan pa dang / yul gyi rnam pa dang ldan par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The mind is also asserted to be endowed with the distinctions of pleasure, etc., and to be endowed with the aspect of the object.

original: des na de 'dra ba'i blo ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na de 'dra ba'i blo ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, such a mind is the nature of the existence of intention.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, this is the nature of the existence of intention.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of the existence of intention, because it is established by experience.üîΩIt is the nature of the existence of intention, because it is the cause of the various changes in the body, such as the experience of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa du ma gang yin pa der gcig tu ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa du ma gang yin pa der gcig tu ste /
