original: myong ba ma yin pa'i cha dang bral bar myong ba'i rang bzhin yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du ste rnam pa 'di dag gis 'dzin par byed pa rnam par 'jog pa po yang dag par rig par byed par nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: myong ba ma yin pa'i cha dang bral bar myong ba'i rang bzhin yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du ste rnam pa 'di dag gis 'dzin par byed pa rnam par 'jog pa po yang dag par rig par byed par nyams su myong ngo //
translated: The nature of experience, free from the aspect of non-experience, is experienced as the nature of the apprehender of objects.üîΩIn these aspects, the one who establishes the agent of apprehension, the one who makes the correct cognition, experiences it.

original: tha dad pa dang bral bar nyams su myong bas grub pa'i yang dag par rig pa de la mi ni ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar byed la rag ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang bral bar nyams su myong bas grub pa'i yang dag par rig pa de la mi ni ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar byed la rag ste /
translated: In that correct cognition established by the experience free from difference, one should do as one wishes.

original: ming tha dad pas ni don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ming tha dad pas ni don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that difference in names does not make the meaning different.

original: sems pa can nyid blo'i rang bzhin yin par nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems pa can nyid blo'i rang bzhin yin par nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it unreasonable to say that the nature of the mind is experienced as the nature of cognition?

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin phra ma nyid kyis myong ba ni mngon sum ma yin la /üîΩblo'i rnam par 'gyur ba yul gyi rnam pa yongs @112a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin phra ma nyid kyis myong ba ni mngon sum ma yin la /üîΩblo'i rnam par 'gyur ba yul gyi rnam pa yongs @112a * //
translated: Because subtlety itself is not experienced by direct perception,üîΩthe aspect of the object is not experienced by direct perception.

original: su 'dzin pa ni mngon sum du gsal ba yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la /
analyzed: su 'dzin pa ni mngon sum du gsal ba yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la /
translated: Others suspect that the object that is apprehended is clearly manifest.

original: bshad pa / blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba mngon sum pa'i mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa yul dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yul las longs spyod pa 'di ni longs spyod par bya ba bzhin du mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba mngon sum pa'i mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa yul dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yul las longs spyod pa 'di ni longs spyod par bya ba bzhin du mngon sum yin te /
translated: In response to this, it is said: The object that is the object of direct perception, which is characterized by the observation of an object, is direct perception, just like the object that is enjoyed.

original: 'di ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what should be accepted as having the nature of clarity.

original: sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin longs spyod pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin longs spyod pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: The enjoyment that has the nature of existing thought is not direct perception.

original: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yang de dang 'dra bar mngon sum nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yang de dang 'dra bar mngon sum nyid ma yin nam /
translated: And is the intrinsic reality of the object not also like that, not direct perception?

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa 'di go skabs su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa 'di go skabs su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is this conception possible?

original: brjod pa re zhig 'di thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i yul gyi chos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa re zhig 'di thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i yul gyi chos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is said: First, the object is not a property that is common to all.

original: gcig gis nye bar spyod pa na yang thams cad kyis spyad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis nye bar spyod pa na yang thams cad kyis spyad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one person were to enjoy it, it would follow that all would enjoy it.

original: 'di skyes bu'i ngo bo rtag tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyes bu'i ngo bo rtag tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that the nature of the person remains permanent,

original: rtag tu nye bar longs spyod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu nye bar longs spyod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always be enjoyed.

original: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i yul la nye bar longs spyod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i yul la nye bar longs spyod pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, it is logical that this enjoyment of an occasional object

original: gsal ba skyes bu'i chos bya ba'i bdag nyid can yin par rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba skyes bu'i chos bya ba'i bdag nyid can yin par rigs pa yin la /
translated: is the quality of the manifest person, which is the nature of action.

original: longs spyod pa de mngon sum ma yin na ni longs spyad par bya ba dang longs spyod pa thams cad mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod pa de mngon sum ma yin na ni longs spyad par bya ba dang longs spyod pa thams cad mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that enjoyment is not direct perception, then all that is to be enjoyed and the enjoyment would not be direct perception,

original: dper na gzhan gyi mngon sum gzhan gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i longs spyod pa de mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin du bdag nyid kyi yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi mngon sum gzhan gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i longs spyod pa de mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin du bdag nyid kyi yang 'gyur na /
translated: just as the enjoyment that is made manifest by another person is not made manifest by another person, so it would be for oneself.

original: mngon sum yang yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang yin te /
translated: But it is direct perception.

original: des na nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba thams cad mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba thams cad mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all that contradicts experience is not direct perception. Thus, the object of experience is direct perception.

original: las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúkarma‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir yul yod pa de'i phyir yul longs spyod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul yod pa de'i phyir yul longs spyod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the object exists, it follows that the object is experienced.

original: yul longs spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul longs spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: The object is experienced.

original: yang gis ni skyon gzhan sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang gis ni skyon gzhan sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes another fault.

original: gang gi phyir yul mngon sum pa nye bar spyod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul mngon sum pa nye bar spyod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the object of direct perception is experienced, not another.

original: des na rig bar byas pa'i phyir na spyod pa'i yul yod pa tsam nyid nyams su myong bar grub pa'i longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rig bar byas pa'i phyir na spyod pa'i yul yod pa tsam nyid nyams su myong bar grub pa'i longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is known, the mere existence of the object of experience is established as experience.

original: 'di ltar longs spyad pa'i yul ni shes par byas so zhes skyes bus shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar longs spyad pa'i yul ni shes par byas so zhes skyes bus shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the object of experience is known by a person.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: dmigs par gyur pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma shes na ni @112b longs spyad par bya ba la longs spyad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs par gyur pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su ma shes na ni @112b longs spyad par bya ba la longs spyad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand the nature of the object of enjoyment, then one does not understand the enjoyment itself.

original: longs spyod pa ni dmigs pa nyid yin pas dmigs pa ma shes na ni de'i khyad par can gyi don yang shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni dmigs pa nyid yin pas dmigs pa ma shes na ni de'i khyad par can gyi don yang shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the object of enjoyment is the object itself, if one does not understand the object, then one does not understand the object of the enjoyment.

original: dbyig pa ma shes na dbyig pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa ma shes na dbyig pa can bzhin no //
translated: It is like not understanding the stick, but understanding the stick-holder.

original: longs spyod pa shes par byed pa'i chos tha dad par yang shes pa med do //
analyzed: longs spyod pa shes par byed pa'i chos tha dad par yang shes pa med do //
translated: There is no understanding of the object of enjoyment as a separate phenomenon that causes understanding.

original: des na longs spyad bzhin par shes pa'i yul nyid longs spyad pa longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: des na longs spyad bzhin par shes pa'i yul nyid longs spyad pa longs spyod pa'i rang bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Therefore, the object of the understanding of the enjoyment is understood as the nature of the enjoyment.

original: rig bzhin pa'i yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa rig pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rig bzhin pa'i yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa rig pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the existence of the object of the understanding were the enjoyment,

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then that would not be reasonable.

original: 'di ltar longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid du shes pa'i yul tsam ni thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid du shes pa'i yul tsam ni thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the mere object of the understanding of the nature of the enjoyment is common.

original: ji ltar gzugs la 'di ni de kho na'i yin no zhes bdag nyid la nges par mi shes pa de bzhin du longs spyod pa yang bdag gis mthong ngo zhes khyad par can du nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la 'di ni de kho na'i yin no zhes bdag nyid la nges par mi shes pa de bzhin du longs spyod pa yang bdag gis mthong ngo zhes khyad par can du nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as you do not ascertain the form as being that of the self, you would not ascertain the experience as being that of the self, thinking, ‚ÄúI see this.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yul yod pa tsam gyis bdag nyid so so la khyad par med pa de bzhin du longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yul yod pa tsam gyis bdag nyid so so la khyad par med pa de bzhin du longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the mere presence of the object does not make it different from the self, the experience of the self would not be different from the self.

original: gzhan yang dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa yin par skyes bus rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa yin par skyes bus rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the object of apprehension were understood to be the apprehension,

original: longs spyod par bya ba nyid la longs spyod par nges pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: longs spyod par bya ba nyid la longs spyod par nges pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: then the experience of the object of experience would not be ascertained as the experience of the self.

original: / de'i phyir longs spyod par ni bdag nyid so so la tha dad par dmigs par bya ba las gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: / de'i phyir longs spyod par ni bdag nyid so so la tha dad par dmigs par bya ba las gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the experience of the self would be different from the object of apprehension, which is the object of experience.

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid so so la tha dad pa'i longs spyod pa dmigs par bya ba las gzhan gyi khyad par gyis de dang ldan pa'i yul rig par mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid so so la tha dad pa'i longs spyod pa dmigs par bya ba las gzhan gyi khyad par gyis de dang ldan pa'i yul rig par mi 'gyur ro//
translated: Otherwise, the object that is the basis of the different enjoyments of each individual self would not be known by the consciousness that possesses it.

original: 'di snyam du yul las tha dad pa'i longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin pa yang rang gi rgyud la yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yul las tha dad pa'i longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin pa yang rang gi rgyud la yod pa yin la /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúAlthough the enjoyer is not directly perceived as different from the object, it exists in one‚Äôs continuum.

original: longs spyod pa de nyid ni skyes bu so so la des pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba las tha dad pa yang yin pa de'i phyir yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: longs spyod pa de nyid ni skyes bu so so la des pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba las tha dad pa yang yin pa de'i phyir yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: Since that enjoyer is different from the individual person and the object that is to be enjoyed, why do you say that the object exists and becomes the enjoyer?‚ÄùüîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / longs spyod pa tha dad pa yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: bshad pa / longs spyod pa tha dad pa yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med de /
translated: Even though the enjoyer exists, it is not different from the nonexistent.

original: ji ltar med pa'i longs spyod pa ni nges par longs spyod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa'i longs spyod pa ni nges par longs spyod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du yod kyang ngo //
translated: Just as the nonexistent enjoyer is definitely not an enjoyer, so too the existent one is not.

original: des na khyad par med pa de'i phyir yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang zhig med pa de ni rang gi bsgrub par @113a * //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa de'i phyir yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa rig pa yin par 'gyur ro // gang zhig med pa de ni rang gi bsgrub par @113a * //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference, the object that exists is the experience of consciousness.

original: bya ba'i don byed par mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: bya ba'i don byed par mi nus pa yin la /
translated: If something does not exist, it cannot perform the function of its object of proof.

original: yod pa ni nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa ni nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if it exists, it can perform a function, can‚Äôt it?

original: des na ci'i phyir khyad par med ce na /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir khyad par med ce na /
translated: Why is there no difference?

original: bshad pa / yul de'i longs spyod pa de las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa ma shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / yul de'i longs spyod pa de las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa ma shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: We reply: That experience of the object is not established as different from it, because it is not known.

original: mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not appear.

original: 'dir shes par byas pa'i don ni longs spyad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir shes par byas pa'i don ni longs spyad pa yin la /
translated: Here the object of consciousness is the object of experience.

original: longs spyad par yang longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: longs spyad par yang longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: And the object of experience is the state of experience.

original: de'i phyir shes par gyur ba'i don gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig nyid longs spyad pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i longs spyod par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes par gyur ba'i don gyi gnas skabs 'ga' zhig nyid longs spyad pa'i khyad par du gyur pa'i longs spyod par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that the state of the object of consciousness is the experience that is the difference of experience.

original: tha dad par gyur pa'i longs spyod pa shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa'i longs spyod pa shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that consciousness is aware of a separate experiencer.

original: des na gzhan gyi longs spyod pa bzhin du longs spyad pa'i don gyi khyad par dngos po la yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi longs spyod pa bzhin du longs spyad pa'i don gyi khyad par dngos po la yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, just like the experiencer of another, the object of experience is not different from what exists in reality, even though it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir yul yod pa tsam shes par gyur pa'i yul yod pa tsam longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul yod pa tsam shes par gyur pa'i yul yod pa tsam longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when there is mere consciousness of an object, the mere existence of the object is experienced.üîΩEven though consciousness is not aware of itself, the object is aware of itself.

original: shes pa ma shes kyang yul shes pa yin no zhes pha rol gyi 'dod pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir khas blangs nas shes par 'gyur ba'i yod pa nyid tsam zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ma shes kyang yul shes pa yin no zhes pha rol gyi 'dod pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir khas blangs nas shes par 'gyur ba'i yod pa nyid tsam zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In order to refute the assertion of others, we accept that mere existence is known by consciousness.

original: ma grub ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: bshad pa / longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa / longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin pas so //
translated: It is said: Because the experiencer is not directly perceived.

original: 'o na ni lkog tu gyur pa'i longs spyod pa rtags las shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni lkog tu gyur pa'i longs spyod pa rtags las shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the experiencer is hidden, it is known through a reason.

original: bshad pa / rtags can ni rtags kyis rab tu sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rtags can ni rtags kyis rab tu sbyar ba ste /
translated: It is said: The possessor of a reason is applied by reason.

original: rtags kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi nye bar longs spyod pa de ni longs spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtags kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi nye bar longs spyod pa de ni longs spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the enjoyment of one who has a sign is not enjoyment,

original: longs spyod kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the nature of enjoyment.

original: yang ni gtan tshigs bsags pa ste /
analyzed: yang ni gtan tshigs bsags pa ste /
translated: Or, the reason is accumulated.

original: gtan tshigs 'dis kyang rtags grub pa yin yang yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis kyang rtags grub pa yin yang yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the reason proves the sign, the existence of the object becomes the enjoyment.

original: ji ltar na gzhan gyi longs spyod bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan gyi longs spyod bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
translated: How is it like the enjoyment of another?

original: ji ltar rtags can gyi longs spyod ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags can gyi longs spyod ma yin zhe na /
translated: And how is it not the enjoyment of one who has a sign?

original: smras pa / longs spyod pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i don yin gyi lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / longs spyod pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i don yin gyi lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is said: Enjoyment is an object that is manifest, not hidden.

original: de'i phyir longs spyod na ni don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir longs spyod na ni don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs yin na /
translated: Therefore, if there is enjoyment, it is the state of direct perception of the object.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas skabs ma yin te /
translated: A consciousness that is hidden is not the state of being manifest.

original: des na don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa yong pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa yong pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the existence of the object that is the direct perception of the object becomes the enjoyment.

original: de la yang nyes pa brjod zin to //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa brjod zin to //
translated: The faults of this have already been explained.

original: gal te don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas @113b skabs longs spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas @113b skabs longs spyod pa yin na /
translated: If it is the state of directly perceiving the object that is the experience,

original: 'o na ni shes pa mngon sum yin yang longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa mngon sum yin yang longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then even though consciousness is direct perception, it would not be experience,

original: de ni don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not the state of directly perceiving the object.

original: 'o na de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum gyi rang bzhin spangs nas don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs gzhan gang yin par brtag par nus /
analyzed: 'o na de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum gyi rang bzhin spangs nas don gyi mngon sum gyi gnas skabs gzhan gang yin par brtag par nus /
translated: Well then, how could you conceive of the state of direct perception of the object, which is the nature of the consciousness that apprehends its nature, as being different from the nature of direct perception?

original: de ltar na 'o na mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na mngon sum du gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can yul yod pa nyid longs spyod pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, the state of directly perceiving the object would be the experience of the existence of the object,

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: but it would not be the experience of the hidden consciousness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin na ni longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum du mi 'gyur bas thams cad mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'di nyid du sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin na ni longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum du mi 'gyur bas thams cad mngon sum ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'di nyid du sngar brjod zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: da ltar ni longs spyod pa med par longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum du khas blangs nas yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par thal lo zhes nyes pa gzhan 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ni longs spyod pa med par longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum du khas blangs nas yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par thal lo zhes nyes pa gzhan 'god pa yin te /
translated: Now, without the experiencer, the object of experience is directly perceived, and the fault is stated that it follows that the existent object is experienced.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi shes pa la ma gtogs pa mngon sum gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i don ni gzhan gyi ngor nyes pa brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi de kho nar ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi shes pa la ma gtogs pa mngon sum gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i don ni gzhan gyi ngor nyes pa brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi de kho nar ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, apart from the consciousness that is direct perception, there is no object that is direct perception by nature. This is stated for the sake of expressing a fault from the perspective of others, but not in reality, so there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du sngar yang don gyi shes pa'i gnas skabs ni shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar yang don gyi shes pa'i gnas skabs ni shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: In the same way, previously, the state of consciousness of an object is consciousness itself.

original: yod pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni skyon brjod pa'i don du gzhan gyi dor khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid 'ba' zhig ni skyon brjod pa'i don du gzhan gyi dor khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Only existence is accepted by others for the sake of stating a fault.

original: longs spyod pa'i rtags grub par khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i rtags grub par khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: Having accepted that the experience of the object is established, he says this:

original: rtags mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason is illogical.

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtags las kyang shes pa zhes bya ba'i longs spyod pa mi 'grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtags las kyang shes pa zhes bya ba'i longs spyod pa mi 'grub pa nyid de /
translated: Also, from that means that the experience called consciousness is not established from the reason.

original: sngar spyod pa'i rtag par bya ba rtags mi 'thad pa nyid ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar spyod pa'i rtag par bya ba rtags mi 'thad pa nyid ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as previously explained, the reason for the experience of the object is illogical.

original: gal te yul longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin na thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yul longs spyod pa mngon sum ma yin na thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If the experience of the object is not direct perception, then everything is not direct perception.

original: longs spyod bar bya ba mngon sum yin na yang yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur la de yang nyes pa sngar brjod zin na 'o na ni yul longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod bar bya ba mngon sum yin na yang yul yod pa nyid longs spyod par 'gyur la de yang nyes pa sngar brjod zin na 'o na ni yul longs spyod pa ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: If the experience of the object is direct perception, then the object itself would be experienced, and that has been previously explained.

original: gang gi phyir blo'i me long la skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan dang yul gyi gzugs brnyan tshogs pa'i longs spyod pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo'i me long la skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan dang yul gyi gzugs brnyan tshogs pa'i longs spyod pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: The experience of the object is direct perception because the experience of the object is the collection of the reflection of the person and the reflection of the object in the mirror of the mind.

original: skyes bu ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But a person is not directly perceived.

original: de ltar na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes gsungs te /
translated: If that is so, then,

original: skyon der gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: skyon der gyur pa na'o //
translated: if that fault arises,

original: gang yang dngos pos dngos po @114a * //
analyzed: gang yang dngos pos dngos po @114a * //
translated: then, since a thing is indicated by a thing,

original: mtshon pas zhes bya bas 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshon pas zhes bya bas 'dun pa yin no //
translated: the intention is that

original: skyon gyi dngos pos yul longs spyod pa mngon sum gyis dngos por mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: skyon gyi dngos pos yul longs spyod pa mngon sum gyis dngos por mtshon pa yin te /
translated: the object of experience is indicated by the thing that is direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir skyon du thal ba na yul dmigs pa longs spyod kyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa de ltar gyur na longs spyad par bya ba dang / longs spyod par byed pa dang / longs spyod par byed pa po yod pa'i tha snyad rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyon du thal ba na yul dmigs pa longs spyod kyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa de ltar gyur na longs spyad par bya ba dang / longs spyod par byed pa dang / longs spyod par byed pa po yod pa'i tha snyad rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: If the object of experience, which has the nature of the perception of an object, were to be grasped by direct perception, then the conventions of the object of experience, the experiencer, and the experiencing would be complete.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: ‚Äú Since‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rdzogs pa de'i phyir sems pa yod pa gzhan brtags pa ni don med de //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzogs pa de'i phyir sems pa yod pa gzhan brtags pa ni don med de //
translated: Since that is complete, it is pointless to imagine any other existent,

original: dgos pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: because that would be purposeless.

original: gang gi phyir longs spyad par bya ba las tha dad pa'i longs spyod par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis longs spyad par bya bar gsal bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir longs spyad par bya ba las tha dad pa'i longs spyod par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid ni de'i rnam pa nyid kyis longs spyad par bya bar gsal bar snang ba yin no //
translated: Because the experiencer that is different from the object of experience is itself the object of experience, appearing clearly in the aspect of that.

original: des na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i dmigs par byed pa de nyid bye ba por snang ba ni longs spyod par byed pa por zhen pa yin no ;üîΩ/ de mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyang yul mngon sum du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: des na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i dmigs par byed pa de nyid bye ba por snang ba ni longs spyod par byed pa por zhen pa yin no ; / de mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyang yul mngon sum du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of that which is the object of observation, which is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù as the agent is the conception of the experiencer.

original: longs spyod par byed pa yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod par byed pa yang de nyid yin te /
translated: The object of experience is the object of direct perception, and the experiencer is that itself.

original: mngon sum nyid rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception is not different from its nature.

original: des na longs spyod pa po nyid longs spyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad rdzogs par longs spyod par byed pa ma yin la longs spyod pa po yang ma yin la /
analyzed: des na longs spyod pa po nyid longs spyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad rdzogs par longs spyod par byed pa ma yin la longs spyod pa po yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, because the experiencer is the experiencer, the conventional is not the experiencer, nor is it the experiencer.

original: longs spyad par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i lkog tu gyur pa sems pa can gzhan mngon sum dang 'thad pas stong pa dang zhig blo la gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed par brtags pa de ni mngon sum dang 'thad pas stong pa dang dgos pa med pas de
analyzed: longs spyad par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i lkog tu gyur pa sems pa can gzhan mngon sum dang 'thad pas stong pa dang zhig blo la gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed par brtags pa de ni mngon sum dang 'thad pas stong pa dang dgos pa med pas de
translated: It is empty of direct perception and inference, and it is pointless.

original: ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gang skyes bu so so la tha dad pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba las gzhan du gyur ba'i longs spyod par byed pa de ni gdon mi za bar snang bar khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang skyes bu so so la tha dad pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba las gzhan du gyur ba'i longs spyod par byed pa de ni gdon mi za bar snang bar khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: If it is different for each person, and it is different from the object of enjoyment, then it must be accepted that it appears.

original: de ltar gyur ba na yang tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir sems pa can gzhan nam ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba na yang tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir sems pa can gzhan nam ;
translated: But if it is like that, then because the convention is complete, what is the use of a conscious being or

original: gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: the basis of the reflection?

original: 'di snyam du gal te sems pa yod pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin du chug pa de lta na yang nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dmigs pa ni blo las gzhan yin no snyam na de yang zhes smos te /üîΩre zhig tha snyad rdzogs pa'i yul la sems pa'i bdag @114b nyid can gyi dmigs pa de ni blo dang rang bzhin gcig tu mthong zhing gang gis tha dad par brtag par bya ba mthong ba 'di la ni rab rib can gyis mthong ba bzhin du gnod par
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te sems pa yod pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin du chug pa de lta na yang nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dmigs pa ni blo las gzhan yin no snyam na de yang zhes smos te / re zhig tha snyad rdzogs pa'i yul la sems pa'i bdag @114b nyid can gyi dmigs pa de ni blo dang rang bzhin gcig tu mthong zhing gang gis tha dad par brtag par bya ba mthong ba 'di la ni rab rib can gyis mthong ba bzhin du gnod par
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúthat‚Äù .

original: byed pa yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byed pa yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: First, the object that has the nature of intention in the domain of conventional reality is seen to be of the same nature as the mind. One might think that it is different, but in this case, as in the case of someone with an eye disease, one does not see any impairment.

original: gnod par byed ba med par ni gzhan du nyams su myong ba la gzhan du brtags pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnod par byed ba med par ni gzhan du nyams su myong ba la gzhan du brtags pa mi rigs te /
translated: Without impairment, it is not tenable to imagine something else in the experience of something else.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no /
translated: Since there is no impairment, it is not established that there is error. This will be explained.

original: rnam 'grel las kyang gnod par byed pa'i rigs pa med par ni nyams su myong ba spang bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las kyang gnod par byed pa'i rigs pa med par ni nyams su myong ba spang bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Without a reasoning that would invalidate it, it is not right to reject the experience.

original: 'di la nyams sum myong ba tha dad pa'i tha snyad du yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la nyams sum myong ba tha dad pa'i tha snyad du yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the difference of the experiences is not tenable even conventionally.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is a reason.

original: tha snyad kyi yan lag rnam pa dang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa dang / gang yang myong ba de dag tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yan lag rnam pa dang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa dang / gang yang myong ba de dag tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of a conventional part and the experience that is it are not different, and it is not another.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yul dmigs pa zhes bya ba longs spyod pa po'i bya ba'i bdag nyid longs spyod par byed pa mngon sum yin pa na nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i longs spyod pa po dang longs spyod par byed pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba'i tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i sems pa yod pa bkag pa la nyams su myong ba nyid sems pa can du gnas par rtogs nas gzhan rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yul dmigs pa zhes bya ba longs spyod pa po'i bya ba'i bdag nyid longs spyod par byed pa mngon sum yin pa na nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i longs spyod pa po dang longs spyod par byed pa dang / longs spyad par bya ba'i tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i sems pa yod pa bkag pa la nyams su myong ba nyid sems pa can du gnas par rtogs nas gzhan rtsod par byed de /
translated: Therefore, in this way, when the so-called object-support is the direct perception of the nature of the activity of the experiencer, then the convention of the experiencer, the experience, and the experienced is complete, because it follows after the experience.  Having understood that the experiencer is the experiencer of the experience, which refutes the existence of a separate intention, another argues:

original: lcags kyi gong bu las me bzhin du blo dang sems pa can dag 'dres pas rnam par dbyer med de /
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu las me bzhin du blo dang sems pa can dag 'dres pas rnam par dbyer med de /
translated: Just as fire is from a mass of iron, the mind and the experiencer are mixed, so they are inseparable.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no understanding of their separation.

original: sems pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid ston par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Intention‚Äù shows this.

original: sems pa ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni skyes bu'o //
translated: Intention is the person.

original: zhen pa ni blo ste /
analyzed: zhen pa ni blo ste /
translated: Desire is the mind.

original: 'di ltar dmigs par bya ba'i yul snang ba na blo dang skyes bu'i rang bzhin dmigs par gyur pa de'i tshe blo'i bdag nyid la skyes bu'i grib ma babs pa'i phyir de dag ni rnam par dbye ba dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs par bya ba'i yul snang ba na blo dang skyes bu'i rang bzhin dmigs par gyur pa de'i tshe blo'i bdag nyid la skyes bu'i grib ma babs pa'i phyir de dag ni rnam par dbye ba dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the object of perception appears, the nature of the mind and the person are perceived. At that time, because the shadow of the person falls on the nature of the mind, they are perceived as distinct.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu ni gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu ni gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa yin la /
translated: Because the person is the one who places the reflection,

original: gzugs brnyan dang ldan pa'i blo yang longs spyod pa po dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang ldan pa'i blo yang longs spyod pa po dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: and the mind that possesses the reflection is like the experiencer.

original: / longs spyod pa po ni de nyid yin te 'di lta ste gzugs brnyan gtod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / longs spyod pa po ni de nyid yin te 'di lta ste gzugs brnyan gtod par byed pa'o //
translated: The experiencer is the very same one, that is, the one who places the reflection.

original: de'i phyir longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyis de gnyis 'dres pas na rnam par dbye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyis de gnyis 'dres pas na rnam par dbye ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the mixing of those two in the nature of experience, they are not distinct.

original: longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can 'dres ba des bslus pa'i rtogs pa po ni longs spyod pa po'i skyes @115a * //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid can 'dres ba des bslus pa'i rtogs pa po ni longs spyod pa po'i skyes @115a * //
translated: The experiencer, deceived by that mixing which has the nature of the experience, is the experiencer.

original: bu dang de'i gzugs brnyan can gyi blo longs spyod pa po dang 'dra ba'i phyir longs spyod pa po nyid du snang ba tha dad par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: bu dang de'i gzugs brnyan can gyi blo longs spyod pa po dang 'dra ba'i phyir longs spyod pa po nyid du snang ba tha dad par mi rtog ste /
translated: Because the son and the cognition of the son‚Äôs reflection are similar to the experiencer, the experiencer does not conceive the appearance as different.

original: dper na 'dres pas bslus pa'i lta ba pos lcags kyi gong bu me las tha dad par mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dres pas bslus pa'i lta ba pos lcags kyi gong bu me las tha dad par mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a viewer deceived by a mixture does not conceive the lump of iron as different from the fire.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa mi phyed par 'gyur ba lcags kyi gong bu dang me dag gcig la ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa mi phyed par 'gyur ba lcags kyi gong bu dang me dag gcig la ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: If the difference is not distinguished, how can the lump of iron and the fire exist in one?

original: smras pa / me dang lcags gong de gnyis kyi gzugs dang reg pa ni nges ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / me dang lcags gong de gnyis kyi gzugs dang reg pa ni nges ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We say: Because the form and the touch of the fire and the lump of iron are ascertained.

original: lcags gong gi sra ba dang dbyi bas dang / me'i gzugs dmar po dang dro ba'i reg pa yang rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lcags gong gi sra ba dang dbyi bas dang / me'i gzugs dmar po dang dro ba'i reg pa yang rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The solidity and fluidity of the lump of iron and the red color and hot touch of the fire are also perceived.

original: des na ji lta gnyi ga yod pa la phan tshun zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dres par tha dad par mi rtogs pa de bzhin du gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa'i skyes bu dang gzugs brnyan can gyi blo rnam pa gcig pa nyid kyis 'dres pa'i phyir rnam
analyzed: des na ji lta gnyi ga yod pa la phan tshun zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dres par tha dad par mi rtogs pa de bzhin du gzugs brnyan 'jog par byed pa'i skyes bu dang gzugs brnyan can gyi blo rnam pa gcig pa nyid kyis 'dres pa'i phyir rnam
translated: Therefore, just as the two modes of existence are not understood to be mixed through the characteristic of mutual engagement, in the same way, the person who posits the reflection and the cognition that possesses the reflection are mixed because they have the same aspect.

original: par dbye ba rtogs pa med pa yin no zhe de ltar gzhan dag dogs pa la /
analyzed: par dbye ba rtogs pa med pa yin no zhe de ltar gzhan dag dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the distinction between them is not understood.üîΩIn response to this qualm of others,

original: lan gdab pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: lan gdab pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: we say:

original: de lta yin na ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na ste /
translated: If that were so,

original: rgyu mtshan 'chol par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan 'chol par 'gyur ba na /
translated: then the reason would be confused.üîΩThe presentation of all things as different or nondifferent would be destroyed.

original: dngos po kun la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa de dag gi rnam gzhag des pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa de dag gi rnam gzhag des pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: The presentation ‚ÄúThis is different.

original: 'di ni tha dad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa de ni nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni tha dad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa de ni nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: This is nondifferent‚Äù would be destroyed.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the presentation of difference and nondifference would not occur in any way.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa na ji ltar tha dad pa med pa de ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa na ji ltar tha dad pa med pa de ston par byed de /
translated: When this is explained, it shows how they are not different.

original: don dmigs pa thams cad la ji ltar skyes bu dang blo tha dad pa med par snang yang tha dad pa de bzhin du 'di yang tha dad pa yin no zhes 'dres par dgos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: don dmigs pa thams cad la ji ltar skyes bu dang blo tha dad pa med par snang yang tha dad pa de bzhin du 'di yang tha dad pa yin no zhes 'dres par dgos par 'gyur la /
translated: When all objects are observed, although they appear to the person and the mind as undifferentiated, they are differentiated.

original: 'dres par dogs pa des kyang gcig tu nges pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dres par dogs pa des kyang gcig tu nges pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: The doubt that they are mixed also makes it impossible to ascertain them as one.

original: gcig nyid du ma rtogs pa las kyang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa yin no /
analyzed: gcig nyid du ma rtogs pa las kyang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa yin no /
translated: And the non-apprehension of them as one also undermines the presentation of them as undifferentiated.

original: 'di tsam zhig ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa la yang dgong par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa la yang dgong par nus pa yin te /
translated: This much is capable of undermining the presentation of them as different.

original: 'di ltar sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa tha dad ba rnams la ni phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa tha dad ba rnams la ni phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For, with regard to things that have different natures and aspects, their natures are not mutually related.

original: dper na bum pa snam bu ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa snam bu ma yin la /
translated: For example, a pot is not a cloth.

original: snam bu yang bum pa'i rang bzhin med pa de'i phyir du ma nyid du des par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snam bu yang bum pa'i rang bzhin med pa de'i phyir du ma nyid du des par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: and the cloth is also definitely not the nature of the pot.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa gcig la yang du ma nyid du dgos pa de'i tshe ma dmigs @115b khyad bum pa yang snam bu'i rang bzhin du dgos par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa gcig la yang du ma nyid du dgos pa de'i tshe ma dmigs @115b khyad bum pa yang snam bu'i rang bzhin du dgos par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When one is certain that even one aspect is not multiple, then at that time the pot would also definitely be the nature of the cloth.

original: de bzhin du ma dmigs kyang thams cad la thams cad kyi rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'ga' yang gang las kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma dmigs kyang thams cad la thams cad kyi rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'ga' yang gang las kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And likewise, even though not observed, the nature of everything would follow in everything, and therefore nothing would be different from anything.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan med par des ba yin na ni gcig gi tha snyad du 'gyur bas de'i tshe 'das pa nyid kyang rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan med par des ba yin na ni gcig gi tha snyad du 'gyur bas de'i tshe 'das pa nyid kyang rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one is certain that something does not exist because it is not observed, then it would be a convention of one, and at that time the past itself would be established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gcig gi tha snyad yod na ni du ma'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi de med na ni du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ga nyams pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rang gis khas blangs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i tha snyad
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gcig gi tha snyad yod na ni du ma'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi de med na ni du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ga nyams pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang rang gis khas blangs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i tha snyad
translated: Therefore, if the convention of one exists, the convention of many would also exist, but if it does not exist, then many would not exist.üîΩTherefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs position is undermined.

original: med par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: med par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: However, in order to demonstrate that the convention of difference does not exist even according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs own assertions, the text says:

original: bde ba dang dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa tha dad par rig pa dag kyang gcig tu khas blangs ba'i phyir to /
analyzed: bde ba dang dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa tha dad par rig pa dag kyang gcig tu khas blangs ba'i phyir to /
translated: Because they assert that the different aspects of pleasure, white color, and so on, which are observed as different, are one.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni sgra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gang smras pa yin no //
translated: They say that pleasure and so on are of the nature of sound and so on.

original: de'i phyir tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs position that they are different is undermined.

original: des na grangs can la tha dad par dmigs pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin tha dad pa tha dad pa med par dmigs pa yang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na grangs can la tha dad par dmigs pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin tha dad pa tha dad pa med par dmigs pa yang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the observation of difference is not a reason for difference, and the observation of nondifference is not a reason for nondifference.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rgyu ci la brten nas rnam par 'jog ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rgyu ci la brten nas rnam par 'jog ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOn the basis of what cause are these posited?‚Äù

original: nges ba dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad rgyu med pa can du ni 'thad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nges ba dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad rgyu med pa can du ni 'thad pa ma yin la /
translated: The conventions of difference and nondifference that are ascertained are not tenable without a cause.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no cause other than the observation of difference and nondifference.

original: tha dad pa tha dad pa med pa 'di dag ni tha snyad med na yang chu don du gnyer ba me la 'jug par sdug bsngal bas 'tsho ba'i phyir ae ma zhes rjes su brtse ba ste ;
analyzed: tha dad pa tha dad pa med pa 'di dag ni tha snyad med na yang chu don du gnyer ba me la 'jug par sdug bsngal bas 'tsho ba'i phyir ae ma zhes rjes su brtse ba ste ;
translated: ‚Äú Alas!‚Äù is an expression of compassion for those who, even without conventions, suffer in their pursuit of water, engaging in fire.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that neither difference nor nondifference would exist.

original: tha dad pa med pa rnam pa tha dad pa med par rig pa gang yin pa de gcig ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa rnam pa tha dad pa med par rig pa gang yin pa de gcig ste /
translated: That which is known as nondifference, without a difference in aspect, is one.

original: gcig gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi tha snyad du rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is suitable as the convention of one.

original: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif consciousness has the aspect of one object‚Äù is ‚Äúif consciousness has the aspect of one object as its cause.‚Äù

original: de ltar gang gang min zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad par rig pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gang gang min zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad par rig pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú In that case, how could it be different?‚Äù means that it is cognized as different.

original: gang gi phyir de tha dad pa dang ldan par tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de tha dad pa dang ldan par tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it has difference, it is established as different.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu ni de spangs pas gnas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩrnam pa tha dad par med par rig pa de gcig nyid kyi tha snyad la sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid na ni tha dad de @116a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu ni de spangs pas gnas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o // rnam pa tha dad par med par rig pa de gcig nyid kyi tha snyad la sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid na ni tha dad de @116a * //
translated: The cause of difference is the abandonment of that.üîΩIf the cognition of the absence of difference in aspect does not establish the convention of one, then difference

original: gcig gi tha snyad dang 'gal ba du ma'i tha snyad la yang shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa sgrub byed du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gi tha snyad dang 'gal ba du ma'i tha snyad la yang shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa sgrub byed du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: is not established as the proof of the convention of many, which is incompatible with the convention of one.

original: gang gi phyir gcig gi tha snyad kyi sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba du ma'i tha snyad kyi sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig gi tha snyad kyi sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba du ma'i tha snyad kyi sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: Because that which is the proof of the convention of one is incompatible with the proof of the convention of many.

original: de ma grub na ni 'di yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma grub na ni 'di yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is not established, then this also is not established.

original: 'dis ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad dag gi rgyu 'gal ba yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad dag gi rgyu 'gal ba yin par bstan nas /
translated: This demonstrates that the cause of the conventions of difference and non-difference are contradictory.

original: da ni grangs can gyi rgyu 'di gnyis spangs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni grangs can gyi rgyu 'di gnyis spangs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that these two causes of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya are rejected, it is said:

original: grangs can gyi dkar sdug la sogs te sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa tha dad snang ste snang ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi dkar sdug la sogs te sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa tha dad snang ste snang ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya say that whatever is white, beautiful, and so on, and blue, pleasure, and so on, is different, but the appearance is the nature of consciousness.

original: shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness.

original: de ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not different.

original: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba yin yang gcig tu 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba yin yang gcig tu 'dod pa yin /
translated: Although it is apprehended by consciousness that appears as different aspects such as white, pleasure, and so on, it is asserted to be one.

original: blo myong na ni tha dad med snang ste snang ba khong du chud pa gang yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: blo myong na ni tha dad med snang ste snang ba khong du chud pa gang yin pa de dag ste /
translated: When the mind experiences it, it appears as undifferentiated.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba yang tha dad de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba yang tha dad de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: That which is understood as the appearance is the object of undifferentiated consciousness.

original: des na shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa /
analyzed: des na shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa /
translated: Therefore, the aspects of consciousness are neither different nor non-different.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of consciousness is neither different nor non-different from the cause.üîΩIt is neither the cause of difference nor non-difference.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rten ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rten ci zhig yin te /
translated: What basis is there for difference or non-difference?

original: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: None at all, is the meaning.

original: tshig le'ur byas par spyir bkod pa zhes 'grel pas kyang rnam par bkral ba'i don sbrel cing legs par bsdebs nas yang dag par bsdu ba de'i don gyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas par spyir bkod pa zhes 'grel pas kyang rnam par bkral ba'i don sbrel cing legs par bsdebs nas yang dag par bsdu ba de'i don gyi phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis te /
translated: The two verses are for the purpose of summarizing the meaning of the commentary, which is an arrangement in general in the verses.

original: bde blag tu don bsdus nas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bde blag tu don bsdus nas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verses are for the easy understanding of the summarized meaning.

original: gal te snang ba tha dad pa med pa gcig gi rgyu yin na 'o na snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i me dang lcags gong dag tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba tha dad pa med pa gcig gi rgyu yin na 'o na snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i me dang lcags gong dag tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the non-different appearance is the cause, then how can the non-different appearance of fire and iron be different?

original: tha dad pa yin no zhes su zhig smra /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin no zhes su zhig smra /
translated: Who says they are different?

original: gang gi phyir blo dang skyes bu 'ba' zhig tha mi dad par ma zad kyi dpe lcags kyi gong bu la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo dang skyes bu 'ba' zhig tha mi dad par ma zad kyi dpe lcags kyi gong bu la yang ngo //
translated: Because not only is the cognition not different from the person, but also the iron ball is not different from the fire.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa lcags kyi gong bu la me lhan cig byed pa dang 'brel pa las te /
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa lcags kyi gong bu la me lhan cig byed pa dang 'brel pa las te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚Äúfrom the cause of appropriation, the iron ball, in connection with the co-operating condition, fire.‚Äù

original: de dag las de ltar khyad par can gyi gzugs dang reg pa skyes pa'i don gzhan gcig nyid ces bya ba gnyis 'brel ba ma yin pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag las de ltar khyad par can gyi gzugs dang reg pa skyes pa'i don gzhan gcig nyid ces bya ba gnyis 'brel ba ma yin pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: From those two, the special form and touch are produced. The meaning of ‚Äúone‚Äù is not a connection between two things.

original: des na de la mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de la mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that case, seeing itself is valid cognition.

original: 'di skad du rigs pa smras bas @116b nyams su myong ba spong ba ni dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du rigs pa smras bas @116b nyams su myong ba spong ba ni dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is taught that it is difficult to refute experience by speaking of logic.

original: tha dad par gyur pa'i me dang lcags gong dag 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa'i me dang lcags gong dag 'dres pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the distinction between the fire and the iron ball is not seen because they are mixed together.

original: nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la tha dad pa'i tha snyad du byed pa ni rtogs par sla ba las snang ba tha dad las sam ;
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la tha dad pa'i tha snyad du byed pa ni rtogs par sla ba las snang ba tha dad las sam ;
translated: The convention of difference is applied to the things that are experienced, whether it is easy to understand that they are different or difficult to understand that they are different.

original: rtogs par dka' ba yin na'ang 'thad pas sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba yin na'ang 'thad pas sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Even if it is difficult to understand, it is established by reasoning.

original: dper na sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag gam /
analyzed: dper na sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag gam /
translated: For example, it is like blue and nonblue,

original: gser gyi cha phal che ba la dngul gyi cha cung zad 'dres pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi cha phal che ba la dngul gyi cha cung zad 'dres pa bzhin no //
translated: or gold in which a small amount of silver is mixed.

original: ser po ro gcig tu snang yang tha dad par khong du chud pa yin te /
analyzed: ser po ro gcig tu snang yang tha dad par khong du chud pa yin te /
translated: Even though yellow appears as a single taste, it is understood to be different.

original: rdzas de dag nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bcas ba las gser dang dngul gyi cha dag skyes par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzas de dag nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bcas ba las gser dang dngul gyi cha dag skyes par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because those substances, together with their coemergent causes, appear to produce the parts of gold and silver.

original: 'ba' zhig gam lhan cig byed pa la ltos kyang bla ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig las 'gal ba skyes pa ni med do zhes sngar lan mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gam lhan cig byed pa la ltos kyang bla ste nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig las 'gal ba skyes pa ni med do zhes sngar lan mang du bshad zin to //
translated: Whether it is alone or in dependence on coemergent causes, there is no arising of contradiction from a single appropriated cause. This has been explained many times before.

original: dngul gyi cha dang 'dres pa'i gser la snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa nyid du rigs kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dngul gyi cha dang 'dres pa'i gser la snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa nyid du rigs kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But since there is no difference in the appearance of gold mixed with silver, it is reasonable that they are not different, not that they are different.

original: ma yin te gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di la dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni der snang ba'i shes pa slu ba med pa can nam rjes su dpag pa las yin zhing /
analyzed: ma yin te gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // 'di la dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni der snang ba'i shes pa slu ba med pa can nam rjes su dpag pa las yin zhing /
translated: No, because we see that it is impaired.üîΩFor the existence of things is established by nondeceptive perception or inference.

original: dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang mi slu ba can gyi snang ba tha dad pa dag gam rjes su dpag pa las yin na /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang mi slu ba can gyi snang ba tha dad pa dag gam rjes su dpag pa las yin na /
translated: And the difference or nondifference of things is established by the nondeceptive appearance of difference or by the nondeceptive inference of difference.

original: tha mi dad par snang ba 'di la ni mi slu ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang ba 'di la ni mi slu ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of the appearance of nondifference, there is no nondeceptiveness,

original: nye bar len pa las byung ba tha dad par mthong ba las tha dad par rjes su dpog pa gnod par byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las byung ba tha dad par mthong ba las tha dad par rjes su dpog pa gnod par byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the inference of nondifference from the perception of difference in the effect is impaired.

original: lcags kyi gong bu la ni me'i mdog tu tha mi dad par snang ba slu ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu la ni me'i mdog tu tha mi dad par snang ba slu ba med pa can yin pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rigs pa yin no //
translated: The color of fire is not different from the mass of iron, because it appears as if inseparable from it and is undeceiving.

original: gal te rdzas gzhan nyid skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas gzhan nyid skyes pa yin na /
translated: If it were produced as a different substance,

original: 'o na rdzas de glo bur du ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rdzas de glo bur du ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could that substance suddenly cease?

original: ji ltar glo bur yin /
analyzed: ji ltar glo bur yin /
translated: How could it be sudden?

original: gang gi phyir ji srid gnas pa'i rgyu yod pa de srid du ni de yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid gnas pa'i rgyu yod pa de srid du ni de yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Because as long as the cause of its endurance exists, it exists.

original: phyis rdzas de'i rgyu rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu me gang yin pa de rgyun chad de log pa'i phyir de yang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis rdzas de'i rgyu rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu me gang yin pa de rgyun chad de log pa'i phyir de yang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, the cause of the substance‚Äôs endurance is the fire. When that is interrupted and ceases, it also ceases.

original: til mar zad na sgron ma ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: til mar zad na sgron ma ldog pa yin no //
translated: When the oil is exhausted, the lamp ceases.

original: gal te de la lcags kyi rdzas med na ji ltar glo bur du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de la lcags kyi rdzas med na ji ltar glo bur du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the substance of iron does not exist in it, how could it be suddenly produced?

original: ci'i phyir glo bur ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir glo bur ba yin /
translated: How could it be sudden?

original: gang gi phyir de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa @117a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa @117a * //
translated: Because it depends on the cause of its appropriation.

original: can grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa smos pas ni yul gyi khyad par dang / chu btab pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩgrang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa de dag las so //üîΩkyang gi sgras ni chu rgyun chad pa'i phyir snga ma ldog pa yang 'thad pa yin la /üîΩrgyu yod pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: can grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa smos pas ni yul gyi khyad par dang / chu btab pa la sogs pa ste / grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa de dag las so // kyang gi sgras ni chu rgyun chad pa'i phyir snga ma ldog pa yang 'thad pa yin la / rgyu yod pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúcold touch, etc.‚Äù indicate the particular object, and ‚Äúfrom water, etc.‚ÄùüîΩindicate the particular cause.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also tenable that the previous state ceases because the stream of water is interrupted.üîΩAnd because the cause exists, another substance is produced.üîΩüîΩ

original: kho bo cag gi lta ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par gnas pa de grub pa ni smos su ci yod /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi lta ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par gnas pa de grub pa ni smos su ci yod /
translated: What need is there to prove the existence of the state of consciousness that apprehends our view?

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum bshad nas /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum bshad nas /
translated: Having explained reflexive-awareness direct perception,

original: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the yogic direct perception,

original: 'jigs sogs bzhin du zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'jigs sogs bzhin du zhes gsungs te ;
translated: it says, ‚ÄúLike fear, etc.‚Äù

original: gsal bar snang ba don byed par bzod pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la ma 'khrul pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba don byed par bzod pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la ma 'khrul pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: A nonconceptual consciousness that is undeluded with respect to the nature of a thing that appears clearly and is able to perform a function is direct perception.

original: de la yid kyi shes pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid 'thad par dka' bas re zhig ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la yid kyi shes pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid 'thad par dka' bas re zhig ston par byed do //
translated: Since it is difficult to establish that a mental consciousness clearly appears to itself, he will teach this point.

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig gsal ba ste gzung bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig gsal ba ste gzung bar snang ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The mere clear appearance of an object is direct perception.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid gang las she na /üîΩbshad pa bsgoms pa'i stobs ni mthu yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid gang las she na / bshad pa bsgoms pa'i stobs ni mthu yin la /
translated: From what is it that there is a clear appearance?üîΩThe power of meditation is strength.

original: bsgoms pa'i mthu yang rab tu gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i mthu yang rab tu gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Since the strength of meditation is also the highest,

original: bsgoms pa rab tu gyur pa de las yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa rab tu gyur pa de las yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang ba yin no //
translated: The clear appearance of the mental consciousness arises from the transformation of the cultivation of the mental consciousness.

original: 'jigs sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i rgyu can du rab tu grags pa'i gsal bar snang ba dpe nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i rgyu can du rab tu grags pa'i gsal bar snang ba dpe nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike fear, etc.‚Äù shows that the clear appearance that is well known to be caused by cultivation is an example.

original: gsal bar snang ba yang slu ba med pa can ma 'khrul pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bsgoms pa na bden pa dang mi bden pa'i dngos po gsal bar snang bar 'gyur la mi bden pa gsal bar snang ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa des na de bzlog par bya
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba yang slu ba med pa can ma 'khrul pa'o // 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bsgoms pa na bden pa dang mi bden pa'i dngos po gsal bar snang bar 'gyur la mi bden pa gsal bar snang ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa des na de bzlog par bya
translated: Clear appearance is nondeceptive, nonerroneous.

original: ba'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the mental consciousness, which has the nature of conception, is cultivated, it becomes clear appearance of real and unreal things. The clear appearance of the unreal is not direct perception. Therefore, in order to refute that, it is said to be nonerroneous.

original: gsal bar snang ba de ni rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba de ni rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: That clear appearance is nonconceptual.

original: des na mngon sum yin te /üîΩbsgoms pas gsal bar snang zhing /
analyzed: des na mngon sum yin te / bsgoms pas gsal bar snang zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is direct perception.üîΩIt is clear appearance because it is cultivated.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rnam @117b par rtog pa med par grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rnam @117b par rtog pa med par grub pa yin la /
translated: Because it is clear appearance, it is established as nonconceptual.

original: tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa yin pas ci'i phyir mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa yin pas ci'i phyir mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: Because it is non-erroneous, being the object of a valid cognition that is completely pure, why would it not be direct perception?

original: mngon sum gzhan yang gsal bar snang ba dang rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gzhan yang gsal bar snang ba dang rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, direct perception is that which is clear and non-erroneous, free from conceptualization.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa na gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rgyu bsgom pa'i go rims ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa na gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rgyu bsgom pa'i go rims ston par byed do //
translated: When this is explained, it shows the order of meditation on the cause of clarity.

original: 'jig rten na ni mnyam par gzhag pa la rnal 'byor pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni mnyam par gzhag pa la rnal 'byor pa yin la /
translated: In the world, one who is in equipoise is a yogi.

original: bstan bcos las ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yin te /
translated: In the treatises, it is one who has the nature of samƒÅdhi and praj√±ƒÅ, ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: rnal 'byor ba de dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba de dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pas te /
translated: Those who have those yogas are yogis.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / de kho na rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / de kho na rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: They are always in equipoise and diligent in discerning reality.

original: de dag rnams kyi gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: What is their clarity? It is connected to that.

original: de dag rnams kyi bsgom pa'i rim pa ci 'dra bar de ston par byed de /üîΩthos pa las byung bas bsgoms pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bstan bcos mnyan pa'i rgyu can gyis bzung ba nges pa'i don bsgom par bya ba /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi bsgom pa'i rim pa ci 'dra bar de ston par byed de / thos pa las byung bas bsgoms pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bstan bcos mnyan pa'i rgyu can gyis bzung ba nges pa'i don bsgom par bya ba /
translated: It teaches the stages of meditation of those who have such meditation.üîΩThe meditation of those who have the cause of listening to the treatise that is compatible with meditation and is derived from listening to the scriptures is meditation on the definitive meaning.üîΩThe meditation of those who have the cause of contemplating and ascertaining with reasoning, that is, valid knowledge, is meditation on the meaning that is ascertained by reasoning.üîΩThe meditation of those who have the cause of the consciousness that, having ascertained the meaning, is set in the mind and is established is meditation on the meaning that is ascertained by the mind.

analyzed: rigs pas te tshad mas sems shing nges par rtog pa ni rigs pa sems pa'o //

original: de'i rgyu can gyi shes pas don de khyad par du rnam par phye bar blo la bkod cing bzhag nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom par byed pa de rnams kyi sgom pa rdzogs shing don rnams la gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'iüîΩrgyur gyur pa'i mthu ste yod pa na gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩgsal bar snang ba'i shugs kyis shes pa yin par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi shes pas don de khyad par du rnam par phye bar blo la bkod cing bzhag nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom par byed pa de rnams kyi sgom pa rdzogs shing don rnams la gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'iüîΩrgyur gyur pa'i mthu ste yod pa na gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩgsal bar snang ba'i shugs kyis shes pa yin par gzung ba yin no //
