translated: Therefore, if the nature of consciousness is the nature of mental consciousness, how could it be that mental consciousness apprehends objects?

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
analyzed: rnam shes yul 'dzin pa yi chos //
translated: The nature of consciousness is to apprehend objects.

original: de ni ji ltar yod pa bzhin //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar yod pa bzhin //
translated: It is as it exists.

original: zhes shes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes shes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it explains that consciousness is by nature the apprehension of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams log pa las kyang skyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams log pa las kyang skyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the adventitious defilements such as ignorance do not arise from the cessation of consciousness,

original: rgyu drungs phyung ba'i phyir dang / de dag shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu drungs phyung ba'i phyir dang / de dag shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause has been uprooted and because they are not by nature consciousness.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
translated: Nonviolence and the right object

original: ngo bo nyid la zhes bdag med pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog pa med pa'i chos su bshad do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la zhes bdag med pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog pa med pa'i chos su bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means that the consciousness which is the nature of the vision of selflessness is not a phenomenon that can be stopped.

original: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba grub pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid bsgoms pa'i rgyu can yin par 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba grub pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid bsgoms pa'i rgyu can yin par 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the clear appearance that is the cause of the realization of omniscience and freedom from attachment is something that must be established with effort.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa dang / bdag med pa mthong ba yin /üîΩmngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa dang / bdag med pa mthong ba yin / mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Omniscience is the vision of selflessness.üîΩIt is direct perception.

original: gsal bar snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag 'gal bar brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yang don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag 'gal bar brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba yang don dam pa yin no //
translated: It is also the case that clear appearance and conceptual thought are contradictory.

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi dbang po nyid lta ba po yin pa dang / slob dpon gyis lung la brten ba'i yid kyi mngon sum bkod pa la gzhan gyis skyon brjod pa dang / kha cig rang rig pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi dbang po nyid lta ba po yin pa dang / slob dpon gyis lung la brten ba'i yid kyi mngon sum bkod pa la gzhan gyis skyon brjod pa dang / kha cig rang rig pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because the Vaibhasikas say that the sense faculties are the perceivers, because others have criticized the master Dignagas positing mental direct perception based on scripture, and because some do not accept reflexive awareness or the consciousness of a yogi,

original: log par rtogs pa 'di thams cad bsal ba'i don du mngon sum rnam pa bzhi rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid dang bcas par bshad nas /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa 'di thams cad bsal ba'i don du mngon sum rnam pa bzhi rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid dang bcas par bshad nas /
translated: in order to dispel all these misconceptions, he explains the four types of direct perception together with their characteristics, free of conceptualization and free of error.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that he and the master Dignaga are in agreement,

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po dang bdag nyid lhan cig 'dod pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po dang bdag nyid lhan cig 'dod pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: ma 'khrul pa'i rnam par gcad par bya ba sten pa na /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i rnam par gcad par bya ba sten pa na /
translated: when one relies on the object of non mistaken direct perception,

original: slob @124a * //
analyzed: slob @124a * //
translated: the master Dignaga and I are in agreement.üîΩWhen the master Dignaga and I are in agreement,üîΩthe master Dignaga and I are in agreement.üîΩWhen the master Dignaga and I are in agreement,

original: dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i rjes su 'brang ba rtog pa dang bral ba tsam zhig thos pa dang ldan bas ma 'khrul pa smos pa la /
analyzed: dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i rjes su 'brang ba rtog pa dang bral ba tsam zhig thos pa dang ldan bas ma 'khrul pa smos pa la /
translated: the master Dignaga and I are in agreement.

original: smad pa dang bcas pa'i gud na gnas pa slong bar byed de /
analyzed: smad pa dang bcas pa'i gud na gnas pa slong bar byed de /
translated: It is refuted by the following:

original: gal te gsal bar snang ba thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gsal bar snang ba thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: If all that appears clearly is nonconceptual,üîΩand if nonconceptual is said to be direct perception,

original: rtog pa med pa yang mngon sum du brjod pa de lta na 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa yang mngon sum du brjod pa de lta na 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: then, because the consciousness in a dream appears clearly, it is nonconceptual.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it would be direct perception.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: ma 'khrul pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to be mistaken.

original: gang zhig rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes kho bos brjod zin pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yang 'di yin pa de ltar ni de ma thag pa nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes kho bos brjod zin pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yang 'di yin pa de ltar ni de ma thag pa nyid du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because we have already stated that that which is free from conceptuality and is nonmistaken is direct perception, and because that is also the intention of the master, that is how it will be taught immediately following this.

original: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba yang gang gis 'khrul pa de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba yang gang gis 'khrul pa de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the consciousness in a dream is mistaken, even though it appears clearly, it is not direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang yang mngon sum ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis su bdag gis brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa gsal bar snang yang mngon sum ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis su bdag gis brjod la /
translated: Because the consciousness in a dream appears clearly but is not direct perception, therefore I have described two kinds of seeming direct perception.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang ji ltar brjod pa de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang ji ltar brjod pa de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the Master will explain them as described.

original: re zhig gcig ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig gcig ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: One is conceptual.

original: de yang dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: And that is a kind of seeming direct perception because it is not a thing, because it is devoid of the appearance of a thing.

original: nye bar bslad pa ni phyin ci log gi don can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa ni phyin ci log gi don can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The other is a kind of seeming direct perception because it is a deceptive object, a consciousness that is mistaken about its object.

original: slu ba'i phyir te don mi 'thob pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir te don mi 'thob pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: It is a kind of seeming direct perception because it is deceptive, because it does not obtain its object.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las don gyis thob pa'i rnam pa gnyis po 'grel par dngos su kha bskangs nas rnam pa gnyis kyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las don gyis thob pa'i rnam pa gnyis po 'grel par dngos su kha bskangs nas rnam pa gnyis kyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The two kinds of seeming direct perception that are implied in the root text are supplemented in the commentary and indicated by the word ‚Äútwo.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te rnam par rtog ba can gyi shes pa thams cad mi bden pa'i don can yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'ga' zhig mi slu ba nyid du 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog ba can gyi shes pa thams cad mi bden pa'i don can yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'ga' zhig mi slu ba nyid du 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Even if all conceptual consciousnesses have unreal objects, still, by the power of convention, some are accepted as nondeceptive.

original: de yang dngos po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: And since they are free from the aspect of an object, they appear like direct perception.

original: log par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de la slu ba nyid kyis don snang ba dang bral ba des na 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: log par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de la slu ba nyid kyis don snang ba dang bral ba des na 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Also, a consciousness that appears falsely is deceptive with respect to what is accepted, and since it is free from the appearance of an object, it is mistaken.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis bsal to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis bsal to //
translated: Both of these are refuted by the mere mention of nonmistaken.

original: ma 'khrul ba smos pas ni bslad pa bsal ba yin la rnam par rtog pa med pas ni rnam par rtog pa zhes de skad ni brjod par mi @124b nus te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba smos pas ni bslad pa bsal ba yin la rnam par rtog pa med pas ni rnam par rtog pa zhes de skad ni brjod par mi @124b nus te /
translated: The mention of nonmistaken refutes adulterated, and the mention of nonconceptual refutes conceptual, but it is not possible to say that it is nonconceptual.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is because it is not mentioned in order to teach its characteristics.

original: gzhan du na ni rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa bsal la /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa bsal la /
translated: Otherwise, the statement free from conceptuality would eliminate all thought.

original: bslad pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin ba na ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur bas ma 'khrul pa smos par lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslad pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin ba na ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur bas ma 'khrul pa smos par lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were stated that it is free from conceptuality, then it would be excessive to state that it is nonerroneous, since a mistaken consciousness is a distorted consciousness.üîΩMoreover, the immediately preceding statement is ‚Äúbecause direct perception is the appearance of things.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i gang gi phyir mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba yin te zhes bya ba de mtshan nyid gang gis bsdus /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i gang gi phyir mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba yin te zhes bya ba de mtshan nyid gang gis bsdus /
translated: By what characteristic is it subsumed?

original: gal te mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur par brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur par brjod na ni /
translated: If it is said to be external to the characteristic,

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gnyis kyis gnyis bsal bar bya ba las snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i gzhan gyis bsal bar rtsom pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gnyis kyis gnyis bsal bar bya ba las snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i gzhan gyis bsal bar rtsom pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then at that time, since the two are eliminated by the two characteristics, what is the use of beginning to eliminate the other that is not subsumed by the prior nonexistence characteristic?

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'i shes pa ni 'di dag tsam zhig srid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'i shes pa ni 'di dag tsam zhig srid de /
translated: Therefore, it is just these that are possible as the consciousness that is like direct perception:

original: 'di dag ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ste /
translated: these

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bzhed pa yin la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bzhed pa yin la /
translated: are conceptual and nonconceptual.

original: de gnyi ga yang ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Since both of these are included in the very statement ‚Äúnonerroneous,‚Äù

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pa med par rnam par rtog pa med pa smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa kho na bsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pa med par rnam par rtog pa med pa smos pas ni rnam par rtog pa kho na bsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: if one were to state ‚Äúnonconceptual‚Äù without stating ‚Äúnonerroneous,‚Äù only conceptual cognition would be excluded.

original: mi 'khrul pa smos pa yod na yang gnyi ga bsal ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa smos pa yod na yang gnyi ga bsal ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid do //
translated: But since the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù is present, the statement ‚Äúnonconceptual‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding misconception, since both are excluded.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa gcod pa grub kyang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa gcod pa grub kyang /
translated: Since it is based on right knowledge, the refutation of dream cognition is established.

original: mi slu bar mngon par 'dod pa'i gsal bar snang ba gzhan bcad pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba yin no zhes mtshan nyid gsal bar brjod zin to //
analyzed: mi slu bar mngon par 'dod pa'i gsal bar snang ba gzhan bcad pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba yin no zhes mtshan nyid gsal bar brjod zin to //
translated: But in order to refute the other, namely, the appearance of clarity that is asserted to be nondeceptive, the statement ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù is to be made. Thus the definition has been clearly stated.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam gyi shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúdream cognition‚Äù is the context of dream cognition.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni ji ltar yang rung ba'i dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni ji ltar yang rung ba'i dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúnon-mistaken‚Äù is for the purpose of showing that it has the necessary purpose in any case.

original: yang ji ltar na dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mngon sum ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mngon sum ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that conceptual consciousness appears to be like perception, because the thing does not appear?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir mngon sum gang la dngos po snang ba yod pa de ni de lta bu ste kho bo dang slob dpon gyis brjod zin to //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir mngon sum gang la dngos po snang ba yod pa de ni de lta bu ste kho bo dang slob dpon gyis brjod zin to //
translated: We have already explained that perception is like that, in which the thing appears, by us and by the master.

original: de ga las she na /üîΩde med na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ga las she na / de med na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po de med na mngon sum de'i rnam pa gzung ba'i rnam pa de nyams pa ste ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de med na mngon sum de'i rnam pa gzung ba'i rnam pa de nyams pa ste ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it does not exist, that is, if that thing does not exist, then the aspect of that perception, the apprehended aspect, is lost, that is, it is eliminated.

original: gang gi phyir 'dis mngon sum gyi snang ba ni don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig shes pa'i snang @125a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis mngon sum gyi snang ba ni don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig shes pa'i snang @125a * //
translated: Because of this, the appearance of perception conforms to the presence and absence of the object, and because of that, the appearance of the object conforms to the presence and absence of the perception.

original: ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de bzhin du ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de bzhin du ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: And in the same way, that which does not follow the reversal and succession of the object is not a cause.

original: rnam par gtod par nus pa'i rgyu ni yul yin no zhes bya ba 'dis brjod zin to //
analyzed: rnam par gtod par nus pa'i rgyu ni yul yin no zhes bya ba 'dis brjod zin to //
translated: The cause that is able to project is the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de ltar dngos po snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de ltar dngos po snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Imagination does not appear as a thing in that way.

original: de'i ste rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dngos po ste rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ste rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dngos po ste rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of that, i.e., the appearance of imagination, is not in accord with a thing, i.e., with its own characteristic,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not follow the existence or nonexistence of the thing.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di yang / 'di ni brjod med rtogs byed yin //
analyzed: dngos po med kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa mi nyams pa'i phyir ro // 'di yang / 'di ni brjod med rtogs byed yin //
translated: Because the aspect of imagination does not deteriorate even when the thing does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba de'i nang du rgyas par bstan zin to ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i nang du rgyas par bstan zin to ;
translated: This has been extensively explained in the statement:üîΩThis is the cause for the realization of the inexpressible.

original: / dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mngon sum ltar snang ba yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: / dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mngon sum ltar snang ba yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does imagination appear as if it were direct perception because it is not in accord with a thing,

original: nye bar bslad pa yang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa yang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Also, a proximate concealer is like a direct perception.

original: dbang po las skyes pa yin du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa yin du zin kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it arises from a sense faculty, it is not a direct perception.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the reason that it arises from a sense faculty

original: dbang po las skyes pa gzhan las bslad pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa gzhan las bslad pa de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because it is not different from a direct perception.

original: bslad pa ni yid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nye bar bslad pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni dbang po las skyes pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: bslad pa ni yid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nye bar bslad pa gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni dbang po las skyes pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is that not only is a concealer mental, but some proximate concealers arise from a sense faculty.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa yin zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / rnam par bslad pa zhes brjod pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa yin zhe na / bshad pa / rnam par bslad pa zhes brjod pa de las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why does it arise from a sense faculty?üîΩIt is explained that it is not different from a direct perception that arises from a sense faculty other than the one that is the basis of the concealer.

original: khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bslad pa dbang po las skyes pa 'di yang mngon sum ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bslad pa dbang po las skyes pa 'di yang mngon sum ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Because it is not different, this proximate concealer that arises from a sense faculty is like a direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not compatible with things.

original: rnam par bslad ba 'di snang ba dngos po dang mthun pa can ma yin pa de'i phyir snang ba dngos po la mi ltos pas mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bslad ba 'di snang ba dngos po dang mthun pa can ma yin pa de'i phyir snang ba dngos po la mi ltos pas mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: This appearance is not compatible with things, therefore, like a direct perception, it does not rely on things.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a conceptual cognition.

original: skra shad du snang ba dngos po dang mthun par snang ba ma yin du zin kyang dbang po las skyes pa'i bslad pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig zla ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid la skye bar 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skra shad du snang ba dngos po dang mthun par snang ba ma yin du zin kyang dbang po las skyes pa'i bslad pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig zla ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid la skye bar 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even though the appearance of floating hairs is not compatible with things, don‚Äôt you assert that some consciousnesses arisen from the sense faculties are generated in regard to some things, such as the moon?

original: de'i phyir snang ba thams cad dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba thams cad dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin par brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, we say that all appearances are not compatible with things.

original: slu ba'i phyir zhes bshad pa de /
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir zhes bshad pa de /
translated: Because they are deceptive.

original: dper na ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol na dngos po med pa'i phyir skra shad du snang ba'i shes pa la yul 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du zla ba @125b gnyis la sogs par snang ba la yang yul yod pa ma yin
analyzed: dper na ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol na dngos po med pa'i phyir skra shad du snang ba'i shes pa la yul 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du zla ba @125b gnyis la sogs par snang ba la yang yul yod pa ma yin
translated: For example, just as there is no object at all in the cognition of the appearance of falling hair because there is no external thing as it appears, so too there is no object in the appearance of a double moon, etc.

original: te / ji ltar snang ba bzhin du zla ba gnyis dang 'gro ba ljon shing phyi rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / ji ltar snang ba bzhin du zla ba gnyis dang 'gro ba ljon shing phyi rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as it appears, a double moon and a moving tree do not exist externally.

original: de'i phyir rnam par bslad pa'i snang ba slu zhing 'drid pa yin la de las kyang dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par bslad pa'i snang ba slu zhing 'drid pa yin la de las kyang dngos po dang mthun pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of a false, deceptive object is deceptive and misleading, and because of that, it is not in accord with things. Therefore, it is a false direct perception.

original: slu ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba ma yin par brjod pa 'dis rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par bslad pa yang slu ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba ma yin par brjod pa 'dis rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par bslad pa yang slu ba'i phyir dngos po snang ba ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this statement that a thing does not appear because it is deceptive, it is explained that the mental consciousness called dream consciousness is not the appearance of a thing because it is deceptive.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang ba slad pa bsal ba na ha cang thal ba med kyang /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang ba slad pa bsal ba na ha cang thal ba med kyang /
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-erroneous‚Äù excludes the clear and aware consciousnesses that are associated with conceptualization.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du byas pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúfree from conceptualization‚Äù is used to exclude the erroneous consciousnesses.

original: dngos su rnam par rtog pa bzlog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su rnam par rtog pa bzlog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the direct opposite of conceptualization.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs par 'khrul pa ni ji ltar yang dbang pos bskyed ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs par 'khrul pa ni ji ltar yang dbang pos bskyed ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The error of two moons, etc., is not produced by the sense faculty at all.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni yid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni yid yin no //
translated: However, it is the mental faculty.

original: zla ba'i yul la ni grangs 'khrul pa yin zhing /
analyzed: zla ba'i yul la ni grangs 'khrul pa yin zhing /
translated: In the case of the object moon, there is an error of number.

original: mgal me la ni dbyibs 'khrul pa ljon shing la ni bya ba 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: mgal me la ni dbyibs 'khrul pa ljon shing la ni bya ba 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: In the case of a firebrand, there is an error of shape. In the case of a tree, there is an error of action.

original: grangs la sogs pa 'di dag kyang sgro btags kyi spyod yul kho na'o //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa 'di dag kyang sgro btags kyi spyod yul kho na'o //
translated: These errors of number, etc., are the domain of reification.

original: yang 'di dag gi gsal bar snang ba nyid ni dper na smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pa de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes kha cig gis rtogs so //
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi gsal bar snang ba nyid ni dper na smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pa de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes kha cig gis rtogs so //
translated: Some believe that the appearance of these objects is like the appearance of water in a mirage.

original: de ni de ltar rigs pa ma yin ta /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rigs pa ma yin ta /
translated: But that is not logical.üîΩThat which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.üîΩThat which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.üîΩThat which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.

original: dbang po las byung ba dbang po las skyes pa la ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed cing rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba dbang po las skyes pa la ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed cing rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.üîΩThat which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dbang po yod pa dang med pa dag gi rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po las byung ba nyid de nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin la /üîΩgang gi phyir de ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la yang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir yid nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dbang po yod pa dang med pa dag gi rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po las byung ba nyid de nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin la / gang gi phyir de ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la yang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir yid nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.üîΩThat which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic original: gang la gang gi tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yod pa de la ni de'i tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang la gang gi tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yod pa de la ni de'i tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is derived from the sense faculties is the characteristic of that which arises from the sense faculties.üîΩThat

original: dper na dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i rdzas chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i bum pa la bum ba'i tha snyad du byed pa bzhin no //üîΩzla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa la yang dbang po las skyes pa'i tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu mtshan dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i @126a * //üîΩrjes su byed pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i rdzas chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa'i bum pa la bum ba'i tha snyad du byed pa bzhin no // zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa la yang dbang po las skyes pa'i tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu mtshan dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i @126a * // rjes su byed pa yod pa yin no //
translated: For example, the convention ‚Äúpot‚Äù is used for a pot that has the capacity to hold such substances as water that have the particular shape of a pot.

original: rgyu mtshan med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir tha snyad 'jug par bya ba nyid la ni rgyu mtshan yod pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir tha snyad 'jug par bya ba nyid la ni rgyu mtshan yod pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: Also, in the case of the cognition that perceives two moons, there is a reason for using the convention ‚Äúarisen from the sense faculty,‚Äù because it occurs in dependence on the presence or absence of a sense faculty.

original: 'jug par bya ba ma yin na ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can du mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba ma yin na ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can du mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not to be used, then it would depend on another reason, and one would not see it as having that reason alone.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa ltos pa med pa nyid mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa ltos pa med pa nyid mi dmigs pas /
translated: Therefore, in the case of the discordant side, the pervasion is not dependent on the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan nyid de las ldog pa na yod na 'jug par bya ba nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan nyid de las ldog pa na yod na 'jug par bya ba nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because of that reason alone, if it were the opposite, it would be pervaded by being the object of engagement, and so it is a reason of nature.

original: gal te gzhan dbang po las skyes par mi 'dod na dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par 'dod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dbang po las skyes par mi 'dod na dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par 'dod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you do not assert that it arises from the sense faculty, how could you assert that it follows the presence or absence of the sense faculty?

original: dbang po'i byed pa yod pa na mthong ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa yod pa na mthong ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWhen the function of the sense faculty is present, it is seen,‚Äù

original: re zhig dbang po las ni ma 'khrul pa zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa dngos su 'byung la /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po las ni ma 'khrul pa zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa dngos su 'byung la /
translated: then, first, the nonerroneous consciousness that appears as one moon arises from the sense faculty.

original: de las zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba na dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba na dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: When the conception that appears as two moons arises from that, it is conceived to follow the presence or absence of the sense faculty.

original: 'o na zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa de ci'i phyir nyams su ma myong /
analyzed: 'o na zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa de ci'i phyir nyams su ma myong /
translated: Well then, why is the consciousness that appears as one moon not experienced?

original: ci ste nyams su myong na ni ji ltar ma nges /
analyzed: ci ste nyams su myong na ni ji ltar ma nges /
translated: If it is experienced, how could it be uncertain?

original: ma nges par khas len na ni dbang po'i shes pa thams cad la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod par khas blang bar bya ba yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad nges par 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ma nges par khas len na ni dbang po'i shes pa thams cad la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod par khas blang bar bya ba yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad nges par 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If you accept that it is not ascertained, then you must accept that there is some experience of consciousness in all sensory consciousnesses. Therefore, the convention of experience would definitely be destroyed.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa dbang po'i byed pa'i de ma thag pa nyid yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa gnod par byed pa med pas bar du chod pa yin no zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa dbang po'i byed pa'i de ma thag pa nyid yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa gnod par byed pa med pas bar du chod pa yin no zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
translated: How could you say that the consciousness to which two moons appear is the immediate condition of a sense faculty, since it is established by experience and is not undermined?

original: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa med par ni mi slu ba dang bcas par nyams su myong bas nges pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar brjod pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa med par ni mi slu ba dang bcas par nyams su myong bas nges pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar brjod pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that experience with error is not a valid cognition because it is not undermined.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not established that it is mistaken because it is not undermined.

original: rnam 'grel las kyang gnod par byed pa'i rigs pa dam pa med par ni shes pa dus cig car bar nyams su myong bas grub pa spang bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las kyang gnod par byed pa'i rigs pa dam pa med par ni shes pa dus cig car bar nyams su myong bas grub pa spang bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: cognitions is established.üîΩ Suppose one thought that the cognition to which one moon appears is

original: 'di snyam du zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa nyid la de'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas gnyis su sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du zla ba gcig tu snang ba'i shes pa nyid la de'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas gnyis su sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: immediately followed by a conceptual cognition that superimposes two

original: de'i phyir zla ba gcig nyid gsal bar nyams su myong @126b ba na grangs gzhan du sgro btags pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su snang bar zhen pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zla ba gcig nyid gsal bar nyams su myong @126b ba na grangs gzhan du sgro btags pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su snang bar zhen pa yin no zhe na /
translated: moons. Therefore, since the one moon is clearly experienced, the superimposition of two moons is the superimposition of a different number.

original: de ni de ltar shin tu ma 'brel te /üîΩbum pa gcig mthong ba la skyes bus bcur yongs su btags pa na yul tha dad par bum pa bcu'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: de ni de ltar shin tu ma 'brel te / bum pa gcig mthong ba la skyes bus bcur yongs su btags pa na yul tha dad par bum pa bcu'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni med kyi /
translated: This is not at all related to the point.üîΩWhen one person sees one pot and another person superimposes ten,üîΩthere is not the appearance of ten pots as a different object.

original: 'on kyang gcig nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin du snang ba na bcur zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin du snang ba na bcur zhen pa nyid do //
translated: However, when one is clearly experienced, ten are experienced.

original: 'dir ni yul gcig pa spangs nas yul gzhan du kha dog dang dbyibs mtshungs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gzhan nyid du gzung bar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni gcig snang ba na grangs btags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni yul gcig pa spangs nas yul gzhan du kha dog dang dbyibs mtshungs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gzhan nyid du gzung bar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni gcig snang ba na grangs btags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, having abandoned the single object, it appears that another moon-disk is apprehended as having a similar color and shape in another place. Therefore, this is not a case of a single appearance being designated as a plurality.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa 'di ni zla ba gnyis su snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa 'di ni zla ba gnyis su snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Rather, this consciousness is the appearance of two moons.

original: de yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, it does not arise from a sense faculty.

original: dbang po las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir thal ba snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir thal ba snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And whatever arises from a sense faculty, since it is not experienced, the previous absurd consequence would follow.

original: gzhan yang nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad thams cad la yid brtan du med par ma gyur cig ces gzhan la gzhan du nyams su myong ba la ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan du skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad thams cad la yid brtan du med par ma gyur cig ces gzhan la gzhan du nyams su myong ba la ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan du skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the case of the experience of something else as something else, conceptualization does not arise in another way, lest all conventions of experience be rendered unreliable.

original: 'dir dbang po 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dbang po 'khrul pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, you may say that conceptualization changes in another way due to the error of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dngos su skyed par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin na /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dngos su skyed par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin na /
translated: If the consciousness that directly produces the transformation of the sense faculty is not the cause of the transformation,

original: bar du chod pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bar du chod pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can it be obstructed?

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i shes pa skyed par nus na ni de'i dngos su skyed par byed la /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i shes pa skyed par nus na ni de'i dngos su skyed par byed la /
translated: If it is able to produce the consciousness of the transformation, then it is the direct cause.

original: mi nus na yang bar du chod nas kyang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi nus na yang bar du chod nas kyang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: If it is not able to, then even if it is obstructed, it does not produce.

original: bar du chod pa 'gags pa ni 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bar du chod pa 'gags pa ni 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: An obstruction that is blocked is not the cause of anything.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i dngos su skyed pa'i rgyu yin na yang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i dngos su skyed pa'i rgyu yin na yang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Even if the sense consciousness is the direct cause of the conceptual consciousness, it produces a conceptual consciousness of an experienced thing or

original: gsal ba med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba la yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba la yin te /
translated: something like an experience because it is not clear.

original: dper na smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba las de dang 'dra ba'i chu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba las de dang 'dra ba'i chu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the conceptual consciousness of water that arises from apprehending the intrinsic identity of a mirage.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa 'dis ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa 'dis ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba'am /
translated: This grasping at intrinsic identity is the cause of the other two.üîΩ

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i nges pa skyed pa med de /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i nges pa skyed pa med de /
translated: This consciousness that apprehends its own characteristics does not generate a cognition or a certainty that resembles the experience of the object,

original: zla ba gcig ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gcig ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir dang / mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is experienced as one thing but is ascertained as another.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rnam pa 'di ci zhig yin /üîΩgzhan yang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam @127a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rnam pa 'di ci zhig yin / gzhan yang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam @127a * //
translated: Therefore, what is the aspect of the sense consciousness that generates conceptual consciousness?

original: par shes pa ni gsal bar snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: par shes pa ni gsal bar snang ba ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, as explained earlier, a conceptual consciousness does not appear clearly.

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtag tu gsal bar snang bas de ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa can du 'gyur /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni rtag tu gsal bar snang bas de ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa can du 'gyur /
translated: But the consciousness of two moons always appears clearly, so how can it be conceptual?

original: 'o na smig rgyu la chu'i rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na smig rgyu la chu'i rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how can a mirage appear clearly as water?

original: gsal bar snang ba ni ma yin gyi smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa dang dngos po 'dra ba'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa cig car 'jug pa na snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa'i don
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba ni ma yin gyi smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa dang dngos po 'dra ba'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa cig car 'jug pa na snang ba dang rnam par brtags pa'i don
translated: The object that appears and the object that is imagined

original: dag gcig tu byas nas gsal bar snang bar 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: dag gcig tu byas nas gsal bar snang bar 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: are conflated and mistakenly appear to be clear.

original: 'dis ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur rnam par rtog pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur rnam par rtog pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the conception of a jewel in the light of a jewel.

original: de ltar 'dir ni khyed la dbang po las skyes pa zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin pas na gang gis na lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la don tha dad pa med par sgro 'dogs pa
analyzed: de ltar 'dir ni khyed la dbang po las skyes pa zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin pas na gang gis na lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la don tha dad pa med par sgro 'dogs pa
translated: Thus here for you, since there is no clear appearance of a consciousness of two moons that arises from a sense faculty, by what means would a conceptual consciousness that simultaneously engages an object impute the nonexistence of a difference in objects

original: gsal ba nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: and mistakenly appear to be clear?

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i byed pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du byung bar nyams su myong ba gsal bar snang ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid do zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i byed pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du byung bar nyams su myong ba gsal bar snang ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid do zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the moon, etc., which is experienced as the immediate antecedent of the activity of the sense faculty, is the cognition that arises from the sense faculty.

original: gzhan yang zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang por 'gyur na 'gyur bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang por 'gyur na 'gyur bar mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the moon, etc., is seen to conform to the sense faculty.

original: des na 'gyur ba'i phyir de dbang po las skyes pa ma yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na 'gyur ba'i phyir de dbang po las skyes pa ma yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it does not arise from the sense faculty because it conforms to it.

original: gal te dbang por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa yin yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dbang por 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa yin yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it conforms to the sense faculty but does not arise from the sense faculty, what is wrong with that?

original: 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa ste /
translated: What is the reason that it conforms to the sense faculty?

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rten te brten par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: rten te brten par 'jog pa ste /
translated: It is the basis, that is, the support.

original: rnam par 'jog cing tha snyad du byed pa gang yin pa de'i rten de'i rgyu mtshan ni de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog cing tha snyad du byed pa gang yin pa de'i rten de'i rgyu mtshan ni de yin no //
translated: That is the basis, that is the reason for the designation and the conventional expression that is established and posited.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan la yang brten pa nyid kyi tha snyad kyi rgyu ni de nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dir yang rgyu yod pa na tha snyad 'jug par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan la yang brten pa nyid kyi tha snyad kyi rgyu ni de nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dir yang rgyu yod pa na tha snyad 'jug par bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the cause of the convention of dependence is just that for another consciousness arisen from the sense faculty, therefore, when the cause exists here, the convention is to be applied.

original: de'i sbyor ba'i tshul ni sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba'i tshul ni sngar brjod zin to //
translated: The method of its application has been stated previously.

original: sbrul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dbang po'i 'gyur pa yod kyang ldog par zla par 'gyur te /üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba log kyang ste /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba dbang po'i 'gyur pa yod kyang ldog par zla par 'gyur te / thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba log kyang ste /
translated: Just as the error of a snake, etc., so the transformation of the sense faculty, although it exists, would be reversed when the sense faculty is reversed.üîΩAnd just so, although the transformation of the sense faculty is reversed, i.e., although it does not exist, it would not be reversed.

original: med kyang mi ldog par thal te thal ba @127b 'dis kyang yid las skyes pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: med kyang mi ldog par thal te thal ba @127b 'dis kyang yid las skyes pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: By this reductio, it is not reasonable that it be born from the mind.

original: gang zhig yid las skyes pa de ni dbang por 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yid las skyes pa de ni dbang por 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is born from the mind does not follow the transformation of the sense faculty and does not follow its reversal.

original: dper na sbrul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the error of a snake.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang yid las skyes pa yin no //üîΩde rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid la ni dbang po las skyes pa'i tha snyad du rung bas khyab pa yin te /üîΩtha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang yid las skyes pa yin no // de rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid la ni dbang po las skyes pa'i tha snyad du rung bas khyab pa yin te / tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of two moons and so on is also born from the mind.üîΩThe reason is contradictory because it is established that the pervasion is contradicted by the fact that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.

original: yid las skyes pa nyid kyang de dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yid las skyes pa nyid kyang de dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.

original: thal ba bzlog pa ni gang zhig dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni yid las skyes pa ma yin te /üîΩdper na sngon po la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thal ba bzlog pa ni gang zhig dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni yid las skyes pa ma yin te / dper na sngon po la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.üîΩThe pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of two moons and so on is born from the mind.

original: sbyor ba 'di ni 'gal bas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ni 'gal bas khyab pa yin no //
translated: The pervasion is contradicted because it is established that the cognition of

original: sbyor ba gnyi ga'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ni dbang po las byung ba'i tha snyad sgrub par gtan la phab ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyi ga'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ni dbang po las byung ba'i tha snyad sgrub par gtan la phab ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The relation of the pervaded and the pervader between the two applications is established by the immediately preceding proof of the establishment of the convention of the sense faculties.

original: yan lag can gcig nyid de dang / nam mkha' dma' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par dpyad pas kyang mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can gcig nyid de dang / nam mkha' dma' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par dpyad pas kyang mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not the conception of a single whole and of the nearness of space, etc., not averted by the analysis?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang yid kyi shes pa 'khrul pa ni rnam par dpyad pas ldog par 'u ro zhes bya ba'i slob dpon gyis bzhed pa'i don 'di yongs su bzung nas skyon 'di spang ngo //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang yid kyi shes pa 'khrul pa ni rnam par dpyad pas ldog par 'u ro zhes bya ba'i slob dpon gyis bzhed pa'i don 'di yongs su bzung nas skyon 'di spang ngo //
translated: Although this is true, still, the master BhƒÅviveka, having accepted the meaning asserted by the master Uddyotakara, that the error of mental consciousness is averted by analysis, rejects this fault.

original: 'di la yid kyi 'khrul pa 'ga' zhig ni mthong ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yid kyi 'khrul pa 'ga' zhig ni mthong ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, some errors of mental consciousness follow the aspect of seeing.

original: dper na gru bzhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gru bzhi la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the error of shape in a square, etc.

original: kha cig ni mthong ba la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni mthong ba la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: Some do not depend on seeing.

original: dper na sbrul la sogs par 'khrul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrul la sogs par 'khrul ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the error of a snake, etc.

original: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni thag pa mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni thag pa mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The delusion of a snake is not subsequent to seeing the rope.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i rgyu rnams mi gsal ba na de 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i rgyu rnams mi gsal ba na de 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The error of a snake does not follow the seeing of the rope, but it does arise from the indistinctness of the causes of seeing.

original: de las gang zhig rtag tu mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de ni rnam par dpyad pas mi ldog la /
analyzed: de las gang zhig rtag tu mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de ni rnam par dpyad pas mi ldog la /
translated: And that which always follows the seeing is not averted by investigation.

original: nam mkha' dma' ba dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dma' ba dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: The imagination of space, of a whole substance, etc., is of that nature.

original: gang yang blta bar bya ba'i dngos po snang ba ni mi gsal ba 'ga' zhig las ma nges pa na 'dra ba'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa 'jug pa de ni mthong @128a * //
analyzed: gang yang blta bar bya ba'i dngos po snang ba ni mi gsal ba 'ga' zhig las ma nges pa na 'dra ba'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa 'jug pa de ni mthong @128a * //
translated: And when the thing to be seen is indistinctly illuminated, the superimposition of a similar thing is applied when it is not ascertained.

original: ba'i dngos po la ji zhig ltar dpyad pa las nges pa na ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i dngos po la ji zhig ltar dpyad pa las nges pa na ldog pa yin no //
translated: But when it is ascertained by some sort of investigation of the thing seen, it is averted.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i rjes su rtag tu 'brang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang zla ba gnyis mthong ba'i rjes su rtag tu 'brang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: And the cognition of a double moon, etc., does not always follow the seeing of a double moon, etc.,

original: 'on kyang rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba'i zla ba la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las gzhan du 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba'i zla ba la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las gzhan du 'jug pa yin la /
translated: But the moon seen in another way is engaged in something other than the reason.

original: de la rnam par dpyad pa las zla ba gcig tu nges par gtan la phebs pa na nges par ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: de la rnam par dpyad pa las zla ba gcig tu nges par gtan la phebs pa na nges par ldog pa yin na /
translated: When one ascertains the moon as one through analysis, one definitely turns away from it.

original: ma log pa de'i phyir 'di ni yid las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma log pa de'i phyir 'di ni yid las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: But since one does not turn away from it, it is not a mental creation.

original: gang zhig zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin yang rnam par mi rtog cing gsal bar snang ba'i rmi lam gyi shes pa bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba nyid do zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin yang rnam par mi rtog cing gsal bar snang ba'i rmi lam gyi shes pa bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba nyid do zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs
translated: One might say that although the second moon and so on are not born from the sense faculties, nonconceptual and clear appearances are like the consciousness in a dream. But it is not necessary to refute them.üîΩThat is not so.

original: te / rmi lam gyi shes pa la ni yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid med pa de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / rmi lam gyi shes pa la ni yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid med pa de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a correct consciousness does not exist in the dream consciousness, it is refuted by the fact that it is based on that.

original: gang zhig yang dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa dang rtog pa med pa de la ni ma 'khrul pa smos pa med na mngon sum nyid du dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa ni de'i don du smos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yang dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa dang rtog pa med pa de la ni ma 'khrul pa smos pa med na mngon sum nyid du dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa ni de'i don du smos par bya ba yin te /
translated: If something is asserted to be right knowledge and it is nonconceptual, then since it is not even mentioned to be non mistaken, there is doubt that it is direct perception, so non mistaken is mentioned for that purpose.

original: dper na dung la ser por shes pa bzlog pa'i don yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dung la ser por shes pa bzlog pa'i don yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is for the purpose of countering the cognition of a conch as yellow.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, why is it called a dream consciousness?

original: smras pa / rtsod pa pos rmi lam gyi shes pa rtog pa med pa log pa'i shes pa dang / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid mthong zhing gnyi ga yang bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par mi rigs pas na de ci'i don du byas snyam du sems pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / rtsod pa pos rmi lam gyi shes pa rtog pa med pa log pa'i shes pa dang / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid mthong zhing gnyi ga yang bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos par mi rigs pas na de ci'i don du byas snyam du sems pa na /
translated: The opponent sees that a dream consciousness is a nonconceptual mistaken consciousness and that a consciousness of two moons and so on is a correct consciousness, and since it is illogical to mention non mistaken for the purpose of countering both, one might think, for what purpose is it mentioned?

original: gang zhig ma 'khrul pas bzlog pa de nyid 'dri ba yin la slob dpon gyis ni yang dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa'i dbang po las skyes pa 'ga' zhig log pa'i shes pa nyid dang / de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa yang gdon mi za bar bya dgos par gzigs nas ma 'khrul zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'khrul pas bzlog pa de nyid 'dri ba yin la slob dpon gyis ni yang dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa'i dbang po las skyes pa 'ga' zhig log pa'i shes pa nyid dang / de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa yang gdon mi za bar bya dgos par gzigs nas ma 'khrul zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] saw that it is necessary to state ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù in order to indicate that some cognition arisen from a sense faculty that is asserted to be correct is itself a mistaken consciousness and that it is necessary to state ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù in order to reverse that.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po las skyes par 'thad pas bsgrubs pa mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po las skyes par 'thad pas bsgrubs pa mjug sdud de /
translated: Therefore, since it is tenable that it is arisen from a sense faculty, the master concludes:

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid kyis ma 'khrul pa smos pas bsal ba'i 'khrul pa 'di la ni dbang po las skyes kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid kyis ma 'khrul pa smos pas bsal ba'i 'khrul pa 'di la ni dbang po las skyes kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this mistaken consciousness that is eliminated by stating ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù is, although arisen from a sense faculty, a seeming direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa ni dbang po las skyes kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa ni dbang po las skyes kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is because a mistake is a seeming direct perception, although arisen from a sense faculty.

original: rgyu des na /
analyzed: rgyu des na /
translated: For that reason,

original: dran dang 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran dang 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: it is memory and desire.

original: @128b zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig 'dis /
analyzed: @128b zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig 'dis /
translated: By this statement, which is completely fulfilled,

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi sde tshan te /
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi sde tshan te /
translated: the class of conceptual thoughts, such as ‚Äúmistakenness,‚Äù ‚Äúconventional knowledge,‚Äù

original: tshoms las logs shig tu ste /
analyzed: tshoms las logs shig tu ste /
translated: is separate from the collection,

original: tha dad par rnam par gcad de so sor byas nas so //
analyzed: tha dad par rnam par gcad de so sor byas nas so //
translated: that is, it is distinguished and made individual.

original: rab rib kyi rgyu mtshan gyis mtshon pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las skyes pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba yang yod pa de'i phyir rab rib smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: rab rib kyi rgyu mtshan gyis mtshon pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las skyes pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba yang yod pa de'i phyir rab rib smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: There is also a semblance of direct perception that arises from another cause, as illustrated by the cause of eye disease. Therefore, the mention of eye disease is an illustration.

original: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rab rib kyis mtshon pa mngon sum ltar snang bar slob dpon phyogs kyi blang pos gsungs so //
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rab rib kyis mtshon pa mngon sum ltar snang bar slob dpon phyogs kyi blang pos gsungs so //
translated: By the phrase ‚Äúwith eye disease,‚Äù the master Dignaga states that the semblance of direct perception is illustrated by eye disease.

original: gzhan du na rab rib las byung ba yang rnam par rtog pa yin na ni 'khrul pa smos pa kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir logs shig tu byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rab rib las byung ba yang rnam par rtog pa yin na ni 'khrul pa smos pa kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir logs shig tu byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if that which arises from eye disease were a conceptual thought, then since it would be included by the mere mention of ‚Äúmistakenness,‚Äù making it separate would be pointless.

original: ji ltar ji ltar yang rung bar logs shig tu byed na ni smra ba bo mi mkhas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar yang rung bar logs shig tu byed na ni smra ba bo mi mkhas par 'gyur la /
translated: If one were to make a distinction in any way whatsoever, then the speaker would be unskillful.

original: dbye ba brjod par khas len na yang thug pa med par thal lo //
analyzed: dbye ba brjod par khas len na yang thug pa med par thal lo //
translated: And if one were to accept the expression of a distinction, then it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir rab rib ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba gzhan rnams kyis nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab rib ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba gzhan rnams kyis nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
translated: Therefore, as with nonconceptual mistaken direct perception, the example of eye disease illustrates the other nonconceptual mistaken forms of valid cognition.

original: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di la /
translated: The definition of direct perception is that it is free from conceptuality.

original: 'di ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is an exception to that.

original: 'dir dmigs kyis bsal ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'dir dmigs kyis bsal ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúexception‚Äù is used.üîΩThe meaning of the expression ‚Äúexception‚Äù is this:

original: rab rib la sogs pa las byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum mo zhes rab rib las skyes pa la sogs pa dmigs kyis bsal bar bstan pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pa las byung ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum mo zhes rab rib las skyes pa la sogs pa dmigs kyis bsal bar bstan pa'i don du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception is that which is free from conceptuality, with the exception of that which arises from eye disease and so on.‚Äù The point of teaching the exception of that which arises from eye disease and so on is this.

original: des na rab rib las skyes pa ltar 'khrul par ma gyur pa'i rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes yul 'dis spang ba'i don du mtshan nyid kyi lhag ma dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rab rib las skyes pa ltar 'khrul par ma gyur pa'i rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes yul 'dis spang ba'i don du mtshan nyid kyi lhag ma dpag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is not a conception that has become erroneous, like that which arises from cataracts, is perception. The remainder of the definition should be inferred in order to exclude objects.

original: de'i phyir ji lta ji ltar yang rung bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las rab rib las byung ba la sogs pa logs su byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji lta ji ltar yang rung bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las rab rib las byung ba la sogs pa logs su byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the class of conceptions is divided into those that arise from cataracts and so on by some other means.

original: tshad ma kun las btus par mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bsgrub pa las gzhan rtsod pa bsgrub par yang mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag rnams zla ba gnyis dang / sngon po la sogs pa de dag gang la snang ba'i shes pa de'i rgyu yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus par mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bsgrub pa las gzhan rtsod pa bsgrub par yang mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag rnams zla ba gnyis dang / sngon po la sogs pa de dag gang la snang ba'i shes pa de'i rgyu yin par gsungs so //
translated: In the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, in the proof of the definition of perception, the opponent‚Äôs position is proven to be that the atoms of the eye and so on are the cause of the consciousness to which two moons and so on appear.

original: de las ni gal te ji ltar yod pa rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i shes pa'i yang rgyu yin pa de ltar de dag yul yin na de lta na ni 'o na mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang zla ba gnyis su snang ba @129a *
analyzed: de las ni gal te ji ltar yod pa rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i shes pa'i yang rgyu yin pa de ltar de dag yul yin na de lta na ni 'o na mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang zla ba gnyis su snang ba @129a *
translated: If they are objects in the way that they are causes of consciousness appearing in other ways, then the atoms of the eye and so on would be objects.üîΩ

original: // dang ; sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i yul nyid du thal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // dang ; sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i yul nyid du thal par 'gyur te /
translated: If the object is the cause of the consciousness that appears in a different aspect, then it follows that the atoms of the eye and so on are the object of the appearance of two moons and blue and so on,

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because they are the cause.

original: mngon sum gyi yul brtag pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams de nyid la yul gyi dngos por ha cang thal bar 'thad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul brtag pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams de nyid la yul gyi dngos por ha cang thal bar 'thad pa yin gyi /
translated: The analysis of the object of direct perception is correct in the context of the atoms of the eye and so on being the object of direct perception,

original: yid kyi shes pa'i yul gyi dngos por ni ma yin pa'i phyir na yid kyi shes pa la ltos nas de skad brjod do zhes ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa'i yul gyi dngos por ni ma yin pa'i phyir na yid kyi shes pa la ltos nas de skad brjod do zhes ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not possible to say that the atoms of the eye and so on are the object of mental perception, because they are not the object of mental perception.

original: des na de ltar mngon sum gyi dbye ba dang mtshan nyid dang / spyod yul la log par rtogs pa bsal nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar mngon sum gyi dbye ba dang mtshan nyid dang / spyod yul la log par rtogs pa bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having in this way cleared away misconceptions about the divisions, characteristics, and objects of direct perception,

original: 'bras bu tshad ma las tha dad do zhes 'bras bu las log par rtogs pa bsal bar bzhed nas gang yin zhes 'dri bar rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshad ma las tha dad do zhes 'bras bu las log par rtogs pa bsal bar bzhed nas gang yin zhes 'dri bar rtsom mo //
translated: The word what? is used to indicate that the result is not different from the valid cognition, and to dispel the notion that the result is something other than the valid cognition.

original: 'di'i ni bshad ma thag pa'o //üîΩthob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i ni bshad ma thag pa'o // thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: The answer is the one just given.üîΩThe valid cognition is that which causes the attainment.

original: gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i don thob par byed pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i don thob par byed pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of that is the attainment of the object that must be attained.

original: de yang rang bzhin gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of that?

original: gzhal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The word object and so on is used.

original: don rtogs na 'jug la des las kyang thob pa de'i phyir don rtogs pa'i bya ba ni don thob pa'i bya ba yin pas gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu ni de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rtogs na 'jug la des las kyang thob pa de'i phyir don rtogs pa'i bya ba ni don thob pa'i bya ba yin pas gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu ni de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
